infotexts.missionsuccess.escort4: Personnel transport successful, and the terrorists have been dealt with.
infotexts.missionfailure.escort4: Escorted personnel did not reach their destination, or the terrorists were not uncovered and neutralized.
infotexts.missionmessage0.escort4: Too many of the escorted personnel have perished at sea. The mission is a failure.
infotexts.missionmessage1.escort4: Looks like that was the last of the terrorists. Navigate the submarine to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.missionmessage0.pirate1: Neutralize the crew or sink the submarine to the bottom of the sea!
infotexts.missionmessage1.pirate1: Navigate the submarine to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.missiondescription.killmopingjack: Captain Hognose has recruited you to help him kill his old nemesis, Moping Jack the Hammerhead.
infotexts.missionmessage0.killmopingjack: Moping Jack is dead. All that remains is to claim the reward.
infotexts.missiondescription.killcrawlerswarm1larg: A large swarm of crawlers has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] marks has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it.
infotexts.missiondescription.killcrawlerswarm1huge: A huge swarm of crawlers has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] marks has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it.
infotexts.missiondescription.killspinelingswarm1: A small swarm of Spinelings has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] marks has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it.
infotexts.missiondescription.killlargecrawler: An especially large crawler has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] marks has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it.
infotexts.missionmessage0.killlargecrawler: The crawler is terminated. Reach the next station to claim the reward.
infotexts.missiondescription.miningmission1: There's been talk of deposits of [resourcename1] along the way from [location1] to [location2]. Bring back [resourcequantity1] samples of [resourcename1] to verify these claims. You are expected to hand over [handoverpercentage].
infotexts.missionmessage0.miningmission1: You have mined enough [resourcename1]. Bring it to an outpost to claim the reward.
infotexts.missionsuccess.miningmission1: The existence of the [resourcename1] deposits has been successfully proven.
infotexts.missiondescription.miningmission2: There's been talk of deposits of [resourcename1] and [resourcename2] along the way from [location1] to [location2]. Bring back [resourcequantity1] samples of [resourcename1] and [resourcename2] to verify these claims. You are expected to hand over [handoverpercentage].
infotexts.missionmessage0.miningmission2: You have mined enough [resourcename1] and [resourcename2]. Bring it to an outpost to claim the reward.
infotexts.missionsuccess.miningmission2: The existence of the [resourcename1] and [resourcename2] deposits has been successfully proven.
infotexts.missiondescription.miningmission1_abyss: There's been talk of deposits of [resourcename1] in the abyssal depths between [location1] and [location2]. Bring back [resourcequantity1] samples of [resourcename1] to verify these claims. You are expected to hand over [handoverpercentage].
infotexts.missionmessage0.miningmission1_abyss: You have mined enough [resourcename1]. Bring it to an outpost to claim the reward.
infotexts.missionsuccess.miningmission1_abyss: The existence of the rare [resourcename1] deposits has been successfully proven.
infotexts.traitor.blamebutton.tooltip: At the end of the round, if the majority of players have correctly suspected the traitor, the traitor fails their objective and will not receive any rewards (such as getting to steal experience points or portions of the mission reward).
infotexts.traitor.blamebutton.dialog: I think [name] might be trying to sabotage our mission…
I have a feeling [name] is a traitor…
[name] is acting kinda sus, right crew? Right…?
What are you up to, [name]? Something is off…
[name], you traitorous scum. I do not trust you!
What shady business have you gotten yourself into, [name]?
What nefarious plan is occupying you, [name]?
[name] is not working toward our mission objective. Do they have some hidden agenda?
infotexts.traitor.blameresult: The crew suspected [name] as a traitor!
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.correct.objectivesuc: The crew's suspicions were correct. Since the traitor was exposed, they will not receive any rewards from whoever assigned them the traitorous task, even though they successfully completed it.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.correct.objectivefai: The crew's suspicions were correct. Luckily, the traitor failed to complete their task.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.failure: The crew's suspicions turned out to be incorrect, and the traitor may still be at large.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.failure.penalty: The crew has received a fine of [money] marks for wasting the official's time with the false accusations.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage1: By equipping the bomb and a screwdriver, one could remove a panel.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage2: Wires are exposed. A skilled weapon-user could defuse this by equipping the bomb and a sharp tool like a knife.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage3: It looks like a nuke with a text display and some wires strapped to it. It has been defused.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevelsetting.tooltip: How dangerous the traitor objectives can be. If, for example, you're playing the campaign mode and don't want players to get assigned traitor objectives that would seriously harm the crew's progress, you might want to choose a low danger level.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevel.2.description: Might result in injuries and/or damage to the submarine.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevel.3.description: High chance of causing injuries or even casualties.
infotexts.traitor.probability.tooltip: The probability of some players getting assigned traitor objectives during a round.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.c1: You are angry. Enraged, even. The constant stress of being confined to your metal coffin is taking its toll on you, and you know it. You have to take out that anger somewhere on something… The beacon station you're supposed to visit might have a nuclear reactor that could be overloaded, causing a huge explosion and radiation to harm those Jove-forsaken crawlers and mudraptors for a long time to come. Your hand stops shaking for the first time in days. You know now: It is what you have to do.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective1: Cause a nuclear meltdown at the beacon station's nuclear reactor.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective2: The beacon station has been burnt to a crisp!
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective3: No beacon station meltdown has been observed.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.c1: Right before you entered the submarine through the station's airlock, you found a shady-looking figure standing in the shadows. He gave you a crooked smile, and said: “Your wallet looks awfully light after the shore leave, eh? Want to do something about that? You see, the cargo you're transporting… The recipients are very desperate for that cargo. They pay good money. Now, if that cargo arrives, they're no longer desperate, no longer paying good money. See where I am going with this? If some cargo were to go missing, it might profit both of us.”\n\nNow you're still wondering whether or not to take the money. It's dirty, but marks are marks.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective1: Ensure at least half of the cargo that's part of the transport mission doesn't make it to the destination.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective2: The cargo is no longer on the submarine. Looks like you're getting paid while your crew is getting played.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective3: To the dismay of your crew and the receiving party, the cargo was nowhere to be found.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective4: When the time came to unload the cargo, your crew found out most of the items were missing. The client is not pleased.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective5: You've failed to get rid of enough cargo.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective6: The cargo was found on board the submarine, despite a risk of betrayal.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.c1: A burly figure leans in the doorframe, blocking your way. You're already late, having just heard the call to get back to your submarine ASAP—what could he possibly want? He has a scowl on his face, but does not seem to be threatening you.\n\n“Hear me out,” he starts. “I oversee mining operations around here, and to put it frankly, your mining mission is going to cut into my profits. Not your problem, you could say, but I say: business opportunity. Cause a few malfunctions in your plasma cutters, and I'll see you're paid more than your mission's cut would be.”
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective1: Disrupt the mining efforts by swapping oxygen tanks in 50% of the plasma cutters for welding fuel tanks.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.c2: This should scare the crew off from future mining operations, which will make your employer happy.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective2: The plasma cutters have been sabotaged. Fingers crossed that nobody actually dies.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective3: The sabotage has been carried out successfully.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective4: The sabotage did not meet the requirements.
infotexts.traitorobjective.miningsabotage.swapobje: Swap welding fuel tanks into 50% of the plasma cutters
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture.c1: In the latest edition of The Europan magazine, you read about a hot new craze: pet mudraptors. How cool would it be if you could hatch and train a mudraptor from birth to be your loyal ally? Your captain wouldn't dare refuse your requests for a pay raise after that. And it just so happens that you might have a perfect chance to get yourself a fresh mudraptor egg!
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture.objective1: Obtain a mudraptor egg from the nest and bring it into the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c1: In the latest edition of The Europan magazine, you read about a hot new craze: pet mudraptors. How cool would it be if you could hatch and train a mudraptor from birth to be your loyal ally? Your captain wouldn't dare refuse your requests for a pay raise after that. Now, it just so happens the beacon station here was destroyed by mudraptors, and they may have left an egg behind. You better volunteer to fix that station and find the egg!
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.objecti: Obtain a mudraptor egg from the beacon station and bring it into the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c2: You found a mudraptor's egg! Now to sneak it back to the submarine unseen…
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c3: You've obtained an egg. Better keep it safe for now.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.objecti: A mudraptor egg has been brought to the submarine. Keep it safe from deconstructors.
A mudraptor egg has been collected. Maybe it will hatch into a beautiful and loyal pet one day?
A mudraptor egg has found its way onto the submarine.
No mudraptor eggs have been brought and kept safe on the submarine.
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture.findmud: Find and obtain a mudraptor egg
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture.obtainm: Bring a mudraptor egg to the submarine
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c1: A one-armed wretch of a man has sold you a guide titled “Mudraptor Pets 101.” It is far from professional—in fact it's all written on some crusty old bandages—but he insisted he has experience in raising mudraptors as pets.\n\nAccording to the guide, the first minutes after hatching are crucial. If they get a taste of human flesh during this period, they'll forever crave more, so this should be avoided at all costs.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective1: You want to hatch a mudraptor and train it as a pet. According to the instructions, you need to inject a mudraptor egg with saline, wait until it hatches and then ensure the mudraptor lives long enough to really experience pet ownership. A mudraptor egg has already been stashed away in a loose vent.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective2: You've obtained the egg. Next step is to hatch it with [catalystitem] in a safe place.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c2: The egg bulges and makes strange noises… You're about to become a parent!
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c3: The egg has hatched! Keep the abyss-puppy alive for [time] minutes.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective3: The egg has hatched. Now make sure the mudraptor hatchling doesn't get killed for [time] minutes.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c4: Your dream of having your own pet mudraptor was shot to pieces by the reality of Europa. It is an unforgiving moon, and weakness has no place here.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c5: You have followed the instructions to the letter, so the mudraptor should be trainable as an obedient pet now, right?
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective7: Your mudraptor hatchling has survived long enough. You feel proud of your accomplishment, no matter what happens next.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective8: Inject a mudraptor egg with saline, wait until it hatches and then ensure the baby mudraptor lives long enough to really experience pet ownership.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective9: The mudraptor hatchling lived as long as required.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective10: The mudraptor hatchling didn't live long enough.
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture2.retrie: Retrieve the mudraptor egg from its hiding spot
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture2.hatche: Hatch the egg in a safe spot
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.c1: People often get more honest when under the influence of alcohol, and yesterday was no exception. Although your head is spinning and parts of the night are missing from memory, you remember the comments of one crewmember rubbing you the wrong way, and not just you. While you can't exactly recall who insulted whom, the drunk version of you left behind a note: “Codeword: [codeword].” Perhaps this will help with identifying like-minded folk?
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.c2: Some of your memory from last night is slowly returning—you seem to recall it was [victim] spewing vile words to multiple crewmates. Time to teach [victim] a little lesson on slander and smear campaigns.
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.objective1: Ensure the majority of crewmembers will accuse the target of being a traitor. With everyone's memories a bit hazy, only a co-conspirator might remember the name of the target. A note saying “Codeword: [codeword]” could help you.
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.objective2: Your memory tells you [victim] is the one bad-mouthing other crewmembers. Let your fellow conspirators and the rest of the crew know they're not to be trusted. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify the co-conspirators.
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.objective3: The reputation of the target has been successfully ruined.
infotexts.EventText.adhominem.objective4: The crew did not agree the target was a traitor. Their reputation remains intact.
infotexts.traitorobjective.adhominem.accuse: Get your target accused of being a traitor
infotexts.traitorobjective.adhominem.victimknown: Ensure people know who the target is
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.c1: “You step into the forest clearing…roll for initiative,” said the GM. The appropriately costumed party members looked at each other in concern.\n“Not again…” exclaimed the rogue. “A one…oh dear.”\n“Goblin children appear at the tree lines all around you, and their bows sing: ‘Thwang, thwang.’”
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.o1: Roll for dexterity at a disadvantage.
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.o1.c1: “Party-wiped by goblin children again,” sighed the warlock. “We need to grow stronger. We must understand our enemies and, to do that, think like our enemies.” And thus, a plan has formed: You will roleplay as goblins. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow goblins.
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.objective1: Roleplay as ballast goblins. Ensure all ballast tanks are painted green and all goblins are in a ballast tank. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow goblins.
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.c2: You've gained valuable insight into the psyche of a (ballast) goblin, which will surely prove to be invaluable the next time you encounter a horde of greenskins.
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.objective2: Roleplay as ballast goblins. Ensure all ballast tanks are painted green and all goblins are in a ballast tank.
infotexts.EventText.goblinhorde.objective4: The goblins were too green to accomplish their task (read: inexperienced).
infotexts.traitorobjective.goblinhorde.occupation: Occupy ballast tanks for five minutes straight
infotexts.traitorobjective.goblinhorde.occupation_: Get every goblin in a ballast tank
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.c1:
“How about we throw a heckin' big party?” one of you said.
“Yeah!”someone replied. “But it's gotta be a surprise until we're ready.”
“Let's call it ‘Project: [codeword],’” another anonymous voice on the terminal suggested. 

You don't know who your fellow planners are, yet, but they're probably the coolest kids on the crew.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.c2: As luck would have it, you have a banner that'd work perfectly as a party decoration. Designate the party room by attaching the banner on a wall.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.objective1: Ensure that preparations for a big party, called “Project: [codeword],” are completed. Nobody should enter the designated party room until the preparations are complete. The party planners are anonymous, but mentioning [codeword] will help with coordinating the planning.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.objective2: Designate a party room using party decorations.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.c3: The party room has been designated. Now, time to find some drinks for the party. One can have booze without fun, but not the other way around, right? A bottle of ethanol per guest should do.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.objective3: Gather enough ethanol in the party room to get everyone drunk.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.objective4: Ensure there's music by bringing an instrument to the party room. An instrument has been stashed in a loose vent, but any instrument will do.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.c4: The drinks have been taken care of, but we need music! Find an instrument of some sort and bring it to the party room. One instrument had been smuggled aboard and stashed in a loose vent somewhere, but any instrument will do.
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.objective5: Party lighting. There has to be suitable red-colored lighting. Red room rave!
infotexts.EventText.partypreparations.c5: Now we've got drinks and music, but how about some party lighting? Make the lighting in the party room red. Red room rave!
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c1:
“Well well well, it seems we have a murder mystery on our hands,” you mutter while looking at the mangled corpse of a crawler.
“No we don't,” replied a crewmember. “Crawler lives don't count. We should murder an assistant or something, present the crew with a real murder mystery.”

While it seems like a rather psychopathic thing to say, you do think giving the crew some relief from their dreary routines is worth sacrificing one crewmember. After all, a lack of motivation could get the entire crew killed.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c2: You are part of creating a murder mystery. To make the murder very mysterious, nobody knows the full details.\nThere are three accomplices, who are not known to each other. One knows the victim, one knows the murder weapon, and one knows which of the accomplices is supposed to do the murder.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.objective1: Set up a murder mystery. Information about the mystery—the murderer, the victim, and the weapon—is split among three accomplices. The murderer is one of the accomplices. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify your accomplices.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c3: You know who the murderer is: it's [murderer]. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify your accomplices.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c4: You know who the murder victim is: it's [victim]. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify your accomplices.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c5: You know the weapon to use: There's a special [weapon] hidden somewhere in the submarine. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify your accomplices.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.objective2: A murder has been committed—now the crew can play detective and hopefully be not very good at it.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.c7: The victim has died, but wasn't killed with the correct murder weapon, by the correct murderer. The murder mystery has failed.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.objective3: Set up a murder mystery. Information about the mystery—the murderer, the victim, and the weapon—is split among three accomplices. The identities of the accomplices are part of the mystery, but the murderer is one of them.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.objective4: The murder mystery was very mysterious indeed.
infotexts.EventText.murdermystery.objective5: Here's a clue: The murder mystery sucked.
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.c1: “The plebs have been growing unruly as of late, and we are lacking in certain peacekeeping tools. Perhaps for a reward, you could craft some on your submarine? You've probably got too many resources stockpiled, anyway—time to clear some of those cabinets.”
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.objective1: Use the fabricator to craft [number] handcuffs.
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.c2: You have created enough handcuffs to resupply the Coalition.
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.objective2: There's enough newly crafted handcuffs. Now you need to ensure they reach their destination.
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.objective3: The Coalition has been provided an ample supply of handcuffs.
infotexts.EventText.handcuffshortage.objective4: There weren't enough handcuffs aboard the submarine to meet the Coalition's needs.
infotexts.EventText.compoundnowhere.c1: Just as you enter the submarine, your headset emits some static noises. When you're about to check whether or not it's damaged, you hear a voice: \n“Listen carefully. You're transporting high explosive materials to be used in a terrorist attack on civilians. Remember, the Coalition is kind to those who help us.”
infotexts.EventText.compoundnowhere.objective1: Ensure the weapons from the Arms Delivery mission are no longer on the submarine when it docks.
infotexts.EventText.compoundnowhere.objective2: The explosives have been disposed of. As long as they stay gone, the Coalition will be pleased.
infotexts.EventText.compoundnowhere.objective3: The explosives were delivered to the separatists.
infotexts.EventText.compoundnowhere.objective4: To the dismay of your crew and the separatists, the explosives were nowhere to be found.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.c1: “A certain activist you're transporting is actually responsible for the bombing of Dank Station. We want the separatist scum to know what it is like to be caught in the blast. It's the one with the fancy hat who calls himself a captain.”
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective1: Blow up the VIP you're escorting, an alleged separatist bomber, using a supplied detonator and C-4.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective2: First, find the detonator and C-4 in a loose vent.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective3: Detonate the C-4 near the VIP.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective4: Kaboom. Your task has been completed.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective5: Well shoot. The C-4 is gone, but the VIP wasn't caught in the blast.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective6: Blow up the alleged separatist bomber using a supplied detonator and C-4.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective7: The VIP was caught in the blast radius of an explosion.
infotexts.EventText.vipbombing.objective8: The VIP hasn't been harmed by explosives on their voyage.
infotexts.traitorobjective.vipbombing.detonate: Detonate the C-4 near the VIP
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.c1: “We have strong suspicions [character] is actually the nefarious Sootman, although we have no evidence to back it up. We’ve put a big bounty on their head, dead or alive. Also, about that evidence… We'd like you to plant some.”
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective1: Incapacitate [character], then replace their ID card with the fabricated ID card belonging to the terrorist Sootman. To avoid facial recognition, mask the victim. Don't get caught.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.c2: Someone saw you plant the evidence! Your plan is foiled.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.c3: The evidence is planted—now someone needs to discover it…
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective2: You have covertly planted the evidence—now "Sootman" just has to be found.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.c4: The evidence you've planted has been discovered!
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective3: The nefarious Sootman was found aboard your submarine, and you are the hero who took them out. Well done!
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.c5: Looks like your "Sootman" is up and about again, and your ploy has been discovered.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective4: The crewmate you disguised as Sootman has been resuscitated, and your ploy has been discovered.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective5: The terrorist Sootman was found as a part of your crew! No one was more surprised than "Sootman" themself.
infotexts.EventText.deadoralive.objective6: The requirements of the tasks were not met.
infotexts.traitorobjective.deadoralive.planteviden: Plant Sootman's ID card and mask
infotexts.EventText.undercover.c1: “Your crew is aiding the oppressors, another boot on the neck of the workers who risk their lives every day. Will you do what is right? All we need is [target]'s ID card…”
infotexts.EventText.undercover.objective1: The Jovian separatists have some designs on [target]'s ID card. Find a way to obtain it.
infotexts.EventText.undercover.c2: You've taken a crewmember's ID card. The separatists seem to have a plan in mind for it.
infotexts.EventText.undercover.objective2: You've obtained the ID card. Keep it on you until you make it to the station.
infotexts.EventText.undercover.objective3: The separatists have obtained a crewmember's ID card.
infotexts.EventText.undercover.objective4: The security of the crew remains uncompromised…for now.
infotexts.EventText.armsinterception.c1: You find a wrinkly note in your pocket that you certainly didn't put there yourself. You unfold it and can barely make out the hastily written instructions: \n“You know those weapons you're transporting are going to harm good people—get rid of them and we'll see you're rewarded.”
infotexts.EventText.armsinterception.objective1: Ensure the weapons of the Arms Delivery mission are no longer on the submarine when docking.
infotexts.EventText.armsinterception.objective2: The weapons are no longer on the submarine, and the separatists will be pleased—assuming the weapons stay gone.
infotexts.EventText.armsinterception.objective3: The weapons were delivered to the Coalition.
infotexts.EventText.armsinterception.objective4: To the dismay of your crew and the Coalition, the weapons were nowhere to be found.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.c1: “You know when the Coalition says you are transporting ‘a highly esteemed medical expert,’ they mean someone who does horrible experiments on anyone disagreeing with them, right?” The separatist recruiter sounded convincing and gave plenty of evidence of a certain Dr. Happy, to boot. Now they asked you to give the VIP a taste of their own medicine. Even if they survive, it will get the message across.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.objective1: Poison the VIP using the supplied poison.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.objective2: Find the poison in a loose vent.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.objective3: Inject the VIP with the poison.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.objective4: Looks like VIP stands for “Very Injected with Poison” today. Task completed.
infotexts.EventText.vippoison.objective6: The VIP has not been poisoned.
infotexts.traitorobjective.vippoison.findpoison: Find the poison in a hiding spot
infotexts.traitorobjective.vippoison.injectpoison: Inject the VIP with the poison
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.c1: While the comrades are unhappy that you have chosen to socialize with the ruling class, they are willing to look past this. You have been chosen as the executive muscle for a display of strength, cause and message. The separatist effort has tasked Blind Jim to stash necessary tools inside your vessel. Retrieve the stash and separate the bourgeoisie snakehead from its body, or whatever the missive suggests.
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.objective1: The task is to remove the “head of the snake.” You imagine blowing up the person steering this vessel would symbolically fit the objective.
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.objective2: Find the hidden stash in a loose vent.
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.c2: You rummage through the container but find nothing. Maybe you've been discovered, or maybe the stash is in a different location?
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.objective3: You've found the bomb. Now, blow up the person steering the vessel.
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.c3: The command room has been bombed!
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.c4: Blowing up the command room failed.
infotexts.EventText.showofstrength.objective4: The command room was not bombed.
infotexts.traitorobjective.showofstrength.blownavt: Blow up the crew at the navigation terminal
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.c1: You find a handkerchief with drawings and incoherent scribbling. Writing runs along the edges: “You know what's funny? Rubber ducks. What's even funnier is rubber ducks filled with lead so that they sink instead of float. We need prototypes. Get to it. Now that's funny.”
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.objective1: Use the fabricator to craft [number] Deepdiver Ducks.
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.c2: You have created 7 prototype ducks as requested. They're magnificent.
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.objective2: There's enough Deepdiver Duck prototypes—now you need to ensure they survive the rest of the voyage.
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.objective3: The Children of the Honkmother have prototyped a new Deepdiver Duck. The purpose is unknown, but it's full of potential nonetheless.
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.objective4: The Children of the Honkmother's attempts at prototyping Deepdiver Ducks have failed.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.c1: You find a note in your pocket.\n\n“The Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries has chosen you to deliver a very important item to your destination. The item is a seemingly normal (but in reality, a very important) duffel bag, hidden somewhere in your submarine. It is very important that you do not let anyone look inside the bag until it's reached its destination.”
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.objective1: Deliver a duffel bag to your destination. For some reason, nobody is supposed to look inside the bag.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.c2: This seems to be the bag the note talked about. Now I'll just need to make sure no one looks inside it…?
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.objective2: You've found the bag. Make sure no one looks inside it.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.c3: Oh no! Someone looked inside the bag.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.objective3: Someone looked inside the bag. The Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries must be very disappointed in you.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.objective4: Nobody has looked into the bag. The Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries is likely to be pleased.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbag.objective5: Tossing the duffel bag out of the submarine wasn't exactly the Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries' plan, although they appreciate the creative thinking.
infotexts.traitorobjective.theduffelbag.dontlookdu: Do not let anyone look inside the bag
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.c1: You find a note in your pocket.\n\n“The Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries has chosen you, yet again, to deliver a very important item to your destination. Plot twist, though! You do want people to take a peek inside it this time.”
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.objective1: The clowns have tasked you to deliver yet another duffel bag to your destination. This time it's booby trapped with a time bomb and needs to be found as quickly as possible.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.c2: This seems to be the bag the note talked about. Now to make sure it's discovered…
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.objective2: You've found the bag. Make sure someone discovers it.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.c3: Someone looked inside the bag, and the time bomb has been activated! …All according to plan? Now it should probably be kept from killing everyone on board, but your task is complete regardless.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.objective3: Someone looked inside the bag. The time bomb has been activated—now it should preferably be kept from killing everyone. Regardless though, your task is complete.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.c4: Someone was wise enough to just toss the bomb out of the submarine. Time to leave the blast area.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.c5: A ticking time bomb was tossed out of the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb.objective4: The bomb was found and chaos ensued.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c1: You find a note in your pocket.\n\n“The Con-sortium of Very Important Deliveries has chosen you to—well, you know the drill. Do they look inside? Do they not look inside? You'll figure it out.”
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective1: The clowns have tasked you to deliver another explosive duffel bag to your destination. No further instructions have been given, so the plan requires some improvisation.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c2: This seems to be the bag the note talked about. Now what…? Inside, there appears to be a battery-powered bomb.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective2: You've found the bag. It has a battery-powered bomb inside it.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c3: Someone looked inside the bag and the time bomb has been activated.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective3: Someone looked inside the bag. The time bomb has been activated.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c4: Tick tick tick. You hear some very ominous ticking aboard the submarine. Better check it out.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c5: The bomb's inner workings could be accessed by equipping the bomb and a screwdriver.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c6: Bomb defusal progress is being made. Should I tell them to cut the red wire as a joke?
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c7: The bomb's wires are exposed. Someone skilled in explosives or weapons manufacturing and equipped with a sharp tool could disarm it.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.c8: Crisis averted—the bomb has been defused.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective4: Phew, the bomb has been defused.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective5: Someone incompetent is cutting wires on the bomb. Your clown friends would love to hear about this.
infotexts.EventText.theduffelbagbomb2.objective6: The bomb was found and more chaos ensued.
infotexts.eventtext.harbingerofhonks.intro: “Honk…” A pause. “Honk…” Closer this time. The Honkmother is calling. And furthermore, she's calling you! The message is clear: Go honk or go home.
infotexts.eventtext.harbingerofhonks.stayhidden: They saw me honking, but I should honk unseen. I need to avoid further suspicion.
infotexts.eventtext.harbingerofhonks.objective: Honk a bike horn in [halfHulls] rooms unseen. Hide a bike horn in at least [halfCabinets] supplies cabinets. If you need more horns, you should be able to find some in a crate that has just been delivered to the cargo area.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective1: Someone saw me honk. Not ideal.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective4: Honk. Just a few more rooms…
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.c1: The call of the Honkmother has undoubtedly been heard by now. Time for the next step.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective5: The call of the Honkmother has been heard. Once [halfCabinets] of the supplies cabinets are stocked with bike horns, the call shall be heard again.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective6: You've placed half the bike horns. Good progress!
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.c2: Your job as the Harbinger of Honks has been completed.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective7: You have earned some rest, having set the honks onto a path of inevitability.
infotexts.EventText.harbingerofhonks.objective10: The honkin' objectives were not completed.
infotexts.traitorobjective.harbingerofhonks.honk: Honk a bike horn in various rooms
infotexts.traitorobjective.harbingerofhonks.hide: Hide a bike horn in supplies cabinets
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.c1: There was an addendum in the monthly issue of Beacon: “Hard times are upon the Church of Husk. We require aluminum to make a batch of commemorative Velonaceps calyx figurines, but the coffers run dry. All the faithful are called upon to create figures according to their means.”
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.objective1: Use the fabricator to craft [number] husk figurines.
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.c2: You have devotedly created 10 husk figurines and you're sad to have to part with them.
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.objective2: There's enough husk figurines—now you need to ensure they make it to the end of this voyage.
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.objective3: The Church of Husk's hard times may soon be over, now that they've been supplied with finely crafted Velonaceps calyx figurines.
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.objective4: The Church of Husk's struggles know no end. They're lacking both volunteers for communion and Velonaceps calyx figurines.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.c1: A recent mishap at a Church of Husk initiation rite left the church feeling rather embarrassed. Some of their robes didn't do their intended job of masking the wearer from the husks. Not a good showing for potential recruits, as those wearing the faulty robes got torn to pieces or taken over. Now they're offering a reward for anyone willing to test out the faulty batch.\n\nAll you have to do is get your crew to wear the robes amidst a large group of husks. It may be difficult to convince them to participate—better wait for the husks to board so the crew is more willing to try out the robes.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective1: Some Church of Husk robes didn't do their intended job of masking their wearers from the husks. Test which robes are functional and which are faulty by exposing them to the husks—the husks won't attack someone wearing functional robes. Once your tests are complete, get rid of the faulty robes.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective2: Find the robes and the husk caller.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective3: Use the husk caller and test the robes.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.c2: You've found the supplies. You can use the husk caller to attract husks to your submarine.\n\nFind a way to test which of the robes prevent husks from attacking, and make sure you've gotten rid of the ones that don't before the submarine makes it to the destination.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective4: Husks have been called! Test the robes, then deconstruct or dump the faulty robes out of the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective5: The cultist robes have been sorted. The Church of Husk will be happy to receive their functional robes back.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective6: Although no faulty robes were returned to the Church of Husk, they didn't receive all the good robes, either.
infotexts.EventText.faultyrobes.objective7: Some faulty robes were returned to the Church of Husk, which may cause a few unlucky sods to get bitten in the near future.
infotexts.traitorobjective.faultyrobes.find: Find the robes and the husk caller
infotexts.traitorobjective.faultyrobes.sorting: Dock with only functional robes on board
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.c1: You find a note in your pocket. “The Church would like to offer you an assignment. You may or may not believe in our cause, but this is strictly for research purposes.\n\nWe need blood samples from healthy individuals. Your crew would make excellent test subjects. We've hidden some blood sample vials in your sub; find and fill them, and we'll be sure to make it worth your while.”
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.objective1: Find the empty vials, then collect a blood sample from each crewmate.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.c2: You've found the vials. Now, they'll need some filling… First, inflict bleeding on a crewmate (in a preferably inconspicuous way), and then use the vial on the bleeding area to collect a sample.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.c3: You've now collected blood samples from everyone. The Church of Husk will be pleased.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.objective2: The traitor successfully collected the samples.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.c1: “Research of the husk symbiote is progressing, but could be sped up if you ask me. The next experiment is dangerous but crucial for any significant breakthrough to occur. Your blood samples collection suggests [character] is the perfect candidate for symbiosis. It is up to you to convince them to voluntarily agree to the symbiosis, or just inject them against their will.”
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.objective1: Inject [character] with the provided Calyx extract. Blood tests suggested a good chance for symbiosis to occur.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.objective2: The test subject has been infected. Now we wait.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.c2: The husk is about to take over the test subject. Soon we will see if the researchers were correct. In any case, my mission has been completed.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.objective3: The scientific experiment has concluded. The target was successfully infected.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples2.objective4: The experiment was never completed to the Church of Husk's satisfaction.
infotexts.traitorobjective.bloodsamples2.inject: Inject the target with Calyx extract
infotexts.eventtext.traitorgeneric.success: You have succeeded in your mission.
infotexts.eventtext.traitorgeneric.failure: You have failed your traitorous mission.
infotexts.nohiddencontainerswarning: There are no hidden containers (such as loose vents or panels) in the submarine. Certain traitor events require these to function properly.
infotexts.missionsuccess.pvpmission: The [loser] vessel has been defeated by the [winner] crew!
infotexts.beaconstationactivetooltip: There's an active ‖color:gui.orange‖beacon station‖end‖ in this passageway, which helps human habitation spread into nearby locations.
infotexts.beaconstationinactivetooltip: There's an inactive ‖color:gui.orange‖beacon station‖end‖ in this passageway. Getting it back online will make it easier for human habitation to spread into nearby locations.
infotexts.huntinggroundstooltip: A creature from the Abyss has made this passageway its ‖color:gui.orange‖hunting grounds‖end‖. Until the beast is dead, new outposts won't be established in the adjacent locations, and existing outposts may get abandoned.
infotexts.enteremptylocation: Select a destination and leave the passageway
infotexts.undockingdisabledbymission: You cannot undock from the outpost before the mission is completed.
infotexts.hostagesdiscovered: The hostages have been located, but still need to be escorted out of the outpost safely. You may want to take their handcuffs off and order them to follow you.
infotexts.entitydescription.door: A sliding door with no integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.windoweddoor: A sliding door with a window. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.hatch: A door, but on the horizontal axis. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
infotexts.entitydescription.doorwbuttons: A sliding door with two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.windoweddoorwbuttons: A sliding door with a window and two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.hatchwbuttons: A door, but on the horizontal axis. Two integrated buttons.
infotexts.entitydescription.navterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttlenavterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the shuttle.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarmonitor: Usable device for observing the sub's sonar. Non-interactive.
infotexts.entitydescription.statusmonitor: Usable device for viewing a schematic of the sub as well as the status of each room.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonartransducer: Sonar generator, allowing the sonar monitors and navigation terminals to receive a sonar signal other than the default one (useful for drones and remote-controlled shuttles).
infotexts.entitydescription.engine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.largeengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttleengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
infotexts.entitydescription.fabricator: A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials.
infotexts.entitydescription.medicalfabricator: A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines.
infotexts.entitydescription.deconstructor: Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars.
infotexts.entitydescription.oxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttleoxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
infotexts.entitydescription.vent: Oxygen output point. Must be linked to an oxygen generator to work.
infotexts.entitydescription.reactor1: Usable device for generating electrical power.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgun: A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunloader: Feeds coilgun ammunition into a linked coilgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargetube: Deploys a depth charge or decoy.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargeloader: Feeds depth charges and decoys into a linked depth charge tube.
infotexts.entitydescription.dischargecoil: Produces a harmful localized electrical shock across a portion of the adjacent hull.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgun: A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.periscope: A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloader: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloadersinglever: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunloadersinglehor: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoshelf: A way to neatly stow ammunition boxes.
infotexts.entitydescription.turrethardpoint: An empty weapon station turrets can be installed on.
infotexts.entitydescription.railguncanistershell: A reloadable burst-type munition for the railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.railguncanistershellpe: A pellet fired out of a canister shell.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaser: A large pulsed chemical laser attached to a turret, capable of firing intense beams of energy after charging up. Inflicts extreme burns on anything it hits.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaserammobox: A box of arranged chemicals and a focusing lens, useful for inducing intense bursts of energy. Used as ammo by the Pulse Laser.
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingun: A powerful multiple-barrel turreted weapon, based on coilgun technology. Though somewhat unwieldy and slow to wind up to its firing state, its capability to deliver a hail of high-velocity metal at any would-be foe is unparalleled.
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingunammobox: A heavy box of ammo for the Chaingun.
infotexts.entitydescription.largeturrethardpoint: An empty weapon station large turrets can be installed on.
infotexts.entitydescription.doublecoilgun: A double-barreled version of the coilgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannon: A large cannon, designed to fire shells that explode into sharp shrapnel fragments.
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannonammobox: A heavy box of wide-spread shrapnel ammo for the flak cannon. Good against swarms.
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannondirectionala: A heavy box of low spread ammo for the flak cannon. Good against single targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannonammoboxphysi: A backbreakingly heavy box of ammo for the flak cannon, utilizing Physicorium as its main material.
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannonammoboxexplo: A heavy box of ammo for the flak cannon, loaded with high explosive materials.
infotexts.entitydescription.idcard: Allows limited access to areas of the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienpistol: A handgun powered by alien power cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainscap: A token of the captain's unquestionable authority.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainsuniform: Makes you look like you might be in charge.
infotexts.entitydescription.healthscanner: A heads-up display that shows information about the vital signs and status of nearby humans.
infotexts.entitydescription.doctorsuniform2: Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency.
infotexts.entitydescription.orangejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.bluejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.entitydescription.toolbox: A portable container for storing tools and supplies.
infotexts.entitydescription.headset: Allows remote communication among the crew.
infotexts.entitydescription.watchmanclothes: Makes you look like you might offer a mission to a passerby at any moment.
infotexts.entitydescription.bodyarmor: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.ballistichelmet1: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.entitydescription.riotshield: Blocks projectiles and prevents creatures or people from passing.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingmask: Small enough to carry around in case it's needed, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingsuit: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust. Only offers adequate protection up to the depth of 4,000 meters—beyond this point, an Abyss or Combat suit is required.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
infotexts.entitydescription.weldingtool: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.plasmacutter: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.
infotexts.entitydescription.screwdriver: Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible.
infotexts.entitydescription.crowbar: Forces doors and hatches open. Also a blunt weapon.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarbeacon: Produces a localized signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal.
infotexts.entitydescription.flare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienflare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoboxexplosiv: Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoboxpiercing: Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingunammoboxphysico: A backbreakingly heavy box of ammunition for the chaingun, utilizing Physicorium as its main material. These rounds have enough stopping power to occasionally stun any foe they hit.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaserammoboxtrila: A box of containing a special concoction of chemicals and rare materials. The lens used splits the laser in three, allowing the laser to hit multiple targets at once.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunboltexplosive: Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunboltpiercing: Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities.
infotexts.entitydescription.uex: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.ic4block: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.
infotexts.entitydescription.detonator: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.spear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienspear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material.
infotexts.entitydescription.explosivespear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
infotexts.entitydescription.harpoongun: Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons.
infotexts.entitydescription.syringegun: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons.
infotexts.entitydescription.stungrenade: Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters.
infotexts.entitydescription.fraggrenade: General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully.
infotexts.entitydescription.stunbaton: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a stun baton may be enough to beat an unruly crewmember into submission.
infotexts.entitydescription.batterycell: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulguriumbatterycell: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienarmor: A body armor fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienhelmet: A helmet fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
infotexts.entitydescription.flamer: An incendiary weapon that fires a stream of burning welding fuel.
infotexts.entitydescription.smgmagazine: A magazine for .45 caliber SMG rounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.grenadelauncher: A portable grenade launcher for 40mm grenades.
infotexts.entitydescription.shotgun: A shotgun designed for crowd control.
infotexts.entitydescription.stungun: A device for firing electrified darts.
infotexts.entitydescription.stungundart: Causes electric shock to incapacitate a target. Non-lethal.
infotexts.entitydescription.crawlermask: Protects wearer's identity. Fun at certain parties.
infotexts.entitydescription.shellshield: A sturdy piece of a moloch's shell.
infotexts.entitydescription.mudraptorshell: A protective shell of a mudraptor.
infotexts.entitydescription.bongodrums: An old handmade pair of bongo drums.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainspipe: For calming the nerves when the sea is stormy.
infotexts.entitydescription.physicoriumammobox: Coilgun ammunition made of alien material.
infotexts.entitydescription.orangejumpsuit1: Has a protective lead shielding against radiation.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainscap1: A well-worn cap that has seen many ports.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainsuniform1: A warm jacket to protect its wearer against the cold depths.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainscap2: Strikes fear into the hearts of the Coalition.
infotexts.entitydescription.securityuniform1: I ain't got time to bleed.
infotexts.entitydescription.ballistichelmet2: A bit lighter than a regular ballistic helmet; designed not to get in the way when one is operating a periscope.
infotexts.entitydescription.ballistichelmet3: Designed for crowd control but equally useful against alien invaders.
infotexts.entitydescription.doctorsuniform1: For frontline medics. Offers some protection against enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.baseballcap: Every self-respecting mechanic should have one.
infotexts.entitydescription.duffelbag: The traditional way of storing a deceased seafarer's belongings until they can be delivered to their next of kin (or stolen or sold).
infotexts.entitydescription.outpostoutfit1: Not much to look at, but pretty warm and comfortable.
infotexts.entitydescription.sprayer: Cleans or paints walls by spraying liquid on them.
infotexts.entitydescription.spearunique: An antique spear named after a legendary captain.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingknifeunique: For friends and enemies alike. Mostly enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.smgunique: A tactical weapon, available in black and slightly darker black.
infotexts.entitydescription.flamerunique: Gets rid of pests like nothing else. Patent pending.
infotexts.entitydescription.clownmaskunique: Nothing remains hidden under mother's gaze.
infotexts.entitydescription.clownsuitunique: Nothing can escape mother's warm embrace.
infotexts.entitydescription.toolbelt: A wearable container for storing tools and supplies.
infotexts.entitydescription.chitinhelmet: A tough helmet made of chitin.
infotexts.entitydescription.glowstick: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.abyssdivingsuit: A heavy suit designed for deep sea exploration. Protects against damage and high pressure all the way down to 10,000 meters, reduces oxygen usage, but at a cost of reduced movement speed.
infotexts.entitydescription.combatdivingsuit: An agile, lightweight suit designed for combat. Offers some protection against damage and withstands pressure up to the depth of 6,000 meters.
infotexts.entitydescription.pressurestabilizer: A special drug that gives the user an immunity to pressure and removes their need for oxygen for a short duration.
infotexts.entitydescription.endocrinebooster: This medical contraption, when used, bestows the user with permanent performance enhancement.
infotexts.entitydescription.slipsuit: A modified Combat Diving Suit with additional diving fins that aid the user when moving in water. Sadly, the fins also make it difficult to walk on solid ground.
infotexts.entitydescription.backpack: A bulky backpack that can hold a large amount of tools and supplies, at the cost of slightly impaired movement.
infotexts.entitydescription.bandolier: A light combat rig, capable of carrying ammunition and other useful items. Thanks to improved ergonomics, increases combat effectiveness with ranged weapons and turrets.
infotexts.entitydescription.repairpack: A handheld contraption, capable of quickly correcting mechanical and electrical problems. Consumed on use.
infotexts.entitydescription.autoinjectorheadset: A modifed headset utilizing an integrated battery, capable of injecting medicine placed within once the user's vitals drop to a certain level.
infotexts.entitydescription.depletedfuel: A heavy, hard material derived from processing a spent fuel rod. Can be further fabricated into tools and munitions.
infotexts.entitydescription.wrenchhardened: A wrench that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.
infotexts.entitydescription.screwdriverhardened: A screwdriver that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.
infotexts.entitydescription.crowbarhardened: A crowbar that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material makes it easier to pry open doors and bash open heads.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingknifehardened: A diving knife that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for deeper slashes and stabs.
infotexts.entitydescription.revolverrounddepletedf: A .38 round for the revolver, fashioned out of depleted fuel. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.smgmagazinedepletedfue: A .45 caliber magazine for the SMG, containing rounds of depleted fuel ammo. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoboxdepleted: A heavy box of depleted fuel ammunition for the coilgun. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
infotexts.entitydescription.handheldelectricalmoni: A small handheld device that gives the user remote access to information regarding the ship's electrical systems.
infotexts.entitydescription.handheldstatusmonitor: A small handheld device with a screen displaying the current status of the ship, informing the user of any breaches remotely.
infotexts.entitydescription.electriciansgoggles: A device that remotely detects and visualizes electrical fields, allowing an engineer to detect power and signals traveling through wires and to read the values of the signals from a device's connection panel.
infotexts.entitydescription.autoshotgun: A roughly engineered automatic shotgun with a vast ammo capacity. Its size and heft makes it a bit cumbersome to lug around.
infotexts.entitydescription.handcannon: A humongous beast of a revolver, designed to better deal with the large alien threats on Europa than typical firearms.
infotexts.entitydescription.handcannonround: An exceedingly large .61 revolver round. The unique alloy of materials allows for high penetration and stopping power.
infotexts.entitydescription.coalitioncommendation: A small medal fashioned out of copper, originally created by the Coalition. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with a sum of experience.
infotexts.entitydescription.coalitionmedal: A small medal fashioned out of bronze, originally created by the Coalition. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with a large sum of experience.
infotexts.entitydescription.assaultrifle: An assault rifle chambering 6.8mm cartridges. Though banned by the Coalition, the schematics for these rifles are still passed around Europa as they present a premier option for submarine defense, or as the Separatists would prefer, societal revolution.
infotexts.entitydescription.assaultriflemagazine: A magazine designed for holding 6.8mm cartridges.
infotexts.entitydescription.rifle: A .30 caliber rifle with a manual reload mechanism. Slow rate of fire for unskilled users.
infotexts.entitydescription.riflebullet: A .30 caliber round for the rifle.
infotexts.entitydescription.hmg: Heavy Machine Gun, capable of dealing a lot of damage, provided the user is skilled enough to handle the recoil.
infotexts.entitydescription.hmgmagazine: A magazine of 5.56mm rounds for the HMG
infotexts.entitydescription.hmground: Round of a Heavy Machine Gun
infotexts.entitydescription.harpooncoilrifle: An advanced harpoon gun, powered by an energy source to launch harpoons at high velocities.
infotexts.entitydescription.machinepistol: A high rate of fire automatic weapon, using .45 (SMG) caliber magazines. Hard to aim.
infotexts.entitydescription.heavywrench: A large and heavy titanium wrench. Can only be properly swung by very burly mechanics.
infotexts.entitydescription.arcemitter: A handheld weapon based on electric discharge coil technology. Fires a high-voltage electrical arc.
infotexts.entitydescription.makeshiftarmor: A bulky and unwieldy set of iron plates, fashioned into something that resembles armor.
infotexts.entitydescription.ironhelmet: A very simple and very heavy helmet that covers the entire face.
infotexts.entitydescription.scrapcannon: A battery-powered makeshift weapon that fires metal shrapnels. Wildly inaccurate, but not too picky when it comes to ammo—any piece of unprocessed iron or steel will do.
infotexts.entitydescription.exosuit: A heavy powered suit originally designed for underwater construction work. Well-armored and capable of carrying substantial loads.
infotexts.entitydescription.advancedsyringegun: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons. Has a higher capacity and integrated health scanner.
infotexts.entitydescription.clowncrate: A crate large enough to fit a prankster inside.
infotexts.entitydescription.europabrew: A reagent that drastically increases the effect of acid burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.sulphuricacidsyringe: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Contained in a syringe.
infotexts.entitydescription.chemgrenade: A grenade filled with acid, causing acid burns when it explodes.
infotexts.entitydescription.40mmchemgrenade: Ammunition for grenade launcher. Filled with acid, causing acid burns when it explodes.
infotexts.entitydescription.rum: A fine liquor made from raptor bane juice. Some purists insist real rum is made from sugarcane — good luck finding any of that on Europa.
infotexts.entitydescription.handhelditemfinder: A small handheld device with a screen, capable of easily finding items within the submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.makeshiftshelf: Crate storage shelves that can be manually installed on a submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.ceremonialsword: A sharp sword to commemorate graduating. It takes varied skills to use it to it's highest potential.
infotexts.entitydescription.shotgunslugexplosive: A shotgun slug containing explosive material. Powerful, but still somewhat inaccurate on account of being fired out of a shotgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.boardingaxe: A hand axe, meant to be wielded with both hands.
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbooksailorsguide: A small handbook that covers all the tasks associated with underwater sailing, though in limited scope.
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbooksubmarinewarf: A small handbook with useful information pertaining to all things submarine warfare, with detailed pictures of elaborate tactical manuevers and proper firearms discipline.
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbookhandyseaman: A small handbook containing detailed information on the most-often-encountered technical problems on board the submarines of Europa, with simple-to-understand instructions for dealing with them.
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbookeuropanmedici: A small handbook seeking to educate its reader on the proper conduct with treating the wounded and the sick using limited medical resources. The word "triage" appears to be mentioned a lot.
infotexts.entitydescription.thermalgoggles: A thermal imaging device that makes it easier to distinguish living targets in poor lighting conditions, even through solid obstacles.
infotexts.entitydescription.reactorpda: A handheld device that can be used to remotely control the submarine's reactor.
infotexts.entitydescription.dirtybomb: An explosive compound mixed with highly radioactive material. Though the explosive payload is low, the ensuing fallout will catastrophically irradiate the area.
infotexts.entitydescription.dirtybomb_showofstreng: An especially dirty bomb built for nefarious purposes.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulguriumfuelrodvolati: A Fulgurium fuel rod that has been further refined to supply power for much longer than normal. However, its radiation shielding can only partially limit the emitted ambient radiation, so the rod must be handled with care.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleargun: A prototype energy weapon built using the unique alien materials on Europa. The weapon induces a type of fission reaction at the end of the barrel, and releases it in a powerful beam once it is too violent to contain.
infotexts.entitydescription.cargoscooter: An underwater scooter special-made to transport material underwater. While the scooter is too large to be stored in one's inventory, its inherent buoyancy means the scooter will stay where you leave it.
infotexts.entitydescription.clowndivingmask: A clown mask combined with a diving mask, allowing the user to both clown around and breathe underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.safetyharness: A special harness made to reduce workplace related injuries incurred on Europan submarines. The harness also dampens the effects of rushing water, stabilizing the user in the event of a hull breach.
infotexts.entitydescription.pucs: The Protective Universal Crisis Suit, or PUCS for short, bestows its user with immense resistances to environmental hazards such as radiation and fire. The built-in air-filtration system allows the suit to utilize hull oxygen when possible, and the built-in computer injects the user with whatever medicine is placed inside the suit. Withstands pressure up to a depth of 6,000 meters.
infotexts.entitydescription.cigar: A submariner's life is mentally taxing, but perhaps this exquisitely crafted cigar can help you soothe your nerves a bit.
infotexts.entitydescription.stungundartfulgurium: A highly potent stun gun dart that will drop any would-be creep like a sack of potatoes.
infotexts.entitydescription.fixfoamgrenade: Emits a cloud of chemical sealant that quickly seals off leaks.
infotexts.entitydescription.portablepump: A small battery-powered pump that can be installed on walls. Pumps out water very fast, but consumes a lot of power.
infotexts.entitydescription.combatstimulantsyringe: A highly advanced stimulant that makes the user rapidly recover from physical injuries and bloodloss.
infotexts.entitydescription.dementonitetool: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.
infotexts.entitydescription.unidentifiedgeneticmat: A mass of alien genetic material. Use a research station to identify the material and to process it into something that can be inserted into a gene splicer.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialmudrapt: Causes the subject to grow a mudraptor-like beak.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialmoloch: Increases resistance to physical damage by [value]%
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialthreshe: Decreases the subject's oxygen consumption by [value]%.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialmantis: Increases movement speed on land by [value]%.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialhammerh: Allows the subject to to do [value]% more damage with melee weapons.
Makes the subject's physical injuries heal at a rate of [value]% per minute.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialspineli: Causes the subject to grow spineling-like bony protrusions out of their back.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialhusk: Prevents husk infections from advancing to the point where the parasite takes control of the host.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialmollusc: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain [value]% vigor.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialskitter: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain [value]% hyperactivity.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialhunter: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain a [value]% boost to melee weapon damage.
infotexts.entitydescription.genesplicer: A device used to splice alien genes into a human. Equip the splicer in the health interface and insert genetic materials in the splicer to activate the genes. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material cannot be removed without destroying it.
infotexts.entitydescription.advancedgenesplicer: A more advanced form of the gene splicer, capable of activating two types of genetic materials at the same time.
infotexts.entitydescription.energydrink: Mantis Energy keeps you skittering from dawn till dusk!
infotexts.entitydescription.chaingunammoboxshredde: A heavy box of ammunition for the chaingun. Designed to shred through flesh and armor of any enemy.
infotexts.entitydescription.shotgunshellblunt: Ammunition for a shotgun. Less lethal.
infotexts.entitydescription.respawndivingsuit: A disposable diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust.
infotexts.entitydescription.junctionbox: Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.battery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.entitydescription.shuttlebattery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.entitydescription.supercapacitor: Can output huge surges of power, but has a much lower capacity than batteries. Recharging the capacitors also takes much more power than batteries.
infotexts.entitydescription.chargingdock: A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock.
infotexts.entitydescription.fpgacircuit: Field-programmable gate array—a multipurpose circuit that can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.
infotexts.entitydescription.andcomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.
infotexts.entitydescription.addercomponent: Outputs the sum of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.orcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receives a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.notcomponent: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.relaycomponent: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.
infotexts.entitydescription.delaycomponent: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.
infotexts.entitydescription.equalscomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.greatercomponent: Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input.
infotexts.entitydescription.colorcomponent: Outputs a combined color signal for light control.
infotexts.entitydescription.subtractcomponent: Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.multiplycomponent: Outputs the product of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.dividecomponent: Outputs the divided value of the received signals.
infotexts.entitydescription.xorcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.memorycomponent: Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.oxygendetector: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.
infotexts.entitydescription.waterdetector: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.
infotexts.entitydescription.smokedetector: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.
infotexts.entitydescription.motiondetector: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.
infotexts.entitydescription.signalcheckcomponent: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.
infotexts.entitydescription.regexcomponent: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.
infotexts.entitydescription.oscillator: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.wificomponent: Allows remote communication between other wifi components that are using the same channel.
infotexts.entitydescription.camera: Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.button: Produces a signal that can be used to toggle the state of equipment and doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.switch: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.emergencylight: Wall-mounted lighting. Requires no electrical input.
infotexts.entitydescription.wire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.redwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.bluewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.orangewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.greenwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.blackwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.brownwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
infotexts.entitydescription.lightcomponent: General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input.
infotexts.entitydescription.emergencysiren: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
infotexts.entitydescription.alarmbuzzer: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
infotexts.entitydescription.beacon: When deployed and activated in the correct location, it will signal colonists to come and set up an outpost.
infotexts.entitydescription.sincomponent: Outputs the sine of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.coscomponent: Outputs the cosine of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.tancomponent: Outputs the tangent of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.asincomponent: Outputs the angle whose sine is equal to the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.acoscomponent: Outputs the angle whose cosine is equal to the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.atancomponent: Outputs the angle whose tangent is equal to the input. If the "signal_in_x" and "signal_in_y" connections are used, the input is interpreted as a vector and the angle calculated using Atan2.
infotexts.entitydescription.modulocomponent: Outputs the remainder when the input is divided by a specific number.
infotexts.entitydescription.roundcomponent: Rounds a numerical input to the nearest integer value.
