infotexts.entitydescription.ceilcomponent: Outputs the smallest integer value that is bigger than or equal to the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.floorcomponent: Outputs the greatest integer value that is less than or equal to the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.factorialcomponent: Outputs the factorial of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.squarerootcomponent: Outputs the square root of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.abscomponent: Outputs the absolute value of the input.
infotexts.entitydescription.powcomponent: Outputs the input raised to a given power.
infotexts.entitydescription.lever: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.
infotexts.entitydescription.concatcomponent: Joins the inputs together and outputs the joined value (for example, the inputs "mud" and "raptor" would output "mudraptor").
infotexts.entitydescription.circuitbox: Allows creating complex circuits in a compact and portable container.
infotexts.circuitboxuicomponentnotavailable: You need to have ‖color:gui.orange‖[item]‖end‖ or ‖color:gui.orange‖FPGA Circuit‖end‖ in your inventory to place this component.
infotexts.circuitboxsettingdescription.resetview: Returns the camera to the center.
infotexts.circuitboxsettingdescription.focusinput: Teleports the camera to the circuit box inputs node.
infotexts.circuitboxsettingdescription.focusoutput: Teleports the camera to the circuit box output node.
infotexts.circuitboxsettingdescription.focuscircui: Teleports the camera to the nearest component node.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienblood: Blood extracted from a Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.huskeggs: The Velonaceps calyx or "husk parasite" likes to bind itself to calcium, regardless of whether it's inside human bones or neatly packed inside a syringe.
infotexts.entitydescription.molochbone: Piece of a Moloch bone. Considered an expensive luxury item by colony dwellers; can be sold at a high price.
infotexts.entitydescription.huskeggsbasic: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as "husk parasite."
infotexts.entitydescription.aliencircuitry: Advanced looking circuitry, typically found within the inorganic guardians of the alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.diversremains: The less easily digested remains of the poor soul that met their untimely demise.
infotexts.entitydescription.hammerheadribs: The ribs and fleshy remains of a Hammerhead. Can fetch a decent price in colonies.
infotexts.entitydescription.endwormshell: A sturdy piece of an endworm's shell.
infotexts.entitydescription.watchershell: A sturdy piece of a watcher's shell.
infotexts.entitydescription.carbon: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.
infotexts.entitydescription.iron: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.
infotexts.entitydescription.tin: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.
infotexts.entitydescription.lead: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.phosphorus: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.copper: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.
infotexts.entitydescription.zinc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.
infotexts.entitydescription.sodium: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine. Reacts violently when coming into contact with water.
infotexts.entitydescription.silicon: Used as an ingredient in aluminum alloys, plastic and various electrical components.
infotexts.entitydescription.uranium: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.potassium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.entitydescription.magnesium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.lithium: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.entitydescription.chlorine: Most commonly used in saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.
infotexts.entitydescription.slimebacteria: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.
infotexts.entitydescription.titanite: A mineral containing titanium and iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.brockite: A mineral containing thorium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.amblygonite: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminum and sodium.
infotexts.entitydescription.sphalerite: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.
infotexts.entitydescription.quartz: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.
infotexts.entitydescription.diamond: A crystal composed of solid carbon.
infotexts.entitydescription.hydroxyapatite: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.
infotexts.entitydescription.uraniumore: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.
infotexts.entitydescription.stannite: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.
infotexts.entitydescription.esperite: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.
infotexts.entitydescription.galena: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.
infotexts.entitydescription.langbeinite: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.
infotexts.entitydescription.chamosite: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminum.
infotexts.entitydescription.ironore: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.polyhalite: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.
infotexts.entitydescription.sylvite: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.
infotexts.entitydescription.lazulite: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.
infotexts.entitydescription.opium: A relatively mild opioid obtained from aquatic poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibiotics: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of minor organ damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.stabilozine: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be used to slow down the effects of most toxins.
infotexts.entitydescription.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.
infotexts.entitydescription.sulphuricacid: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.
infotexts.entitydescription.antidama1: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.entitydescription.antidama2: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibloodloss2: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.entitydescription.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and, to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
infotexts.entitydescription.calyxanide: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.
infotexts.entitydescription.antinarc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate-based withdrawal and overdose.
infotexts.entitydescription.morbusineantidote: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.cyanideantidote: An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.sufforinantidote: An antidote for acute sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.deliriumineantidote: An antidote for acute deliriumine poisoning.
infotexts.entitydescription.antirad: Slows down cellular degradation caused by radiation.
infotexts.entitydescription.liquidoxygenite: A mildly toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.entitydescription.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.steroids: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.
infotexts.entitydescription.hyperzine: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.
infotexts.entitydescription.morbusine: A highly potent neurotoxin that causes an eventual shutdown of lungs and muscles, greatly hindering movement.
infotexts.entitydescription.chloralhydrate: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
infotexts.entitydescription.cyanide: A highly toxic chemical that causes a rapid death once a sufficiently large dose has been administered.
infotexts.entitydescription.radiotoxin: A highly radioactive substance that causes radiation sickness and eventual liquefaction of inner organs.
infotexts.entitydescription.sufforin: A stealthy neurotoxin, undetectable in early stages. Causes a loss of vision and, ultimately, death.
infotexts.entitydescription.nitroglycerin: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
infotexts.entitydescription.calcium: A silvery-white powder. Used to fabricate Tonic Liquid.
infotexts.entitydescription.aluminium: A soft, lightweight metal. Used in the manufacture of diving equipment and some military applications.
infotexts.entitydescription.titanium: A hard and strong metal. Used for creating the durable Titanium-Aluminium alloy, as well as military applications.
infotexts.entitydescription.thorium: A weakly radioactive, silvery metal. Can be refined to create longer lasting fuel rods.
infotexts.entitydescription.steel: A strong metal alloy of iron and carbon. Used in fuel rod manufacturing, as well as many military applications.
infotexts.entitydescription.titaniumaluminiumalloy: A very tough metal alloy. Used in durable diving gear and advanced weaponry.
infotexts.entitydescription.plastic: An easily shaped, synthetic material. Contains Silicon and Carbon. Used in circuitry and various equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.ballisticfiber: Strong fiber strung from plastic and titanium. Used in the manufacture of armor.
infotexts.entitydescription.organicfiber: Fiber created from plants. Used in the manufacture of clothing and bandages.
infotexts.entitydescription.rubber: A tough and elastic substance. Used in the manufacture of diving gear and other equipment.
infotexts.entitydescription.flashpowder: A quick burning powder, composed of magnesium and potassium. Used in flares and explosives.
infotexts.entitydescription.fiberplant: This plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Can be processed into organic fiber.
infotexts.entitydescription.elastinplant: The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Can be processed into elastin.
infotexts.entitydescription.aquaticpoppy: It's warm to the touch. Can be processed into opium.
infotexts.entitydescription.yeastshroom: The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Can be processed into ethanol.
infotexts.entitydescription.elastin: A highly elastic, naturally occurring protein. Can be used to stem bleeding or heal burns once processed to medical items.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenaline: A naturally occurring hormone. Used to manufacture medicine or combat stimulants.
infotexts.entitydescription.paralyxis: A strange substance that numbs when touched. Used to create a powerful paralyzing agent.
infotexts.entitydescription.antiparalysis: A cure for paralysis. Beware: Excessive use may cause psychosis.
infotexts.entitydescription.hallucinogenicbufotoxi: Hallucinogenic toxin secreted by some Europan species. Serves as an antiparalysant in a pinch.
infotexts.fabricationdescription.advmunition_tip: Advanced bullet tip material. Hardened metals.
infotexts.fabricationdescription.advmunition_core: Advanced core munition material. High-density metals.
infotexts.fabricationdescription.advmunition_jacke: Advanced munition jacket material. Softer metals.
infotexts.entitydescription.petegg: A strange egg. Try injecting it with saline.
infotexts.entitydescription.food: The best food for your slimy friend.
infotexts.entitydescription.defensebotspawner: Build a deadly machine to look after you.
infotexts.entitydescription.petraptoregg: A slimy, pulsating mudraptor egg. Hard to believe that this one is friendly. Drop it on the floor and feed it with saline, maybe?
infotexts.entitydescription.swimbladder: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
infotexts.entitydescription.suppliescabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.mediumsteelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.mediumwindowedsteelcab: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.steelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.securesteelcabinet: Lockable storage for small- and medium-sized items.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunshellrack: A way to neatly stow railgun shells.
infotexts.entitydescription.divingsuitlocker: A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit.
infotexts.entitydescription.metalcrate: A vessel in which items may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.securemetalcrate: A secure vessel in which items may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.explosivecrate: A vessel in which explosives may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.chemicalcrate: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored.
infotexts.entitydescription.extinguisherbracket: Holds a fire extinguisher to the wall.
infotexts.entitydescription.weaponholder: A place to stow your weapons neatly.
infotexts.entitydescription.dockingport: A vertically aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking port to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
infotexts.entitydescription.dockinghatch: A horizontally aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking hatch to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
infotexts.entitydescription.ductblock: A mechanically operated vent that may be opened or closed to allow the passage of water.
infotexts.entityname.label: Label
infotexts.entitydescription.label: Decorative text label.
infotexts.entitydescription.fuelrod: A bar of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulguriumfuelrod: A bar of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.entitydescription.thoriumfuelrod: A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthchargeshell: A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthcharge: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode.
infotexts.entitydescription.depthdecoyshell: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthdecoy: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
infotexts.entitydescription.nuclearshell: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun.
infotexts.entitydescription.mudraptoregg: A slimy, pulsating mudraptor egg. The gaping maw on top of the egg seems to be grasping for something to eat.
infotexts.entitydescription.loosevent: A place to stash things of dubious nature.
infotexts.entitydescription.loosepanel: A place to stash things of dubious nature.
infotexts.entitydescription.handheldterminal: A handheld device used for storing messages.
infotexts.entitydescription.idcardwreck: This ID card allows access to most of the wreck, provided the door isn't rusted shut.
infotexts.entitydescription.outpostterminal: Allows access to the outpost's digital services.
infotexts.entitydescription.sealedsupplycrate: A box of various in-demand supplies. Fetches a high price at outposts.
infotexts.entitydescription.scrap: A pile of possibly useful material.
infotexts.entitydescription.spinelingspike: A detached bone spike that once belonged to a Spineling.
infotexts.entitydescription.mediccrate: A box for medical items and ingredients.
infotexts.entitydescription.rustdecal: Decorative decal for walls and machines
infotexts.entitydescription.unitloaddevice: A container that can hold a large quantity of crates.
infotexts.entitydescription.huskfigurine: A somewhat pleasant depiction of the Velonaceps calyx, made of aluminum.
infotexts.entitydescription.huskcaller: An item of dubious origin that attracts a large swarm of husks when used.
infotexts.entitydescription.traitortimebomb: It looks like a nuke with a text display and some wires strapped to it.
infotexts.entitydescription.traitortimebomb2: It looks like a nuke with a text display and some wires strapped to it. Any water would probably trigger an explosion due to the exposed wires.
infotexts.entitydescription.traitortimebomb3: It looks like a nuke with a text display and some wires strapped to it. It is powered by a battery, which should be kept from running out.
infotexts.entitydescription.bloodsamplevial: Proper equipment for taking blood samples isn't something you usually find on subs, but it will work as long as the patient is bleeding. Getting the patient to bleed, however, is left as an exercise for the reader.
infotexts.entityname.safeandsoundsecurity101: Officer Pérez's Safe and Sound Security 101
infotexts.entitydescription.safeandsoundsecurity10: An official set of guidelines for dealing with traitorous crewmates.
infotexts.securityofficer.traitor.guidelines:
Officer Pérez's Safe and Sound Security 101

Hostile factions and individuals are known to offer submariners bribes or other compensation for committing unlawful acts. This is unfortunately so common that throwing every traitorous submariner out the airlock would be detrimental to the submarine fleets and the Europan labor force as a whole. The Code of Fair Disciplinary Actions provides guidelines for dealing with traitors or other troublesome crewmates in a just manner.

Level 1 Offenses:
Description: mostly harmless misdemeanors, "pranks," neglect of assigned duties. Acts that at most cause minor inconvenience to the rest of the crew.
Suggested disciplinary actions: Notify the person of their misconduct and command them back to their duties. A baton or some other non-lethal tool may be used to accentuate the verbal commands. More severe disciplinary actions can be considered if the misconduct continues.

Level 2 Offenses:
Description: acts that may endanger the health of the crew or submarine, such as intentional mishandling of devices or substances.
Suggested disciplinary actions: Similar to level 1 offenses, a simple disciplining can suffice, but depending on the misconduct security can deem it necessary to instead handcuff or detain the individual by other means

Level 3 Offenses:
Description: clearly hostile acts with the intention to cause severe injuries or the death of one or more crewmates.
Suggested disciplinary actions: Disposing of the traitor as soon as possible is advised. The disposal should preferably be carried out in a humane way, but it is understandable if such means are not available or feasible for one reason or another.
infotexts.entitydescription.idcardfakesootman: This belongs to Sootman, the notorious masked vigilante.
infotexts.entitydescription.radiojammer: A portable, battery-powered device that temporarily blocks radio communications.

infotexts.entitydescription.alientrinket2: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alientrinket3: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.

infotexts.entitydescription.aliendoor: A vertical door for alien ruins.

infotexts.entitydescription.aliengenerator: Converts alien power cells to electricity.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienpump: Used to pump water in and out of ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienbutton: Sends a signal to alien mechanisms.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienturret: A stationary turret found in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.aliencoil: Discharges electricity; used in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienlightcomponent: Emits light; used in alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienterminal: Sends signals if the required item is contained.
infotexts.entitydescription.artifacttransportcase: A case to ease the transportation of alien artifacts.
infotexts.entitydescription.gravitysphere: Generates a strong, artificial gravity field.
infotexts.entitydescription.ruinwallcorner1: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.ruinscanner: A device that uses sonar waves to map ruins.
infotexts.entitydescription.ruinvent: A vent that might emit harmful spores or gas.
infotexts.entitydescription.incendium: A rare alien crystal capable of emitting extreme amounts of heat. Used in incendiary weapons.
infotexts.entitydescription.fulgurium: A rare metallic alien material, capable of storing massive amounts of energy. Used in high capacity batteries.
infotexts.entitydescription.physicorium: An incredibly hard and durable alien material. Used in highly advanced weaponry and ammunition.
infotexts.entitydescription.dementonite: A strange living metal. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.
infotexts.entitydescription.smallplanter: Suitable for most Europan plantlife while small enough to be transported around by hand.
infotexts.entitydescription.fertilizer: Carefully tended Europan soil guaranteed to give your plant the best living conditions.
infotexts.entitydescription.seedbag: Can store a wide variety of seeds.
infotexts.entitydescription.wateringcan: Keeps your plants happy and alive.
infotexts.entitydescription.creepingorange: A tasty fruit. Its processed juice has minor healing properties.
infotexts.entitydescription.tobaccobud: Damp and strongly fragrant. Can be refined into serviceable pipe tobacco.
infotexts.entitydescription.raptorbane: It looks delicious, but should not be ingested under any circumstances. Not good for mudraptors.
infotexts.entitydescription.raptorbaneextract: Concentrated raptorbane juice. Mildly toxic for humans, catastrophically toxic for mudraptors.
infotexts.entitydescription.pomegrenadeextract: Concentrated pomegrenade juice. It offers minor healing properties.
infotexts.entitydescription.pipetobacco: Put it in your pipe and smoke it.
infotexts.label.outpostinfodisplay1: Welcome. Oxygen Levels: Nominal. Power Levels: Nominal. Radiation Levels: Suboptimal. Weather Forecast for Today: Cold and Damp.
infotexts.label.dronedoor: Please ensure the drone door is closed before attempting to undock
infotexts.label.letwaterdrain: Allow all water to drain before exiting!
infotexts.autoloadout_description: Modify the quantity of items to be spawned on the sub initially
infotexts.submarinetier.description: Higher tier submarines are more advanced, costlier and better equipped than lower-tier submarines. They can also be upgraded further than lower tier submarines.
infotexts.submarineclass.description: A submarine's class describes what kinds of tasks it was primarily designed for. The class also affects how far certain features of the submarine can be upgraded.
infotexts.submarinetierandclass.description: Submarine tier and class affect the number of available upgrades, as well as the maximum upgrade level per category. Higher tier submarines can be upgraded further than lower tier submarines. Class can raise the maximum upgrade level of matching categories even higher.
infotexts.submarineclass.scout.description: Scout class submarines are fast and agile. Their engines and turret visibility ranges can be upgraded further than other classes, and they support mineral scanner installations.
infotexts.submarineclass.attack.description: Designed for combat, attack submarines are tough and heavily armed. Their turrets can be upgraded further than other classes.
infotexts.submarineclass.transport.description: Transport submarines have plenty of space for cargo and are well equipped for collecting and processing resources. Their fabricators, deconstructors and fuel efficiency can be upgraded further than other classes, and they support mineral scanner installations.
infotexts.submarine.description.humpback: A former military vessel, WH4-L3 "Humpback" has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. As she's still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment.
infotexts.submarine.description.bunyip: Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between submarines and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board makes it vulnerable to attacks.
infotexts.submarine.description.muikku: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.orca: With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel.
infotexts.submarine.description.remora: A range of customization options are available for Remora. In this model, some of the main hull space has been replaced by a detachable ballast and a remote-controlled drone. A large crew is needed to operate this submarine.
infotexts.submarine.description.typhon: Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed.
infotexts.submarine.description.dugong: Compared to larger vessels, the Dugong series is overshadowed in all aspects except one: Their reliability for their price is world class. They're lacking in firepower and speed, so smart maneuvering is key.
infotexts.submarine.description.selkie: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.venture: Originally intended as research vessels, Venture shuttles have been co-opted as a more robust alternative for travel between outposts and submarines.
infotexts.submarine.description.berilia: Berilia is one of the biggest cargo ships on Europa. Its two engines and three ballasts require a copious amount of power to operate, and keeping the machinery in good working condition is a handful for even a moderately large crew.
infotexts.submarine.description.kastrull: The Kastrull is a dependable attack sub class bringing plenty of firepower to any fight, and although it's not very nimble, it does sport a drone gunship as standard. Keep in mind that with its experimental open ballast tanks, low tolerance to flooding and numerous crew stations, a large, experienced crew will get the most out of this sub.
infotexts.submarine.description.hemulen: For when you need extra room to stretch your legs or want some space between you and the poor, choose Hemulen shuttles.
infotexts.submarine.description.typhon2: Typhon 2 is an overhauled version of the venerable Typhon class of sub. Serving as a heavy gunship, the Typhon 2 class subs remain slow and ugly, but with the benefit of better survivability for their crews.
infotexts.submarine.description.azimuth: Superior speed, sleek design and quality-of-life systems make this submarine a favorite among wealthy Coalition captains who manage to make it to retirement.
infotexts.submarine.description.r-29: R-29 is a heavyweight transport ship. While not terribly well armed against Europa's underwater denizens, it has been retrofitted with two powerful electric discharge coils. Original design by rav2n.
infotexts.submarine.description.barsuk: Barsuk is a favorite among beginner captains. Using materials out of recycled hulls of destroyed submarines (many of which were Barsuks anyway) keeps the price of the line down. Over the years, a subculture of Barsuk-enthusiasts has formed around customizing and tuning their vessels.
infotexts.submarine.description.winterhalter: Originally manufactured by Archsteel Yards in New Iapetus, Winterhalter submarines were only in production for a year until they were acquired by the Coalition for research purposes. Many surviving models come equipped with an onboard research laboratory, and they are heavily armed.
infotexts.submarine.description.herja: With its varied weaponry, Herja submarines are equipped for encounters against most expected and unexpected run-ins with the denizens of Europa. A reliable workhorse in the Coalition fleet. If a monster nest has been cleared nearby, chances are high that it was a Herja that did the deed.
infotexts.submarine.description.orca2: Successor for the classic Orca series, this submarine boasts the same three-ballast setup which allows it to ascend and descend with only a moment's notice. Well armed and equipped for a scout vessel, Orca2 is capable of taking on all but the most dangerous denizens of Europa.
infotexts.submarine.description.camel: Easily identified by its two humps, the CML (Cargo & Medical Logistics) submarine is best known as the Camel. The Camel has an extensive medic bay and ample cargo space, but it handles flooding poorly. The front ballast tank is a liability, and some less-liked crewmembers may have found an untimely death in an "accident" there. Trivia: The two humps are welded to the submarine during missions, but they can still be detached relatively easily when needed to supply heavier equipment to stations.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.humpback: Type "on" or "off" to either connect batteries to power grid or disconnect them. Enter a number from 0 to 100 to set recharge rate for each battery at once.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.typhon2: Enter a value between 0 and 100 to set battery array recharge rate.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.kastrulldiary1:
Day 1 of the expedition out of Meltwater. We're navigating through a newly discovered gap in the ice, trying to find a shorter route to Novaya Moskva.

It's not the safest of missions, but hopefully it'll be my last. Should be able to retire after this one.

Day 3. Cap says the whole voyage shouldn't take more than six days. By my reckoning that should place us somewhere around halfway there.

Course there's always a chance this cave doesn't actually have an exit and we'll have to turn back.

Day 4. Now if I were a superstitious man, I'd wager that saying the worst outcome in any given situation out loud makes it come true. Turns out this route is a dead end.

Captain is bummed out. I share his disappointment. It'll take a few days longer to get to an outpost now that we have to go back.

Day 8. There was a hole in the ice here. It's gone now. Icebergs must've moved and closed it. We've started broadcasting our position in hopes that someone picks it up. They're joking now, asking me why I chose my last expedition to get lost at sea.

Day 9. We're rationing food and water. Crew is getting ornery.

Day 11? 12? No response. Food's running out. More concerned about water, myself. Don't feel like writing any more.

Day 30-ish, who cares anymore? I'm surrounded by dead men. Pale husks of men slumped on the floor. Some of their eyes still move, but they're dead nonetheless.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.dugongtransmission:
Replaying last outgoing transmissions.
[2451-3-4 11:33] DG-35 calling for Tara colony. Do you read?
[2451-3-4 11:35] Tara colony, do you read? We're taking heavy hits to our topside!
[2451-3-4 11:35] Look at the size of that thing!
[2451-3-4 12:02] We managed to take down the attacker, but the hull is heavily damaged. Requesting rescue from anyone who receives this call.
[2451-3-4 12:06] Hello?
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.traitorletter: This message will be both my farewell and confession. I was tasked to smuggle this sonar beacon on board and turn it on when we were a safe distance away. It turns out it was set to a frequency that attracts monsters. I was promised a shuttle was picking me up when the task was done but they never showed.\n\nThis is the last time I accept a "research assignment" from a big-shoe. Or anyone, for that matter. May they honk in hell.
infotexts.linkwaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.idcarddescriptiontooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.idcardtagstooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.spawnpointjobstooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.spawnpointtagstooltip: Can be used to refer to the spawnpoint in events and human prefabs.
infotexts.reloadlinkedsubtooltip: Reload the linked submarine from the specified file
infotexts.linklinkedsub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.spamfilterkicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.spamfilterblocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.fabricatorrequiredskills.tooltip: Fabricating the item takes longer if your skills are insufficient.
infotexts.reactortipfissionrate: Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine, which generates electricity.
infotexts.reactortipturbineoutput: The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down, and if too low, it will overheat.
infotexts.reactortiptemperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.reactortipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the reactor.
infotexts.reactortippower: How much power is currently being generated by the reactor.
infotexts.reactortipautotemp: When automatic control is on, the reactor will automatically adjust itself according to the power consumption. However, the system is not fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption, so manual adjustments may still be needed.
infotexts.reactor.temperatureboostup: Increase pressure to temporarily increase the temperature of the reactor.
infotexts.reactor.temperatureboostdown: Release pressure to temporarily reduce the temperature of the reactor.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.fuelslots: The reactor needs fuel to generate power. Place one in these slots.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.power: Turns the reactor on or off.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.load: Load is the amount of power the submarine is currently consuming, and output is the amount the reactor is currently generating. The output should be kept as close to the load as possible.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.fissionrate: Fission rate controls the amount of heat generated, and turbine output controls the amount of power generated from the heat. Try to keep both needles on the green.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.automaticcontrol: When automatic control is on, the reactor will operate itself automatically. However, it reacts to power fluctuations slower than a human operator would be able to.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.temperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.steeringautopilotmaintainpostip: AUTOPILOT ON\nMaintaining position. Choose the position to maintain by clicking on the display.
infotexts.steeringautopilotlocationtip: AUTOPILOT ON\nAutopilot is set to navigate toward [locationname].
infotexts.sonartipactive: When active sonar is on, the transponders send out pings that reflect from nearby obstacles. The pings may also be heard by hostile creatures or enemy submarines.
infotexts.sonartippassive: In passive mode, the sonar only listens to sources of sound and sounds reflected from nearby obstacles without actively sending out pings.
infotexts.powertransfertipovervoltage: When the electrical grid is supplied more power than what is being consumed, the voltage rises, which may cause damage to electrical devices.
infotexts.powertransfertiplowvoltage: When there's not enough power available, the voltage drops, which may cause some devices to shut down.
infotexts.powertransfertipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the electrical grid.
infotexts.powertransfertippower: How much power is currently being supplied to the electrical grid.
infotexts.draganddropreports: Drag and drop on a room
infotexts.researchstation.empty.infotext: No material inserted. Insert genetic material.
infotexts.researchstation.refine.infotext: Genetic material detected. Ready to refine. Caution: [taintedprobability]% risk of contamination.
infotexts.researchstation.refine.missingitem: Insufficient material. Insert more genetic material to refine.
infotexts.researchstation.combine.infotext: Unstable combination of materials detected. Proceed with caution.
infotexts.healthitemusetip: Drop items here to use them on the selected limb. You can also use items with the inventory hotkeys or by double-clicking.
infotexts.lowmedicalskillwarning: Low medical skill! The suitable treatments list may be inaccurate.
infotexts.healthlimbname.head: Head
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.
infotexts.giveinhelpmultiplayer: Let go of your character and enter spectator mode (other players will no longer be able to revive you)
infotexts.giveinhelpsingleplayer: The character can no longer be revived if you give in.
infotexts.deathchatnotification: Your chat messages will only be visible to other dead players.
infotexts.dialogreactorfuel: Loading more fuel to the reactor!
infotexts.dialogreactortaken: Hands off please! I've got this!
Hey, we don't need two people at the reactor!
infotexts.dialogcantfindcontroller: I can't find a way to operate the [item]!
I don't know how to control the [item]!
infotexts.dialognobatteries: There aren't any batteries on this boat!
infotexts.dialogleakfixed: Repairing [roomname]. A few more holes to go!
infotexts.dialoggetdivinggear: Need to find a diving suit!
infotexts.dialoggetoxygentank: Need to find an oxygen tank!
infotexts.dialognofire: I don't think there's any fire to put out!
infotexts.dialogsteeringtaken: Hey, I'm at the helm now!
Hands off please! I'm steering now!
Hey, we don't need two people to steer!
infotexts.dialogsonartarget: A target on the sonar at [direction]!
A blip on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.dialogsonartargetlarge: A large target on the sonar at [direction]!
Something big on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.dialogtargetresuscitated: [targetname] is back on their feet again!
infotexts.dialogignoreminorinjuries: [targetname]'s injuries are so minor I don't think I should waste any meds on them.
[targetname] is mildly injured, but I think they'll manage without my help.
infotexts.dialognorepairtargets: What do you mean? Everything is working all right.
infotexts.dialognopumps: The pumps are okay, aren't they?
None of the pumps require attention at the moment.
infotexts.dialognorescuetargets: No one seems to be in need of medical attention at the moment!
I don't think anyone needs medical attention at the moment.
infotexts.dialogcannotreachfire: Can't get to the fire at [name]!
infotexts.dialogcannotreachleak: Can't get to the leak near [name]!
infotexts.dialog.cantupgrade: I'm not able to work on your new submarine until it has been delivered.
infotexts.dialog.upgradepurchased: Thank you for your purchase! I will start working on your submarine shortly before you depart.
infotexts.dialogattackedbyfriendly: What the hell are you doing?!
Hey! What do you think you're doing?
infotexts.dialogenteroutpostwarning: Okay, that's far enough. Get back to your sub and leave right now or we'll open fire.
You people are not welcome here. Get the hell out or you'll be leaving in a duffel bag.
infotexts.dialogstealwarning: What do you think you're doing? Put that back!
Thief! Put it back right now and I'll pretend I didn't see anything.
infotexts.dialogattackedbyfriendlysecurityresponse: Do you really want to take that path?
Hey! This is the last warning!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindrequireditemtorepair: Can't find the tools to do the repairs!
I don't have the tools for the repairs!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindfireextinguisher: I need something to help with the fire! Where are all the fire extinguishers?
Can't find any fire extinguishers on board!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindweldingequipment: Where's all the welding equipment? I can't find any!
A torch, a welding torch... Where are you when I need you the most?
infotexts.dialogdamagewallswarning: Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing?!
Stop that or you'll drown us all!
Are you out of your mind? Stop it or you'll flood the whole place!
infotexts.dialogunidentifiedtargetspotted: I've got a new target! I'm not sure what it is...
infotexts.dialogicespirespottedsonar: Got some ice spires on the sonar!
infotexts.dialogcannottreatpatient: I don't have the means to treat [name]!
I'm sorry, there's nothing I can do for [name]!
infotexts.dialogcantfindtoxygen: I can't find any oxygen tanks!
infotexts.dialoglowonweldingfuel: There's not many welding fuel tanks left aboard the sub!
infotexts.dialoglowonoxygentanks: Almost all the oxygen tanks on the sub are empty! Can we get some of the empty tanks to the oxygen generator for refilling?
infotexts.dialoglowoncoilgunammo: We're running low on coilgun ammunition! Fire short controlled bursts!
infotexts.dialoglowonrailgunammo: There's not many railgun shells left onboard.
infotexts.dialoglowonturretammo: We're running low on ammunition. We should get some more at the next stop.
infotexts.dialoglowonfuelrods: We're very low on fuel rods. We should buy more ASAP, or make some.
infotexts.dialogoutofoxygentanks: All our oxygen tanks are empty!
infotexts.dialogoutofrailgunammo: There are no more shells for the railgun!
infotexts.dialogoutoffuelrods: We're completely out of fuel rods!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindloadable: I can't find the items I'm looking for!
I can't find anything to load into these containers!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindloadable.batterycells: I can't find battery cells to recharge!
I can't find anything to recharge!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindloadable.oxygentanks: I can't find oxygen tanks to refill!
I can't find any tanks to refill!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindloadable.turretammo: I can't find ammo for the submarine weapons!
I can't find any ammo to put into the loaders!
infotexts.dialoglastoxygentank: I'm using my last oxygen tank now.
I've got no more oxygen tanks after this one.
This is my last oxygen tank then.
infotexts.dialogcombatnoweapons: I don't have a weapon to defend myself!
infotexts.dialogcannotreturn: Can't get back to the submarine!
I can't find my way back to the submarine!
infotexts.dialogturrethasnopower: There's no power in the supercapacitor!
I can't shoot! The turret is not working.
infotexts.dialogsupercapacitorisbroken: I need someone to fix the supercapacitor!
infotexts.dialogreactorisbroken: I need someone to fix the reactor!
infotexts.dialognavterminalisbroken: The navigation terminal is not working!
I need someone to fix the navigation terminal!
infotexts.dialogmentalstateconfused: Huh... I must be seeing things.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatedesperate: Shut up. Shut up. Shut up.
infotexts.dialogmentalstateberserk: It will all be over soon.
They won't trouble us for long.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactiondefensive: I won't let you take me!
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactionarrest: I won't let you hurt me!
I have to put you down!
infotexts.dialogterroristannounce: This ship belongs to the Jovian Separatists!
This ship will serve the Separatists well!
You must all die for the revolution!
The Jovian Separatists shall be victorious!
The Jovian Separatists shall rule Europa!
infotexts.dialogoutofpulselaserammo: We're out of pulse laser fuel.
infotexts.dialoglowonchaingunammo: We're running low on chaingun ammunition! Fire short controlled bursts!
infotexts.dialoglowonpulselaserammo: There's not much pulse laser fuel left onboard.
infotexts.dialoghuskdormant: My throat feels a bit sore.
I think I might have a fever.
I feel really weak. Every muscle hurts.
infotexts.dialoginsufficientpressureprotection: I'm not protected enough from the pressure!
The pressure is breaking up my suit!
I'm getting crushed by the pressure!
infotexts.dialogcannottreatself: I don't have the means to treat myself!
infotexts.dialoglowrepcampaigninteraction: Honestly, I'd rather not do business with you people, but I don't have the luxury of picking my customers.
They say I shouldn't be serving you, but I say I shouldn't be turning down a paying customer.
If I wasn't broke, I'd tell you to piss off. But if you've got the money…
Oh, you're one of those people. Although…if there's marks in your wallet, let's pretend you're just a kind stranger in need of my services.
infotexts.orderdialogself.operatereactor: I'll take care of the reactor!
infotexts.orderdialog.steer.navigatetodestination: [name], set the course to our destination!
infotexts.orderdialog.chargebatteries.charge: [name], make sure all batteries are charged!
infotexts.orderdialog.rescue: [name], give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.orderdialogself.rescue: I'll give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems.jobspecifi: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.repairsystems.all: [name], repair any damaged systems! I don't care if you don't have the skills—do your best!
[name], try to fix any broken devices, even if it's something you're not trained for!
[name], repair any damaged devices! Anything you can—I don't care about your training now!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairsystems.all: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.reportbrokendevices: Need someone to repair devices in [roomname]!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairelectrical: I'll take care of electrical devices!
infotexts.orderdialogself.repairmechanical: I'll take care of mechanical devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.cleanupitems: [name], clean up all the items lying around!
[name], put things back where they belong!
infotexts.orderoptions.steer: Maintain position, Navigate back, Navigate to destination
infotexts.orderoptions.pumpwater: Pump out, Pump in, Stop pumping
infotexts.orderdialog.unignorethis: You should consider the target in [roomname] again!
infotexts.orderdialog.reportballastflora: I found weird, fleshy, plants in [roomname].
We need to do something to these things growing in [roomname]!
infotexts.orderdialog.assaultenemy: [name], take care of any enemy you can find!
infotexts.orderdialogself.assaultenemy: I'll take care of the enemies!
infotexts.orderdialog.reporttraitor: Something suspicious is going on in [roomname]!
I think we might have a traitor in [roomname]!
infotexts.orderoptions.loaditems: Recharge battery cells, Refill oxygen tanks, Reload ammo
infotexts.orderdialog.loaditems.batterycells: [name], make sure all the battery cells are charged!
infotexts.orderdialog.loaditems.oxygentanks: [name], make sure all the oxygen tanks are filled!
infotexts.orderdialogself.loaditems.oxygentanks: I'll load ammo for the submarine weapons.
infotexts.orderdialog.loaditems.turretammo: [name], make sure the submarine weapons don't run out of ammo!
[name], load ammo for the submarine weapons!
infotexts.orderdialogself.loaditems.turretammo: I'll load ammo for the submarine weapons.
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.return: [name], you don't have to return to the submarine!
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.fixleaks: [name], thanks for taking care of the leaks!
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.repairsystems: [name], thanks for taking care of broken devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.repairelectrical: [name], thanks for taking care of electrical devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.repairmechanical: [name], thanks for taking care of mechanical devices!
infotexts.orderdialog.dismissed.cleanupitems: [name], thanks for cleaning up all the items lying around!
[name], thanks for putting things back where they belong!
infotexts.thischaractercanthear: This character can't hear the order
infotexts.nocharactercanhear: There's no character that can hear the order
infotexts.huskdormant: It feels as if something was stuck in your throat
infotexts.huskcantspeak: You feel something moving in your throat. You try to scream but no sound comes out.
infotexts.huskactivate: A strange chitinous appendage bursts out from your mouth. Use it to inject eggs into a living body by pressing [Attack]!
infotexts.doormsgcannotopen: This door is controlled by buttons or remote controllers wired to it.
infotexts.itemmsgoxygenrefill: Insert oxygen tank to refill it
infotexts.itemmsgrequiretraining: Special training required to place this item.
infotexts.itemmsgtotalnumberlimited: Too many of this item type placed on this submarine
infotexts.afflictiondescription.internaldamage: There are signs of burst blood vessels and of organ damage.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.internaldamag: You have succumbed to your internal injuries.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bleeding: Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn: The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.oxygenlow: The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bloodloss: The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.stun: The patient is dazed and unresponsive.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pressure: There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.huskinfection: Taken over by a husk parasite.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.huskinfection: You have been taken over by the husk parasite.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.psychosis: The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk: The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.drunk: You have died of alcohol poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiatewithdrawal: Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.opiatewithdra: You have died of opiate withdrawal.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateoverdose: The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.opiateoverdos: You have died of opiate overdose.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateaddiction: The patient is happy enough...so long as they get what they need.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.gunshotwound: The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound, however, is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue, and it's pouring blood.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.gunshotwound: You have died of gunshot wounds.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.morbusinepoisoning: The patient can't breathe at all, and their heart rate is slowing rapidly.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.morbusinepois: You have died of morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.sufforinpoiso: You have died of sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.cyanidepoison: You have died of cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.blunttrauma: The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.blunttrauma: You have succumbed to injuries from blunt force trauma.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.lacerations: The skin is pierced and there are deep, bleeding wounds.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.lacerations: You have succumbed to your wounds.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bitewounds: There is extensive damage to soft tissue in the area and there are asymmetrical, bleeding wounds.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.bitewounds: You have been mauled to death.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.radiationsickness: The patient's skin is red and blistering.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.deliriuminepoisoni: The patient seems agitated, with small but noticeable nervous twitches in their face and hands.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.organdamage: The patient is suffering from sharp pain in their internal organs. There is no visible damage to the epidermis.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.organdamage: Perished as a result of internal organ failure.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.organdamage: You have perished as a result of internal organ failure.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.explosiondamage: The area is colored purple. The tissue underneath feels different than the surrounding skin.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.explosiondama: You have succumbed to your deep tissue injuries.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.nausea: The skin is clammy and the patient is vomiting periodically.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.nausea: You have choked on your own vomit.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.watchersgaze: Seeming confused and slightly terrified, the patient doesn't look good. Could it be a mental breakdown? A stress reaction? There's not much you can do about it.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeath.watchersgaze: Stared to death by a Watcher.
infotexts.afflictioncauseofdeathself.watchersgaze: Stared to death by a Watcher.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.reaperstax: The patient is tormented by painful visions of death and rebirth. Memories of past lives or just a stress reaction...? Consulting a medical doctor at an outpost is advised.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.concussion: The patient seems disoriented and has trouble focusing their eyes.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.disguised: As long as you keep covering your face, others might not be able to tell who you are...
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hallucinating: The things you hear and see appear so real! But are they?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidreaction: Reagent that drastically increases acid burn damage.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.internaldamage.low: No injuries are visible externally, but the sweating and aches suggest something is amiss.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.blunttrauma.low: A light bruise shows where something hit, but it doesn’t look like anything is broken.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.lacerations.low: The cuts look worse than they really are.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bitewounds.low: Something tried to take a big chomp but luckily only caught a nibble. It will leave a scar though.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.gunshotwound.low: The bullet missed all the important bits and went straight through, but the pain is real and so is the risk of infection.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.organdamage.self: You feel a sharp pain in your abdomen. There are no wounds to be seen.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.explosiondamage.lo: The area of skin appears slightly bruised.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bleeding.low: Blood is slowly dripping out from the wound.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bleeding.high: Blood is gushing out at an alarming rate.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn.low: The area is red and dry.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.burn.high: The skin is white and partially charred; this looks severe.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidburn.low: The skin is irritated and raw.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidburn: Parts of the flesh are stripped away by acid; a mixture of red and white mark the edges.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidburn.high: The flesh has deformed and essentially melted away due to high amounts of acid.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.oxygenlow.low: Restless anxiety and headaches hint at low blood oxygen levels.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bloodloss.high.sel: You feel cold and dizzy, probably not far from passing out.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bloodloss.low: The patient's skin feels cold and moist.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.stun.self: You are temporarily rendered unable to move.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.concussion.low.sel: Something hit you so hard your eyes are still shaking.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.concussion.high.se: A massive headache, your ears are ringing and your eyes refuse to focus. It takes a lot of effort to stand upright.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.dorm: There’s an itch in your throat; the source seems to move around.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.tran: Something growing in your throat prevents you from talking; it’s freaking you out.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.acti: Deep down you know you should be worried about the thing chittering and moving about in your mouth. Yet, you feel oddly at peace.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.dorm: A faint clicking noise can be heard occasionally from within the patient.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.tran: The patient is eerily silent, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.acti: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfection.fina: Violent seizures signal the emergence of the husk.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.spaceherpes.self: You feel as ugly on the outside as they said you were on the inside. Karma strikes back?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.invertcontrols.sel: You seem to have two left feet, and your brain disagrees with both. It’s like trying to walk mirrored.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.psychosis.low: The patient insists they saw a spider the other day, but seem otherwise healthy.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk.self: After all… why not? Why shouldn’t you have another drink?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk.lethal.self: Is it time to lie down? Oh the infinite bliss of drowning out your sorrow…
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk.low: This crewmate is in high spirits, perhaps a bit too high to operate complex machinery.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunk.lethal: This crewmate has departed this world mentally, with a grin on their face. You fear the crewmate's life functions will soon depart as well.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiatewithdrawal.l: Teary-eyed, sweaty and fidgety, the craving is growing.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateoverdose.sel: You feel disoriented and struggle to breathe. The world is very cold, even colder than usual.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.opiateaddiction.se: You’re feeling good… so long as the next fix isn’t too far.
You feel feverish. Even your skin feels as though it’s on fire.
You’ve never felt nausea like this, and your body aches all over.
The patient can’t stop vomiting, and they’re showing ulcers and various soft tissue symptoms.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.morbusinepoisoning: You’re gasping for air, but to no avail.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.sufforinpoisoning: The patient is seemingly sick, and without a prompt treatment they will only get worse.
The patient has been poisoned and is unable to move. Unless an antidote is found, the patient will eventually die in agony.
Your vision seems to be getting blurry and you feel the urgent need to regurgitate.
The patient’s symptoms are barely detectable, but may indicate poisoning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.deliriuminepoisoni: You see and hear things that aren't there. They're the effects of Deliriumine poisoning.
The patient is manic, their eyes darting around wildly. They're wondering how you can be so calm, when everything around you is on fire…
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning.m: You feel very very wrong. Have you been poisoned?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning.h: You regret not having invested in antidotes for Cyanide poisoning. Now you die.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning.l: Scanning the patient reveals Cyanide poisoning. Unless administered an antidote, this will be fatal.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning.h: The patient's mouth is foaming and they are rendered unable to move. You could probably steal their valuables and get away with it…
infotexts.afflictiondescription.cyanidepoisoning: The patient is gasping, the skin is blue, and there are occasional muscle spasms all over the body. Their condition is decreasing rapidly.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.paralysis.low.self: You’re having trouble moving your limbs.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.paralysis.high: The patient is completely paralyzed and unable to move.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.nausea.low: Feeling queasy, but nothing a rest wouldn't fix.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.nausea.high: You are really sick. Should you worry about it or just rest?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.watchersgaze.self: You can’t shake it. It will always be there, staring. Would tearing out your own eyes make it go away?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hallucinating.low: There's something strange going on with your senses.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.reaperstax.self: You’re plagued by a sense of déjà vu, and it’s too real. Maybe you should be glad you can only remember your death, and not your birth.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.haste: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfectionresis: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pressureresistance: Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.paralysisresistanc: The patient's body is less affected by paralysis. It also seems to recover from any existing effects.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.increasedswimmings: Oxygen flows more freely into the subject's limbs, resulting in greater swimming speed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.naturalmeleeweapon: A sharp beak is protruding from the subject's forehead.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.naturalrangedweapo: Sharp spikes are growing from the subject's back.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.damageresistance: Subject's skin is hardened and more resistant to damage.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.decreasedoxygencon: Subject's lung capacity is grown, resulting in more efficient oxygen consumption.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.increasedwalkingsp: Subject's bone structure is lighter, resulting in greater walking and running speed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.increasedmeleedama: Subject has gained muscle mass, resulting in greater strength.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.healdamage: Subject's wounds are healed at an accelerated rate.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.vigorondamage: Subject's pain receptors are numbed in response to physical trauma.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hyperactivityondam: Subject's reflexes are heightened in response to physical trauma.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.increasedmeleedama: Subject's adrenaline level is heightened in response to physical trauma.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.husktransformimmun: Subject has gained a heightened tolerance for the husk parasite.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tunnelvision: Subject's eyes are sensitive to light.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.rigidjoints: Subject's joints are stiff and moving is more difficult.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.hypersensitivity: Subject's skin is sore and more sensitive to touch.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.xenobiology: Subject's organs are resistant to traditional medicine.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.outsideinfluence: Subject hears unintelligible voices inside their head.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.glassjaw: Subject suffers from longer periods of unconsciousness when knocked out.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.musculardystrophy: Subject suffers from decreased muscle mass.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inflamedlung: Subject has an adverse reaction to oxygen.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.regeneration: The subject is slowly regaining their vitality.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.repairflow: The subject is in the flow, and able to repair devices effortlessly.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.evasivemaneuvers: The subject has momentarily become a much better captain.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.stonewall: The subject has become sturdier and resistant to stuns.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.clownpower: Only by wearing the mask is the true self revealed.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.soothingsounds: The sounds of clownery have a healing effect on the subject.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inspiringtunes: The subject's skills are momentarily increased.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tandemfire: The subject is gaining combat effectiveness from being near an inspiring ally.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tumbling: The subject's effectiveness with pistols is increased.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.quickdrawing: The subject is prepared to draw.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.dashing: The subject is moving forward, quickly.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inspiredtoact: The subject, ordered by their captain, has become stalwart and able!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.welldrilled: The subject, ordered by their captain, has become better at ship repairs and maintenance.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.battleready: The subject, ordered by their captain, is now a much better warrior.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.downwiththeship: The subject refuses to abandon ship, and will do anything to restore it to its former glory.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.powerattack: The subject is about to unleash a powerful attack.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pickinguptheslack: The subject feels they must work a bit harder to make up for someone else.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pyromania: The subject is enjoying the smell of searing flesh a bit too much.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.tinkerexhaustion: The subject can't tinker with any more devices for the time being.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.bedsidemanner: The subject is feeling very healthy.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.guarded: The subject is prepared for the next attack on them.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.skillfulmelodies: The subject has become better at learning.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.chemaddiction: The patient has grown dependent on performance-boosting drugs.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.chemwithdrawal: The patient sweats and twitches a lot, likely craving their next fix.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.pressurestabilized: The subject is immune to pressure and has no need for oxygen at this time.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.endocrineboost: The subject has gained heightened capabilities, permanently.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.implacable: The subject is unable to fall unconscious.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.lonewolf: You thrive in isolation. Without interference of others, your capabilities are enhanced.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.deputy: Your captain trusts you to take care of the sub in case of their absence. You wouldn't let them down.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.highmorale: Your captain is leading by example. You feel confident and energetic.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.excellentmorale: This crew is like a family to you. Nobody messes with your little submarine family.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inspirationalleade: Your captain inspires and encourages you to learn.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.inspiringpresence: The presence of your captain makes you eager to impress.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.genetampering: Your medical doctor has tampered with your genes, eliminating minor health issues.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.emergencyresponse: It's fortunate food is scarce. It makes crewmmates that much easier to carry to safety.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.medicalassistance: As long as you follow the Doctor's instructions, the patient will be fine.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.miracleworker: Your lifeforces are fading, yet one Doctor shines bright like a beacon. While they're nearby, you won't give in.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.berserker: They've bruised your body and, more importantly, your ego. You'll make them pay. Deal more damage.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.foolhardy: Dang, they sure gave you a beating. But what doesn't kill you makes you stronger. Resist some physical damage.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.revengesquad: They killed our assistant. You don't remember their name, but you will avenge them. Temporarily take reduced damage.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.journeyman: Once an apprentice proves their skill, they can efficiently help the professionals. Gain your primary skill faster.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.loyalassistant: A friend is someone who walks into a room when everyone else is walking out. A loyal assistant keeps working even when you walk out. Increases your crafting quality.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.disloyalscum: The assistant's dedication to their apprenticeship and their master leaves a lot to be desired, but hanging out with the other crew boosts their efficiency. Repairing and skill gains are increased.
infotexts.jobdescription.captain: The commanding officer is responsible for commanding the entirety of the crew and ensuring that everything is running smoothly.
infotexts.jobdescription.engineer: Engineers are the backbone of a submarine's crew, complementing a mechanic's mechanical engineering skill with their knowledge of electrical engineering. They are capable of performing maintenance on the various electrical pieces of the submarine.
infotexts.jobdescription.mechanic: Mechanics are capable of fixing various mechanical devices with their high mechanical engineering skill. Together with engineers they ensure a submarine is working to its fullest.
infotexts.jobdescription.securityofficer: Security Officers are responsible for keeping the submarine safe from threats, both external and internal. The creatures inhabiting the ocean aren't the only threat they need to worry about, as several of the renegade groups opposing the Europa Coalition are known to have sent infiltrators on board the vessels.
infotexts.jobdescription.medicaldoctor: Although usually taken for granted, doctors play an important role on the submarine, possessing the required skill to treat injured or unconscious crewmembers. Their skills can also be useful for creating various non-medicinal chemicals.
infotexts.jobdescription.assistant: Assistants don't have any specific responsibilities or areas of expertise. This job is a good choice for newcomers who want to get a hang of working on board the submarine without taking up tasks that they aren't qualified for.
infotexts.jobdescription.captain1: A veteran of Europan seas, this captain either inspires loyalty in their crew or keeps them in line by force.
infotexts.jobdescription.captain2: Renegade captains are a thorn in the establishment's side. They use a combination of daring and aggressive maneuvers to keep the Coalition off balance.
infotexts.jobdescription.captain3: Captains of the Coalition adhere to a strict set of rules. That doesn't stop them from coming up with new innovations to hunt down their enemies.
infotexts.jobdescription.engineer1: Nuclear engineers are in charge of the sub's reactor. Occupational hazards require them to wear some protective gear against radiation.
infotexts.jobdescription.engineer2: The submarine's fickle electrical systems need constant maintenance. The dubious honor of replacing fuses, hooking up devices with power and taking numerous electric shocks falls to electrical engineers.
infotexts.jobdescription.mechanic1: A mechanic's primary job in Europa is to plug leaks wherever they appear. These guys are trained to keep the hull, devices and equipment in shape.
infotexts.jobdescription.mechanic2: A mechanic variant that specializes in making art (and supplies) out of crude materials.
infotexts.jobdescription.securityofficer1: Commandos are a special breed of security officer. They only have a single purpose: Destroy the enemy, whether it's at range or mano a mano.
infotexts.jobdescription.securityofficer2: These peacekeepers are dedicated to keeping the peace at any cost. Preferably but not necessarily using non-lethal force.
infotexts.jobdescription.securityofficer3: Submarine gunners are trained not only to shoot accurately with coil and railguns but also to keep them in working condition.
infotexts.jobdescription.medicaldoctor1: Administering first aid often requires venturing into dangerous areas. These front-line medics have gear that offers them some protection against monsters and guns, while not compromising their mobility.
infotexts.jobdescription.medicaldoctor2: These doctors are prepared to treat most, if not all, injuries that threaten the crew on lengthy trips underwater.
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.outpost: A group of settlers has ventured into [previousname] and established a new outpost.
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.military: A new military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.none.changeto.research: A new research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.lair.changeto.none: [previousname] has been rid of its monster lair and is now safe for colonization.
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.outpost: An outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.military: A military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.ruins.changeto.research: A research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.locationchange.outpost.changeto.military: A coalition force has moved into [previousname], establishing a military presence in the area.
infotexts.locationchange.outpost.changeto.research: A band of researchers have turned [previousname] into a research station to study the surrounding fauna.
infotexts.locationchange.military.changeto.city: The commander at [previousname] has been appointed governor, making [name] officially a city.
infotexts.locationchange.research.changeto.city: Research laboratories at [previousname] have driven more settlers to move in. It is now known as [name].
infotexts.locationchange.mine.changeto.city: Families of miners at [previousname] have moved in and turned it into a proper city.
infotexts.locationdescription.none: Uninhabited, a potential location for an outpost.
infotexts.locationdescription.city: Bristling with activity and no shortage of supplies.
infotexts.locationdescription.military: Offers an abundance of military hardware.
infotexts.locationdescription.mine: Offers raw materials at discount prices.
infotexts.locationdescription.abandoned: Contact was lost with this outpost.\nRe-establishing contact or eliminating a threat here could net you money.
infotexts.tutorial.tryagain: Do you want to try again?
infotexts.tutorial.radio.speaker: Captain Huskinson
infotexts.tutorialskipwarning: It looks like this might be the first time you've played Barotrauma. We strongly recommend that you give the tutorials a try before starting your journey through the depths of Europa.
infotexts.tutorial.mechanictitle: Mechanic - Glue, duct tape and your nerve are the only things keeping the crew alive.
infotexts.tutorial.mechanicdescription: When the plan goes as planned and the gear works is as probable as the human race leaving this shithole. There are no breaks or rest for you, as everything that can break down, will break down. And if nothing’s broken, then it's maintenance, maintenance, maintenance. Getting to the next destination is all that matters, and you’re the one who delivers. There’s no thank-yous or respect, just snickering and contempt from your "fellow crewmembers"—but that’s okay. This is YOUR survival vessel, and if any of them make it too, well...whoop dee doo for them.
infotexts.tutorial.engineertitle: Engineer - The one who harnesses the power of nature.
infotexts.tutorial.engineerdescription: Power and oxygen, it's like that. Without, the ship don’t move and the lungs won’t breathe. Beyond the fancy talk and costume play, you are the guy who really runs the ship, get it? Trust in the laws of physics and think clear. Also, keep your eye on that damn toy-tinkering wannabe engineer mechanic, and whatever you do, don’t bite into the psycho-babble of the medic. He’s so deep in his softie inner world he’s practically a woman. Captain and security are harmless, and way below your intelligence. Obviously.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficertitle: Security Officer - The backbone of violence.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficerdescription: It is said that pressure brings out the worst in people. Not everybody has your moral strength—hell, most of them are so crooked that it’s questionable if they even should be allowed to live. Channel the crew’s anger toward the creatures outside, but never fool yourself into trusting them. Keep the nukes ready, the handcuffs available, and every now and then put someone in the brig just so they know who’s in charge!
