infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2: “I found some weird eggs in the vents. Dunno what they are but figured they’d mean something for someone like you.” He flashes some eggs but it’s too dark to make out which species. He quickly hides them before you can ascertain their nature. “500 marks.”
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.c2: Do you want to buy the eggs for 500 marks?
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.o1.c1: He carefully places the eggs in your hand. Most of them are actually oversized marbles, but one is a genuine mudraptor egg. “This can potentially cause a lot of damage,” you think to yourself as you stow it safely inside your jacket.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.o1.c2.o1.c2: In the light, the eggs are instantly recognizable as “Velonaceps calyx,” otherwise known as husk eggs.
infotexts.eventtext.blackmarket.nomoney: “Not enough cash? I thought the submarine business paid well...”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.c1: “Hello, fellow traveler!” a pale figure greets you. You’re slightly taken aback by their cheerfulness. “Would you happen to have any eggs of the species Velonaceps calyx? I’ll pay good money for each one you come across in your travels.” Their facade momentarily slips and you can hear them muttering under their breath. You can make out “disgusting meatsack” and something about “ascending.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.c1: You check your pockets. As luck would have it, you have some husk eggs on you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o1.c1: You exchange the eggs for money, which you count immediately. It's all there.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o2.c1: You decide to donate the eggs for free. The person seems overjoyed.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o3: Actually, I'll keep these for now.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.c2: You check your pockets. You're fresh out of husk eggs.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o4: “I don't have the eggs on me but I'll go get some.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist.o1.o4.c1: “I'll be here,” the person whispers. It sends shivers down your spine.
infotexts.eventtext.fanclub.c1: A crowd of teens has gathered to observe the newcomers to their outpost. They’re loudly arguing about which is the coolest job on board a submarine.
infotexts.eventtext.fanclub.o1.c1: They have an endless amount of questions. You answer them diligently, and in the end you have the feeling a few of them are going to grow up to be seafarers. Remember: If they wind up as crawler food, it’ll be blood on your hands.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.c1: Two pale characters with bags under their eyes approach. They’re reaching for something under their clothes. You feel threatened.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o1.c1: The two figures draw out sharp knives and lunge at you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2: “Easy, dear brothers. My time for ascension isn’t here yet.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2.c1: They stop their approach, apologize for the confusion and the three of you grab some crawler cocktails and laugh it off. They share information on this outpost.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultambush.o2.c2: The two figures draw out sharp knives and lunge at you.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo_campaignsta: “We've sold some basic construction materials to the neighbouring outpost, but delivery is on us. A simple transport job; perfect for a new crew like yourselves. What say you?”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo1.c1: “We hired a crew to transport these materials, but they never showed. The stuff is still here if you want the job.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo2.c1: “Got some real 'handle with care' cargo sitting in the bay. Normally I wouldn't trust them with any new face but I hear you've proved yourselves.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo3.c1: “These research materials are sorely needed in the neighboring outpost. It's imperative they get to their destination intact.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killswarm.c1: “No transport ship can leave without running into a swarm of monsters. Take care of the problem and there's a reward in it for you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonstercommon: “There's this especially mean monster terrorizing the caves near here. I've put a little reward aside for the crew that takes it down.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonsterrare.c: “I've heard reports of a gargantuan monster somewhere in the vicinity. If you want to try hunting it down, be my guest. Just make sure you're prepared. It's a dangerous one.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvageartifact.c: “We picked up a signal nearby. The eggheads say it could be something alien. If you check it out, there'd be some marks in it for you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvagewreck.c1: “We received a distress signal from a vessel that was carrying some sensitive cargo. The contents are probably long gone by now but the captain's logbook should shed some light on what happened to it. I want you to recover it.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_killmonster.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvage.c1: “I posted about an assignment earlier. Sent the details to your onboard navigation system too, in case you're interested.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_clownoutbreak.c1: There are flyers with notices for various jobs. One of them is for ferrying a few boxes of clowning equipment to a neighboring outpost. It states: “If interested, imitate your favorite bird.”
A distant sound of a bike horn confirms you as the recipient of the assignment. A container is waiting for you when you leave the outpost.
A distant sound of a bike horn confirms you as the recipient of the assignment. A container is waiting for you when you leave the outpost.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1: An announcement comes over the PA. “Calling the crew of the vessel that just docked. Please send a representative to see the security chief in administration.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1: “You're one of the new arrivals? Good. I have a sensitive issue I can't trust any of my own employees with.” The chief pauses for a second, sizing you up, then continues. “In usual circumstances, I wouldn't ask for help from just anyone, but I'm running out of options. Needless to say, I need you to keep this to yourself. Are you interested?”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.c1: The chief nods. “According to intel we managed to gather earlier, we can expect a separatist prison break soon,” they state, matter-of-factly. “Prison breaks are already a nasty business, but to complicate matters I have reason to believe they have a man on the inside.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.o1.c1: “I'm talking about inside the security force.” It seems like sense of humor isn't how one makes it to chief of security. “To cut to the chase, I need to make sure all my personnel are on the level and take precautions. Here's what I want you to do. Take these microphones and hide them in the crew quarters.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You pick up some small surveillance microphones. “One more thing. I can't permit this kind of surveillance in an official capacity. If you get caught, you're on your own.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.c1: These must be the quarters the chief was talking about.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c1: You quickly stuff the mics in footlockers under the bunks. The sound coming through is a bit muffled but serviceable. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.c2: You toss the mics under a bunk. When you turn around to leave, you run into a security guard. “What are you up to?” they ask.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1: “Oh, just some calisthenics. Need to stay in shape for emergencies.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c1: The guard seems satisfied with the explanation and goes back to their rounds. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2: “You look like you've never done an honest day's work in your life.” They start inspecting undersides of the bunks. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2.c2: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1: You open up a nearby transistor radio and install a microphone inside the speaker, out of sight. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c2: You spot a transistor radio that could possibly hold a microphone. As you're fiddling with it, a security guard calls out. “You! Come here!” You decide to comply for now. “What were you doing?” the guard demands.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “Finally. Make sure K-Rawler comes through loud and clear.” Something will come through all right, you think to yourself. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.c1: In a nearby trash can, there are two small bottles of clear liquid. Both of them are labeled with a different chemical formula.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1: Take a closer look at the bottles.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c1: Neither solution is anything you’re especially familiar with, but you are reasonably sure one of them is strongly acidic. You decide to leave the acid be. The other bottle is a total mystery to you.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. None of them are the same as the one you drank but maybe they can be of some other use.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o2: Not a very sensible thing to do...
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c2: Chemistry makes no sense to you; it might as well be an alien language. After a quick shake test, either liquid seems perfectly safe to you. One of them has a blue label, the other green. Do you want to try one of them?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. Maybe one of these is the same miracle solution!
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o4.c1: The liquid burns your throat a bit when you swallow it. At first, the effect isn’t unlike a good Jovian vodka, and the prospect of getting buzzed while spending no money appeals to you greatly. The situation suddenly takes a turn for the worse when you feel like your stomach is on fire. A sharp pain causes you to double over in agony. Who would’ve thought drinking something out of the trash was a bad idea?
infotexts.eventtext.crawleroutbreak.c1: A panicked researcher runs past you. “God dammit Jimmy, I told you we should’ve went with padlocks instead of these electronic pieces of shit!”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.c1: As you step inside the office, the manager notices you. “I suppose you're here about the situation in the mines?” he asks.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1: “Uh...sure. Remind me what the situation was, again?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.c1: It turns out the miners have halted the work in the mines because of a toxic gas leak. “They're demanding ridiculous hazard pay and we just don't have the budget for that. That's why you're here, right? To negotiate a better deal?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1: “Yes, that's right. Get me in contact with the foreman.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1: “They can probably be found near the main mineshaft. Good luck.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.c1: The foreman is pacing back and forth, loudly arguing with someone on the radio. You only catch the tail end of their discussion. “There aren't enough diving masks for the whole crew. Even if there were, we couldn't waste the oxygen keeping them on all day long. ...No, the ventilation in the mines is connected to the rest of the outpost so we can't risk pumping it out either.” Exasperated, he looks at you. “Are you here about the gas leaks?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2: “What kind of gases are we talking about?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.c1: “Mercury gases. Colorless, odorless, gives you breathing problems real quick.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1: Come up with a solution to help with mercury exposure.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “A combination of iron, Stabilozine and crawler liver should keep your lungs clean of mercury. Take two pills every six hours.” The foreman thanks you for your advice. You collect a considerable reward from the outpost manager.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3: “Tell me more about the ventilation problem.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.c1: “The ducts reach from here all the way to the mess hall and dorms, meaning we can't pump the vapors out. I don't know who installed them originally, but I'd like to have a word with 'em.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1: Attempt to solve the ventilation problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c1: You study a map of ventilation ducts. “Why not install an extra air filtration system right here?” you suggest, pointing to a junction near the dorms. “Should pump out all the mercury before it spreads farther.” And sure enough, it does. You collect a fee from the manager for solving the problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o2: “This is above my pay grade. Goodbye.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.c1: “Do you have the eggs with you now?”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c1: You check your pockets. As luck would have it, you have some husk eggs on you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o1.c1: You exchange the eggs for money, which you count immediately. It's all there.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o2.c1: You decide to donate the eggs for free. The person seems overjoyed.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o3: Actually, I'll keep these for now.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c2: “No, you don't. Please stop wasting my time.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_collectminerals.c: “There's been talk of valuable mineral clusters nearby. We'd like you to see if there's any truth to the rumors.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_mudraptornest.c1: “A couple of divers stumbled upon a mudraptor nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We obviously don't want a swarm of raptors in our backyard, so if you can get rid of those eggs we'd happily pay you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_crawlernest.c1: “A couple of divers discovered a bunch of crawler eggs in a nearby cave. We don't need any more crawlers near the station, so I've put a little reward aside for the crew that wipes out the nest.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_tigerthreshernest: “A couple of divers discovered a thresher nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We don't want to see those things hatching, and there's a reward in it for any crew that makes sure they won't.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_clearruin.c1: “We're conducting research into the nearby ruins, but their guardians are hindering progress. Clear them out for us, would you?”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_scanruin.c1: “A request from the science wing. A nearby ruin needs to be mapped. For a reward, of course.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_beacon.c1: “We could use a hand getting one of our beacon stations back online and transmitting so we can start building a new outpost out there. There's some marks in it for you and your crew if you can set it right.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort2.c1: “A highly esteemed medical expert and their armed escort are looking for transportation to a nearby station. Their safety is of utmost importance.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_pirate1.c1: “A rogue vessel has been preying on our cargo shipments. Eliminate its crew, and we will show our graditude. Take care though, the ship is heavily armed.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort4.c1: “We believe that Separatist terrorists have snuck among the innocent civilians looking to leave on the next transport ship. If you're willing to have your ship act as that transport, you might be able to draw the terrorists out into the open and detain them. Just make sure the civilians survive.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort3.c1: “We have a few prisoners that need to be transferred to a prison on another station. You'll be paid well for their transportation, but be aware that they need to be closely guarded.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_escort1.c1: “Some of the commoners here are looking for safe passage to a nearby station. Escort them over there safely and you'll be paid.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargohuskcult: “Looking for work? We've got some…let's say, research materials that are sorely needed in the neighboring outpost. Get them there, don't ask questions, and we'll pay you.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgeneric.c1: “I've heard a lot about your crew's recent endeavours, and I must say the Coalition appreciates the work you're doing. Not every sub is allowed to pass through this outpost to the deeper regions, but you and your crew are more than welcome to pass.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgeneric.c2: “Looking to pass through the outpost to the deeper regions? The Coalition won't grant a novice crew passage there, and judging by your reputation, you're definitely not someone I'd let pass. Of course if you happened to have 5,000 marks to share with me, my opinion of you would almost certainly improve...”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgeneric.o1.c1: “On a second thought, you seem like someone with potential, so perhaps I'll let you pass after all. Pleasure doing business with you.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgeneric.o2.c1: “Your choice. Maybe it's better for you to play in the kiddie pool a little longer anyway.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgeneric.nomoney: “Not enough cash? Well, tough luck. Maybe you should play in the kiddie pool a little longer to prove us you have what it takes to make it out there.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c1: “You've certainly kept yourself busy in the Cold Caverns. I must say the Coalition appreciates the work you've put in. As you may be aware, this is the last stop before the Europan Ridge. Not every sub is allowed to pass through this outpost to the deeper regions, but you and your crew are more than welcome to pass.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c2: “Looking to pass through the outpost to the deeper regions? The Coalition won't grant a novice crew passage there, and judging by your reputation, you're definitely not someone I'd let pass. Of course, if you happened to have some marks to share with me, my opinion of you would almost certainly improve.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.c1: “On second thought, you seem like someone with potential. Perhaps I'll let you pass after all. Pleasure doing business with you.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o2.c1: “Your choice. Maybe it's better for you to play in the kiddie pool a little longer anyway.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.nomon: “Not enough cash? Well, tough luck. Maybe you should play in the kiddie pool a little longer to prove to us you have what it takes to make it out there.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpatheuropanridge.c1: “It says here you've been helping the effort to colonize the Ridge. For that, we've decided to grant you access to the Aphotic Plateau. Bon voyage!”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpatheuropanridge.c2: “Looking to pass through to the Plateau? I don't know... I haven't seen much effort from your side to prove your loyalty to the cause. A donation would go a long way.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpatheuropanridge.o1.c1: “Ah yes, that will work. You shall now pass.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpatheuropanridge.o2.c1: “Oh? You're welcome to stay in the Europan Ridge for as long as you want, in that case.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpatheuropanridge.o1.nomo: “I'm sorry. I can't accept anything less than four thousand marks. Maybe you should salvage a couple more wrecks. Or whatever it is you do.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c1: “I'll have to congratulate you. Not many make it through the Plateau, much less while being so useful. I'll radio ahead to let you move to the Great Sea.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c2: “I'm sorry, I know you've made it this far, but we can't take the risk to let an unknown crew to wander around the Great Sea. For your protection, you understand.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.c1: “I'm sure it will. That is not an official guarantee by the Coalition nor an endorsement. I'll let the guard know you can take care of yourself.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o2.c1: “I'm sure you'll find a nice duplex to live out your retirement. The radiation shouldn't reach here for a few days at least.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgreatsea.c1: “So you want to enter the Hydrothermal Wastes? Why on Europa would you do such a thing? I suppose it's none of my business. A friend of the Coalition is a friend of mine. Go ahead.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgreatsea.c2: “Do you have clearance to enter the Hydrothermal Wastes? Didn't think so. As luck would have it, we're having a clearance sale right now, if you know what I mean.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.no: “8,000 will convince me. No less. Come back when you have it.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgreatsea.o1: “16,000? What a steal! Here you go.”
infotexts.eventtext.unlockpathgreatsea.o1.nomoney: “This isn't enough. I can't go below 16,000. Come back when you have it.”
infotexts.eventtext.healreaperstax.c1: “I heard one of your crewmates has developed a rather unusual condition as of late, something we usually refer to as the 'Reaper's Tax.' If they're interested, I could take a shot at treating them.”
infotexts.eventtext.healreaperstax.c2: “Oh, I see you're the unfortunate sailor in question! I could rid you of the condition for a measly sum of say, 1,000 marks. How's that sound?”
infotexts.eventtext.healreaperstax.o1.nomoney: Not enough money? Tough luck, this ain't a charity.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway1.c1: Hmm. This box wasn't here before.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway1.o1.c1: It is a regular storage crate found all over Europa, identical to the ones you receive your supplies in. You bend down and try to open it. However, as you start lifting the lid, something slams it back down.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You hold your breath and put your ear next to the crate. You can hear rustling from inside.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You successfully wrestle the lid off. To your surprise, a small crawler jumps out ready to claw your eyes out!
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c2: You successfully wrestle the lid off. Lying on top of a saline shipment is a small creature. It eyes you carefully, then crawls out of the crate and looks at you expectantly. It seems like you have made a friend.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.c1: Noises are coming out of this cabinet. As you approach it, they grow quiet.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.c1: When you open the cabinet door, a harlequin in unusual garb steps out. They greet you formally and explain that they are a messenger.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o1.c1: The jester explains that there is a sunken submarine nearby. It was carrying an item of tremendous value to the Honkmother. The messenger doesn't wait for your answer. Instead, they turn on their heels and leave you to ponder.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.c2: You carefully open the cabinet door, only to reveal a mouth-agape, wide-eyed young person hiding in it. By the looks of them, they are in their late teens.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.c1: “N-nobody special, I guess,” the teen stammers.
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.c1: “Me and a couple of friends snuck on board while you were visiting [location]. I was stuffed in here by them, as a joke.” They sniff. “I guess they heard you coming and ran back into the station. I swear I didn't mean to stay here for this long.”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1: “What am I going to do with you?”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.c1: “W-well, I'd like to go back home. If you don't want to go back, I guess I can hop onto a shuttle on the next station.”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o1.c1: The teen climbs out of the cabinet. “Thanks. I'll stay out of trouble, I promise.”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o2: “You'll get off at the next stop.”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o3: “Come out. You're working for me now.”
infotexts.eventtext.stowaway2.o1.o2.o1.o1.o3.c1: “Are you serious?” the teen whines. Yes, you are. That'll teach them to sneak on board strange vessels.
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.c1: A radio is blaring nearby. A man with a raspy voice is yelling about something.
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.c1: “Well we've all heard about this nonsense about so-called clown brutality. As if for some reason clowns are being sought out and roughed up because of how they look. Let me tell you, it's got nothing to do with the color of their makeup and everything to do with how they choose to carry themselves!”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.o1.c1: In fact, in this latest incident, I can only imagine how it would have unfolded if the jester in question had been wearing a suit and a tie instead of oversized shoes and a ridiculous wig! And instead of running away, they could've gone 'Yes, sir,' 'No, sir,' and they'd be on their merry way right now! But no. The take-away here, dear listeners, is: Clown around and your brains will end up all over the walls.”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.signoff: “And that's all the time we have for now. Remember, listen and obey. Maurice! Hold the cards up! Maur— No! What does that even mean?” The person in the booth sounds very irate. “Maurice, I swear to— What do I even pay you for?” The broadcast suddenly stops and is replaced by static.
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.c2: “Recreational drug use is on the rise, people. Have you heard about “Cult of the Husk”? A bunch of weirdos abusing biohazardous materials? And the establishment does nothing about it!”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.o2.c1: “And don't get me started on casual opioid use that's rampant everywhere! According to trusted sources, the Coalition is putting something in them, making them addicting! Before too long, it'll be your children, squatting away in abandoned outposts, wearing dirty robes, doing whatever substances they can get their grubby hands on.”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.c3: “Dear listeners, if I was the Coalition president, I would walk right into the crew quarters, set up my little podium and say, 'Listen, citizens, if you vote against military spending and a separatist army marches in and blows you up, we're not going to do anything about it.'”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.o3.c1: “You want to cry about your ruined little station? Give us your money next time! Anyway, that's what I would say, if I was the president.”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.c4: “What a bunch of bullshit. Don't believe everything you hear on the radio.”
infotexts.eventtext.shockjock.o1.o4.c1: “It's some weird hermit who's built a makeshift radio station somewhere. Nobody knows where, otherwise somebody would have put a stop to it already. The guy gets on everybody's nerves.”
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra1.o1: Take a look at the ID card.
(The ID card belongs to one Jacov Subra. Where have I heard that name before? Oh well.)
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra2.c1: A worker, presumably on break, is reading the paper. “Hey, you hear about that Subra guy?”
“Jacov Subra. He's a weird guy who put together these—how should I put it—'themed' festivals.” The person rolls their eyes. “Full of husks. Multiple fatalities. He had a high profile trial a while back. You might have read about it on the Europan. Anyway.”
“They caught him here a week ago. From what I heard, he had held another disastrous festival nearby, and was sent to the mines.”

“Good news, until he slipped away again.” A tone signals that the break is over. The worker puts the paper away and starts toward the dock. “I hear they put up a reward for whoever brings him to custody,” they yell over their shoulder.
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra3.c1: “Welcome to the annual 'Church of the Mollusc' festival! Featuring: Sonata Aquatica, Jethro Hull, Irma-Donna, Draft Bunk and many more! With a special appearance by Sacov Jubra!” The word “mollusc” is written on top of a scribbled out “husk.” Seems like the festival is being held nearby. A passerby exclaims: “Draft Bunk is playing! Sweet!”
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra4.o1: “Give up, Jacov! You're coming with me!”
“I'm not going anywhere! I'm innocent! Look, I'll pay you!”
“Been there, done that.” Jacov smiles devilishly. “What makes you think I won't run away again?”
“I can see your heart isn't in this. I'll give you three thousand marks and you let me walk out of here. Deal?”
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra4.nev: “Here's the money. We never saw each other.”
infotexts.eventtext.assassinationofjacovsubra4.run: As soon as the words leave your lips, Jacov hurls a fistful of coins at your head and turns to run away.
“Maybe I'll put a bullet in your leg.”
Jacov is sweating profusely. “Surely you wouldn't shoot an unarmed man?”
“Three thousand for you and we part as friends, right here.”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.c1: The station manager looks at you with haggard eyes. “You're one of the new arrivals? Man, am I glad to see a non-masked face.”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1: “Now that you mention it, there are a lot of masks around.”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.c1: “A bunch of clowns. Let me ask you, you ever wake up in the middle of the night to a sound of bike horns? They don't even attempt any kind of melody, just honking away all willy-nilly. I haven't had a full night's sleep in...days?” They stare blankly into space. “Weeks?”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.c1: “Who knows? I've tried talking to them, offering money, threatening to kick them out, you name it, I've tried it. I think they're content with torturing me and the rest of the crew.”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.c1: “The manager scoffs. “Tell you what. You get them to leave, there's a...” Their eyes narrow as they study you. “Thousand marks for you. One more thing. No physical violence. While I personally wouldn't shed any tears for roughed up clowns, we have rules here we adhere to.”
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.c1: You approach a clown. They stare at you.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.c1: You stare the clown down for a minute. They try to grab your nose but you slap their arm away. You point to the direction of the airlock. With slumped shoulders, the clown shuffles away, their friends in tow.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.o1: It's suddenly very quiet. You report your success to the manager on the radio and one thousand marks are deposited to your account.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.c2: You strain to flex your biceps. For some reason this only succeeds in making the clown laugh in your face and continue their merriments.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o1.o2: You have missed your chance at making an impactful impression and dejectedly report failure to the station manager.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.o1.o1.o1.o2.o2.c1: You try to reason with the clowns, explaining that their behaviour is disrupting the lives of the crew here and frankly, quite unacceptable. Your words fall to deaf ears.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations1.c1: A sound of shattering glass makes you jump. Someone is slouched against the wall, shards of glass at her feet. By the looks of it, it might have been a bottle of rum she was holding. She's muttering under her breath.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations1.o1.c1: No response. You notice she's repeating the same thing over and over. “Bad vibrations, man. Bad vibes.” Drool is slowly dripping from the corner of her mouth onto her jacket.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations1.o1.o1.c1: You're wondering about the person's mental health, when they unexpectedly swing around and grab you by the collar. “Bad vibrations, do you hear me?” A sudden realization dawns on her when she recognizes you as a member of a submarine crew. “You can help me,” she pleads. “We found a relic. Turned it on. In the structure. Deep.” She lets up her grasp on you for a second.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations1.o1.o1.o1.c1: The madness seems to have found it's way back to cloud her mind. “I was first! I know! I got the trophy!”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations1.raving: You wonder what the person is raving about. A relic inside a structure? Something in the ruins? You make a note to check it out if you have time.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations2.c1: Touching the artifact's etched surface causes an almost imperceptible itch inside your head.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations2.o1.c1: For some reason, you find it very difficult to drop the item, and it remains in your hands. The itch builds up into a slight vibrating feeling in your skull.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations2.o1.o1.c1: It's as if you've forgotten how to move your arms. Your head feels uncomfortably warm and numb. It's getting more and more challenging to keep your focus on anything.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations2.o1.o1.o1.c1: You close your eyes. This seems like as good a place as any to have a nap. Jupiter knows you've earned one. You let yourself fall back into a dreamless sleep.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations2.protrusion: As you run your hands across the item's surface, you hit a protrusion. At once, the numbness inside subsides and you are again fully aware of your surroundings. Time to get this artifact somewhere it can be kept safe.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.c1: Somebody is trying to get your attention. “Hey! I've been looking for you.” She looks vaguely familiar. “You don't remember me, do you?”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.o1: “Oh yeah, you're the one with the, uh, vibrations.”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.gotbetter: “So, I got better. Suppose that is because you turned the thing off?” She crosses her arms. “Wanted to come say thanks.”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.anotherthing: “There's another thing. Because I was...unwell, I got booted from the crew I was with back then. I was thinking I could join up with you guys? I'm pretty handy with all things mechanical or electrical.” She looks strong and capable now that she's not being hindered by an external influence.
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.hangout: “Well, I guess I'll hang out here 'til I find something.”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.scrounge: “Oh. Uh, I can scrounge up a few hundred marks if you like. I'll send 'em to you as soon as possible.”
infotexts.eventtext.badvibrations3.o2.c1: “Huh?” She looks confused and mildly annoyed. “No, you're mistaking me with someone else. I ran into you earlier when I was still having...trouble with a certain relic. You know, with the 'bad vibes' and all.”
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor1.c1: A distressed looking person is pacing in circles in the hall. When they see you, their eyes light up. “You're from that sub that just docked, aren't you? Do you take passengers?”
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor1.o1: “I am indeed. What type of passengers?”
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor1.o1.c1: “Just me and Rex. We're supposed to visit nana in the next town over, but for some reason nobody wants us on board.” The person can't keep eye contact for more than a second and keeps glancing over their shoulder.
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor1.o1.o1.c1: There are always vessels traveling these waters, eager to make some extra moolah by taking on passengers. You open your mouth, trying to voice your suspicions about the situation. “Wh—” you start, but the person interrupts you. “I'll pay you three thousand. One when we leave, two when we get there.”
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor1.great: “Great!” they exclaim. “I'll get Rex and we'll meet you on board!” What a happy fellow. Hopefully their money is good.
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor2.c1: You're inspecting the sub when the person you talked to at the station peeks out from a cabin, with a wide smile on their face. “You ready to meet Rex?” Before you can utter a response, the biggest mudraptor you've ever seen jumps out behind them.
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor2.o1.c1: You yell out and reach for a weapon, but the creature only tilts its head and looks at you quizzically. “Isn't he a cutie?” This is Rex? They brought a mudraptor on board? “Be careful, though. Rex gets ornery on long trips. Don't you, boy? Yes you do!” Great.
infotexts.eventtext.manandhisraptor2.c1.c1: Rex is pacing back and forth.
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.c1: As you approach, this bandit throws down their weapon. “Ah fuck it, I give up. Don't shoot!”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.o1: “Too late for that. Say your prayers.”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.o1.c1: The bandit reaches for their weapon on the ground. “Do your worst!”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.o2.c1: “Thanks for not offing me, I guess.” The bandit squats down and wipes sweat off his brow. “I've never fired that, you know,” he says, pointing to the gun on the floor. “Not cut out for this shit.”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.wait: “Wait!” The bandit cries out and jumps to their feet. “Can I come with you? I know a lot about chemistry. I could cook you meds!”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.signingbonus: “All right! We can sort out a signing bonus later.”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.whatamigonnado: “Well what am I gonna do then? Wait 'till another sub comes through guns blazing?”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.o2.o2.c1: “I was captured along with the rest of my crew and sub. They're all gone now.” They scowl. “Eaten. They were used as bait for the crawlers that used to inhabit this place. I was spared because I know how to make morphine and fent.”
infotexts.eventtext.heartofgold.o2.o2.o1.c1: “Give me a break. Like you haven't done any opiates yourself? The way I see it I provided a service and, in return, nobody pointed a gun my way.” A dry smile creeps on their face. “Until you, that is.”
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.c1: The guard takes a long look at you. “Never mind. I thought you looked like someone else. You're free to go.”
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.c1: “Just be careful,” the guard cautions. “We received a bomb threat a few hours ago, by some usual suspects. It's been a while and no bomb has been found, but we advise caution.”
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1: The guard lowers their voice. “Look, you better stay clear of this separatist business. There have been some serious attacks lately. Just come to me if you see something suspicious.”
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.c1: Out of the corner of your eye, you see a pile of scrap electronics.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: To your surprise, the pile of scrap turns out to be a homemade pipe bomb. As luck would have it some wires have come loose, preventing the bomb from going off. You carefully remove the detonator, pick up the bomb and place it in your bag. The guard from earlier should be interested in seeing this.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1.c1: You thrust the bomb to the arms of the guard, who flinches a bit. You recount your experience and the guard thanks you for finding the bomb and gives you a small reward for dismantling it.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c2: To your surprise, the pile of scrap is wired to a timer. You turn it around and see “00:01” displayed on the timer.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.o1.c1: You drop the bomb and dive down onto the floor, covering your head with your hands. Seconds pass by, but nothing happens. Gingerly, you stand up and dust yourself off. Seems like this bomb is a dud. The guard from earlier should be interested in seeing this.
You report finding a bomb in the hallway and the guard immediately springs to action. They thank you for finding and reporting the bomb.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.c1: You see a person crouched next to a vending machine, assembling or fixing something.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1: Find out what they're working on.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1.c1: You sneak behind the person and crane your neck. It seems they're fiddling with some kind of a device with lots of wires. They glance back and jump up when they see you. “Shit! Don't just stand there!”
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1.o1.c1: “It's all right, I guess.” They check their pulse and exhale deeply. “I've been a wreck ever since my medication was pulled. Couldn't afford it, they said. Then they went ahead and installed these fuckin' things.” Irate, the dweller kicks the vending machine.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.excuse: “I, uh...” Their eyes dart around, looking for something. “I'm building a, um...” They're sweating profusely.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.shh: “SHHH! Not so loud!” they hiss. Then they continue, whispering. “Yes, it's a bomb. But it's also so much more. It's a symbol of discontent against our overlords. We must topple the monuments of oppression, like this one here.” They spit on the vending machine. “But that's hypothetical at this point, 'cause I don't actually know how to arm this symbol.”
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.novice: The novice terrorist scrutinizes you for a minute, then warily hands you a bunch of wires. “I think I can trust you,” they say.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.bombarmed: It's only a matter of connecting the detonator wire to get the bomb armed. You hand the bomb to the person and they give you some change and a promise to talk you up to their Separatist friends.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.bombdismantled: You pretend to arm the bomb, but instead you remove some of the wires, making sure the bomb can't go off. The person hands you some change as a reward and promises to talk you up to their Separatist friends.
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1.o1.o1.o1.o2: “Keep it that way. Terrorism is no way of life.”
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1.o1.o2: “Sorry to hear that. See you later.”
infotexts.eventtext.terrorism101.o1.o2.o1.o2: “Keep it that way. Terrorism is no way of life.”
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.c1: This colony is in a hurry. Lots of workers are loading supplies onto submarines. You see a pair of them arguing quietly and gesturing toward you.
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.c1: On your approach, the pair instantly quiets down. Up close you can see an anarchist patch on one of their jackets, revealing them to be separatists. “Didn't you help us out earlier?” the other asks.
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.o1.c1: “You see all that crew running around? A lot of subs here are readying for a dive.”
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.o1.o1.c1: “Yeah, so do we. We sent one of ours to the office to find out.” The speaker shifts their weight and pauses for a bit. “They haven't come back yet, and I'm getting worried. Might've been caught doing something they shouldn't have.”
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.o1.o1.o1.c: “Not a bad idea. Officials here don't know you yet. Just sneak in, see what you can see. Whatever it is, don't cause a scene.”
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.o1.o1.o1.o: “Oh, and if our guy ask you if you've had Versas liver, the answer is 'It's to die for.'”
Peeking into a side room, you see somebody sitting on a chair, handcuffed. Judging by their bloody and swollen face, they've been roughed up pretty thoroughly.
The person is semi-delirious, but they manage to mutter a question: “You ever...ever had V-versas liver?”
“S-shame. I hear it's to die for.” They chuckle to themselves. “You better leave before s-security comes back. If you could let somebody know I'm in here, it'd be s-swell.”
You inform the separatists of the location of their agent. They thank you for your help and set out to rescue their comrade.
“Take th-the scrap of paper from my pocket. M-make s-sure it makes it to safe hands. I better stay here or the pigs smell something's going on.” You take the paper and stuff it in your pocket.

You hand the intel to the separatist. “Damn. This isn't much to go on. The only thing this proves is that the Coalition has started mobilizing en masse and they're searching for something. I could've told you that by just looking around. Thanks for your help anyway. If you'll excuse me, we have a rescue mission to undertake.”
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.c1: “Hey, psst!” You hear a sharp whisper from behind. A person in a clown costume is trying to get your attention.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1: Listen to what they have to say.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.c1: They seem grateful that you're willing to hear them out, but under all that white makeup, you can't be sure. The person is really fidgety and every time they shift, their shoes squeak loudly.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.c1: You manage to gather that a shipment of important materials has been falsely impounded from this clown person's vessel and they're asking for help getting it back.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1: The jester is overjoyed. The box has been taken to the manager's office. They toot a horn as you turn to leave. Weird.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.c1: There is a box of supplies here, labeled “Confiscated.” This must be what the clown wanted. You bend down and pick up the box, then turn around to head back when you see a security guard pointing at you with a stun baton. “Where do you think you're going? That's confiscated materials you're carrying.”
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: You explain that you're helping someone get their unlawfully confiscated cargo back. “Unlawfully? Do you realize you're carrying highly dangerous implements of terror there?” The guard carefully opens the box, revealing a bunch of red and white costumes and an assortment of bike horns.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.o1.c: The guard takes the box from you. “Don't let me catch you trying that shit again.”
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.o2.c: Without saying another word, you turn tail and run. The officer is stunned for a moment, then chases after you.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.o2.c1: You explain that you are a new customs officer here and are transporting the box to a more secure facility.
infotexts.eventtext.censorship.o1.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c: The guard decides it's not worth their time to fact-check what you said. They wave you to continue on.
The clown is happy to see their items back and teaches you a customary clown greeting that you can use to impress other clowns.
The guard is not convinced and takes the box from you.
Sadly, you return to the clown empty-handed.
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.c1:
A gaunt young man walks up to you, a bottle of liquor in hand. Despite appearances, he speaks to you in a peppy tune:

"Hey, the name's Artie Dolittle. You came here on that ship, right? You should take me with you!"
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.o1.c1: “Because I'd be a great employee! I'm good at everything and I'll even work for free! How's that sound?”
infotexts.eventtext.atwitsend.o1.o2.c1: “Oh. Can't blame a guy for trying though, right?”
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1: A passing scientist grabs hold of you. “It lives! Who would've thought it would ever live?” Their eyes are wide open and sporting impressive bags under them.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.o1.c1: “I was too preoccupied with asking 'Can I?' instead of 'Should I?'” They pace back and forth, directing each word to a different passerby. When it becomes clear to them nobody's paying any attention besides you, they turn their attention back toward you.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.o1.o1.c1: “Are you not listening to me?” the hysterical researcher bellows, sending drops of spittle across your face. “A human-crawler hybrid! Oh, it's beautiful! No! Hideous!” They sit down, cross-legged on the floor. “How will the scientific community remember me? As a creator? A destroyer?” they pose to no one in particular. “Dare I say...a god?”
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.o1.o1.o1.c1: Looking at the scientist—now writhing on the floor, gibbering and laughing to themself—you are somewhat grateful that the end comes in your line of work quickly and violently, instead of a slow spiral to madness.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: Their claims of having successfully bred a human-crawler hybrid are obviously fantastical. Although... There is a small part of you that wants to believe. Maybe you could check the lab, just in case?
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.c1: A crawler is sitting motionless in a tank.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.o1.c1: It seems to have been heavily sedated. This is not unordinary. Researchers are known to catch live specimens for research. Numerous scientific breakthroughs have been made using data received from crawlers: medical, gastronomical, psychologica— Wait. Did it just...blink?
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.o1.o1.c1: You tap on the glass three times and the creature opens its eyes. They are remarkably blue and fixated on you. It blinks once, twice… You can't help but feel like the creature is trying to communicate.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: It is a living creature, after all. Why shouldn't it be granted clemency?
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1: It takes a few swings to make a crack appear. The water crashes out along with the creature, who turns its head toward you and nods, before slithering into a vent and disappearing from view. Weird. Did it acknowledge your help, or was it simply a jerky movement on its part?
A glint catches your eye in the now empty, broken tank.
Among the debris, there is a small trinket with alien etchings. You take it. It's time to go before someone starts asking questions.
It's time to go before someone starts asking questions.
infotexts.EventText.captivesouls.c1.o1.o1.o1.o1.o2: You decide to leave the creature in its tank.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.c1: You hear voices from behind a closed door. “...so I just hold down this button?”
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.c1: A low humming voice can be heard in the background, like an old-timey vacuum cleaner. “Basically. Though you should be careful not to overheat it.”
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.o1.c1: “Overheat?” The humming noise grows louder and louder, increasing in pitch.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.o1.o1: Keep your ear to the door.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.o1.o1.c1: The door is blown off its hinges, knocking you down.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: It looks as if a bomb had gone off inside the laboratory. Expensive instruments are strewn broken on the floor and the once-white walls are decorated with streaks of dark red and pieces of brain matter. Two smoking corpses lie on the floor, along with an alien device of some kind. Someone nearby is yelling for a security guard.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1: Examine the device before security gets here.
The device is made of black metallic material and is heavy to hold. There is a handle that your hand fits into, and a button that lies directly under your index finger.
Nothing happens. It seems if this item indeed is the cause of the mess here, it has run dry of its destructive power.
Look for anything else useful in the lab.
You find a shiny capsule that fits into a slot on the underside of the device. You hear footsteps approaching. If you want to keep the device for yourself, it's time to bounce.
Surrender the weapon to the authorities.
Security is happy to take the dangerous device off your hands. They promise to put in a good word for you in the office.
You find nothing. You decide to hold on to the device and leave before security gets here.
infotexts.EventText.occupationalhazards.c1: A man with a hard hat is nursing a drink.
infotexts.EventText.occupationalhazards.o1.c1: You pull a seat next to him and he acknowledges you with a nod. “Here to work?”
infotexts.EventText.occupationalhazards.o1.o1.c1: He chuckles. “Had you pegged as the type. Well, if you're thinking of heading into the mines, don't,” he says and finishes his drink in one gulp.
infotexts.EventText.occupationalhazards.o1.o1.o1.c: “Well,” the worker starts, is interrupted by a hiccup, and continues: “Not any miners with two brain cells to rub together, that's for sure. Not during breeding season.”
infotexts.EventText.occupationalhazards.o1.o1.o1.o: The worker grunts an affirmation. “But when the boss says 'drill' you drill, or you go without food. So I went deeper until I hit something.”
“Mudraptor eggs. Now the whole shaft is overrun with angry raptor mamas and papas.”
“So, is there a reward for clearing them out?”

The man bursts into laughter. “No. What are you, some kind of a monster hunter? Rudy might've had some cash on him but he's down there.” He yelps at the bartender and motions for another beer. “Or a part of him at least.”
You excuse yourself and leave the man in peace. You wonder if you could find this Rudy's body in the mineshaft.
You find a badly mauled body clad in miner's overalls. The name tag says "Rudy."
infotexts.EventText.hognose.c1: You see a man with an eyepatch and a white beard sitting at a table. Some passersby are casting nervous side-eye glances at him. “That's Hognose Huber, sea captain extraordinaire,” someone whispers.
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.c1: The man growls as you approach.
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.c1: He hacks up something from his throat and spits it out. “Had a bit of a blockage. Help you?” Huber squints at you.
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1: ”I was wondering how one gets a nickname like Hognose.”
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1.c1: “Hognose was the name of my ship. Used to run the Hettol-Ihesas-Urghstead circuit.” He sits up, beaming with pride. “Must've had a hundred successful transports. Meds, military ordnance, submarine parts, you name it, I hauled it.”
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: “What happened? It got sunk! By Moping Jack!” Hognose pounds the table with his fist, sending empty glasses flying. “Caught me totally by surprise. One hit, the engine was down. Second, the hull was breached.” He stares through you, into the distance.
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: “I swam,” Hognose states matter-of-factly. “Grabbed all the O2 I could and hopped on a scooter. Had to even leave Ringo, my pet toad, behind.” A single tear rolls down from Hognose's remaining eye. “At that moment I swore revenge against the beast.” He slams down a radio on the table. Noticing your puzzled look, he explains. “It ate my radio mast. I've been all over Europa, trying to get a signal. If I ever find him, it's—” The radio lets out a series of beeps.
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: “It's here! You have a ship, don't you? Up for a hunt, young one?” Hognose is shaking with excitement. “Well compensated of course.”
infotexts.EventText.hognose.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.o1.c: “I knew there was a fight in your generation after all! I'll see you on board.”
infotexts.EventText.nothingtoseehere.c1: An elderly woman waves at you. “Could you be a dear and throw this out for me?” she asks, shoving a handful of trash in your hand.
infotexts.EventText.nothingtoseehere.o1.c1: You're glad to be rid of the old hag's garbage. While unloading your smelly cargo you catch a glimpse of a human finger amid the refuse.
infotexts.EventText.nothingtoseehere.o1.o1.c1: Being up to your elbows in the trash can draws some weird looks from onlookers but they shrug it off. The economy is bad after all. Under all the burger wrappers you can see a lanyard identifying the corpse as a reporter for The Europan, a newspaper of questionable quality. Curiously, their name is scratched out.
infotexts.EventText.nothingtoseehere.o1.o1.o1.c1: You try not to gag at the smell of the garbage and the dead body and rip the tag off. Maybe somebody in security would be interested in this?
infotexts.EventText.nothingtoseehere.o1.o1.o1.c1.o: ”I'd like to report a dead body.”

You show the name tag to the security officer and explain your findings. They scratch their head and sigh. “Look, I've been working security for fifteen years. If a line cook at Irma Burger is found dead, it's probably a crime of passion, an argument gone wrong,” they explain. “The killer may be found, justice dispensed.” They take a look around. Nobody seems to be listening, but the guard continues in whisper: “A reporter is found in the trash, their ID scratched out? You turn a blind eye. There's nothing good to be found in that rabbit hole.”
The guard raises their voice again. “Thank you for your tip, citizen. Five hunded marks have been deposited to your account.”

To the guard's dismay, you ask them to elaborate. “Do I need to spell this out for you? Reporters investigate—” Somebody walks by you, and the guard stops mid-sentence, waits for them to pass, then continues: “and more importantly, they report. Somebody clearly didn't want to be reported on.”

The guard rolls their eyes. “You finally get it. There's a nice reward for reporting a dead body. I suggest you take that, buy yourself some opium, or whatever it is you submarine types like and forget about what you saw. I'll take care of the body.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.c1: "What kind of idiot would interrupt our undergoing experiment in the post-ascension stage?!"
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.c1: "Ah, of course it's a non-believer. Look around, open your eyes. Have you noticed society is slowly crumbling? Food on outposts is scarce, populations are thinning."
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.o1: "So you decided to speed up our demise?"
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.o1.c1: "Our demise? No! Our salvation. Humankind's only way to move beyond slowly being wiped out is by adapting. And the way to adapt is through the Velonaceps calyx, or Husk as you would call it. It takes us beyond the limits of our frail human bodies, makes us something more. A sacrifice now means less deaths in the long-term—probably even preventing the extinction of our whole race! By whatever means necessary!"
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.o1.o1: "The Husk may be the way forward, but not like this… Through voluntary experiments and real science in labs, we'll find our way."
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.o1.o2: "We will find a way to survive. I'd prefer it to be without a parasite in my throat."
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o1.o1.o3: "You may have a point… We'll leave you be."
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o2: "Brothers, you are clearly misguided. The mess you've made here isn't what an Ascension looks like."
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o2.c1: "Oh, so you're one of the cowards who pretend to be on the way to Ascension, but are too afraid to take a proper dive to the deep end? Perhaps we need to silence those weak little human thoughts and give you a little push over the edge?"
infotexts.eventtext.huskextremists1.o3: "The kind that has a post-shotgun to the face experiment prepared for you."
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasewallhealth: Increase submarine hull durability. Makes the walls less vulnerable to damage and allows the submarine to dive deeper without getting crushed by pressure.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasedeterioration: Equipment will take longer to start deteriorating.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaselowskillfixdu: Decrease the amount of time and skill needed to repair equipment.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaserequiredskill: Decrease the skill level required to repair items.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasefabricationsp: Decrease the time needed to fabricate items, but increase power usage.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefabricationsk: Lower the skill levels required for item fabrication.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasedeconstructio: Items will be deconstructed faster. Power usage increased slightly.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaserotatio: Increase the rotation rate of all guns when operated by insufficiently skilled crew.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaseoffseto: Increase the view range of all weapons.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increaseoxygengenerat: Increase the amount of oxygen generated.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefuelconsumpti: Decrease fuel consumption rate. Increase the time reactors can stay at critical temperature before meltdown.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemeltdowndelay: Increase the time reactors can stay at critical temperature before meltdown.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemaxpumpflow: Increase the speed at which water is pumped in or out of the sub. Decreases pumps' power consumption.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefireprobabili: Decrease the probability of fires occurring.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increaseovervoltagere: Resist damage from excessive voltage. Decrease the probability of fires occurring.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemaxcondition: Increases the maximum condition of the item, making it deteriorate more slowly and withstand more damage.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasewallhealth2: Significantly increases submarine hull durability. Makes the walls less vulnerable to damage and allows the submarine to dive deeper without getting crushed by pressure.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasewallhealth3: Substantially increases submarine hull durability. Makes the walls less vulnerable to damage and allows the submarine to dive to abyssal depths.
infotexts.upgradedescription.enablemineralscanner: Displays locations of minerals on Navigation Terminals and Sonar Monitors.
infotexts.upgradecategorynotapplicable: This upgrade category is not applicable for the selected submarine.

infotexts.UpgradeUI.AllSubmarinesInfo: Upgrades are automatically transferred when you switch to another submarine, provided the tier and class of the new submarine allow for it.

infotexts.campaignstore.sellwarningtext: Are you sure you want to sell the items?
infotexts.campaingstore.valueincreasetooltip: Buying the listed items will increase the merchant's balance enough for them to offer more for items sold in the future!
infotexts.campaingstore.valuedecreasetooltip: Selling the listed items will decrease the merchant's balance enough for them to offer less for items sold in the future.
infotexts.campaignstore.reputationtooltip: Your reputation will affect prices. High reputation lets you buy low and sell high. With low reputation, merchants demand more for their goods and offer less for yours.
infotexts.crewhiredmessage: The newly hired personnel will join the crew when you leave [location].
infotexts.purchaseandswitchsubmarinetext: Purchase [submarinename1] for [amount] [currencyname] and switch to it from your current submarine ([submarinename2])?
infotexts.deliveryrequesttext: Deliver [submarinename1] from the nearest colony at [location1] to your location at [location2] and switch to it from your current submarine ([submarinename2]) for [amount] [currencyname]?
infotexts.notenoughmoneyfordeliverytext: Not enough [currencyname] to deliver [submarinename] from the nearest colony at [location1] to your location at [location2]!
infotexts.switchsubmarinetext: Switch from your current submarine [submarinename1] to [submarinename2]?
infotexts.itemswillbetransferred: The items on the current submarine will be transferred to the new submarine.
infotexts.itemswontbetransferred: The items on the current submarine will remain there and won't be transferred to the new submarine.
infotexts.switchingbacktocurrentsub: Switching back to the currently active submarine. No items will be transferred.

infotexts.submarineswitchwithitemsfeevote: [playername] wants to switch and transfer items from the current submarine to [submarinename] with a delivery from [locationname] costing [amount] [currencyname].
infotexts.submarineswitchwithitemsnofeevote: [playername] wants to switch and transfer items from the current submarine to [submarinename].
infotexts.itemtransferenabledreminder: Your items will be transferred to the new submarine when you exit the outpost.
infotexts.itemtransferdisabledreminder: Your items will remain on your old submarine when you exit the outpost.
infotexts.toggleitemtransferprompt: You can change this by clicking the "Transfer items" toggle.
infotexts.lowfuelwarning: There are fewer than two full fuel rods on the submarine.
infotexts.noitemswarning: All the items on the selected submarine have been transferred elsewhere. Are you sure you want to switch to it without taking the items with you?
infotexts.submarineswitchinstruction: You can switch between the submarines you've purchased at the Submarine Switch Terminal, located near the outpost's airlock.
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvote: [playername] wants to purchase [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname] and switch to it from the current submarine.
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevote: [playername] wants to switch from the current submarine to [submarinename] with a delivery from [locationname] costing [amount] [currencyname].
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevote: [playername] wants to switch from the current submarine to [submarinename].
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvotepassed: The crew agreed to purchase and switch to [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarinepurchasevotepassed: The crew agreed to purchase [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevotepassed: The crew agreed to switch to [submarinename] with a delivery from [locationname] costing [amount] [currencyname], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevotepassed: The crew agreed to switch to [submarinename], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvotefailed: The vote to purchase and switch to [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname] failed, with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarinepurchasevotefailed: The vote to purchase [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname] failed, with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevotefailed: The vote to switch to [submarinename] with a delivery from [locationname] costing [amount] [currencyname] failed, with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevotefailed: The vote to switch to [submarinename] failed, with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.voterejectedpleasewait: Your previous vote was rejected. You need to wait at least [time] seconds before you can vote again.
infotexts.faction.coalition.description: The autocratic de facto superpower of Europa, with a distributed bureaucracy and an iron grip on the resources, manufacturing and power within Europan society. They rule by fear, and have a reputation for shutting disobedient colonies and outposts out of the supply loop, or simply subjugating them by direct force. Their motivation is ultimately to preserve humanity, but at any cost, and preferably with the status quo left intact.
infotexts.faction.coalition.shortdescription: The autocratic de facto superpower of Europa, with a distributed bureaucracy and an iron grip on the resources, manufacturing and power within Europan society.
infotexts.faction.clowns.description: Every once in a while, these minstrels, fools and clowns attempt to form unions, and names like "Europan Jesters' Association" pop up. In truth, the Honkmother's children are a less-than-organized lot who simply heed the call of the bikehorn.
infotexts.faction.clowns.shortdescription: The Honkmother's children are an unorganized lot who simply heed the call of the bikehorn.
infotexts.faction.separatists.description: A small, underground organization seeking a more democratic society by any means, from petty resistance to full-blown terrorism, all with the end goal of disrupting the ability of the Europa Coalition to function, and to undermine its authority.
infotexts.faction.separatists.shortdescription: A small, underground organization seeking a more democratic society by any means, from petty resistance to full-blown terrorism.
infotexts.faction.huskcult.description: A mysterious and outlawed religious group with a transhumanist twist, they seek "communion" with the husk parasite in order to usher in a new kind of humanity, one more capable of surviving in this harsh environment, more in tune with the local ecosystem, and devoid of pride, hatred, fear, or complex thought. Hated equally by the Europa Coalition and the Jovian separatists.
infotexts.faction.huskcult.shortdescription: A religious group that seeks 'communion' with the husk parasite in order to usher in a new kind of humanity, one more capable of surviving in this harsh environment.
infotexts.campaignstart:
In the late 20th century, it was discovered that under the icy, irradiated surface of Jupiter's moon Europa lies a vast sea capable of sustaining life. This discovery sent shockwaves through the scientific community.

In the year 2022, the first manned space flight arrived on Europa to discover that the moon was indeed already sustaining life, in the form of hostile sub-aquatic fauna. Besides the wildlife, the researchers faced gruelling difficulties posed by the dangerous radiation emitted from Jupiter and the intense cold and tremendous pressure of the Europan ocean.

Despite all their hardships, Earth-born colonists were able to construct a handful of habitable outposts where a new way of life developed over many decades. A new system of governance was formed by a coalition of the largest, most influential cities on the moon. Different industries made their mark in the new world, including mining, manufacturing and chemical laboratories.

Over the years, Europan society became more and more dissociated from Earth. Fifty years ago, contact was lost entirely, and no more supply ships have arrived since.

Sub-aquatic travel and vehicles are in a key role in this new society, scouting for new inhabitable locations, protecting citizens from creature attacks and establishing supply lines between stations as humanity ventures ever deeper to evade the lethal radiation from Jupiter above. The life of a crewmember aboard one of these submarines is a lucrative one, albeit dangerous and often short.

You have enlisted to serve on a yyyy-class submarine, docked at xxxx. The waters of Europa open up before you—explore, help expand the colonies, and make of this place what you will.
infotexts.campaignend1: Hints of what are to come flash before your eyes: a crystalline space, something coiled within itself slumbering fitfully. But you are not yet ready to fully experience this. Your fate is still being woven by the Undertow.
infotexts.campaignend4: Everything fades to black in this moment... You've just been commissioned by the Europa Coalition at xxxx to serve aboard a yyyy class sub. The waters of Europa open up before you, ever deadlier. A sense of déjà vu overcomes you—have you done this all before?
infotexts.campaignend5: Having reached the end, your adventure restarts from a new beginning, this time with greater peril in store for you.
infotexts.shrinkingmap: As the intensity of the Jovian radiation effect increases, shallower regions of Europa will gradually become uninhabitable and unsafe to travel. Make your way to deeper waters to avoid it.
infotexts.outpostmodulemaxcounttooltip: How many instances of this module can be used in the same outpost.
infotexts.outpostmoduletooltip: Outposts are generated from a combination of outpost modules. If you want your custom modules to be used in outpost generation, you must add them to a content package (i.e. your mod) after saving.
infotexts.readycheck.title: Ready Check
infotexts.readycheck.body: [player] has initialized a ready check. Are you ready?
infotexts.readycheck.serverbody: Server has initialized a ready check. Are you ready?
infotexts.readycheck.pleasewait: Please wait [seconds] second(s) before commencing another ready check.
infotexts.eventeditor.testpromptbody: Do you want to test the saved event in an empty outpost environment?
infotexts.saveradiochannelbuttontooltip: Store the current radio channel as a preset.
infotexts.disableingamehintstooltip: Prevent any in-game hints from being displayed during the game.
infotexts.hintmessagebox.dontshowagaintooltip: Don't show this hint again. In-game hints can be disabled altogether in the settings menu.
infotexts.hintmessagebox.disablehintstooltip: Disable all future hints. They can be re-enabled from the Settings.
infotexts.hint.onadjacenthull.highpressure: The area beyond this door is flooded with water under high pressure. Proceeding without a diving suit may be dangerous.
infotexts.hint.onadjacenthull.highwaterpercentage: A nearby room is currently filled with water. You might need to bring some diving gear with you.
infotexts.hint.onafflictiondisplayed: You've developed an affliction. Afflictions can be treated by pressing [key] to open the medical interface.
infotexts.hint.onautopilotreachedoutpost: The autopilot has navigated the sub to the outpost. Switch to manual control to move closer to the docking port.
infotexts.hint.onavailabletransition.returntoprevi: You have returned to the beginning of the level. Select a new destination to continue your journey, or close the map by pressing Esc.
infotexts.hint.onavailabletransition.progresstonex: You have reached the end of the level. Select a new destination to continue your journey.
infotexts.hint.oncharacterkilled: The character you were controlling has died. Switch to another crewmember by opening the crew list to the top left of the screen and clicking on a portrait.
infotexts.hint.oncharacterunconscious: The character you were controlling has fallen unconscious. You can either wait for another crewmember to heal you or give in by clicking on the button on the top of the screen.
infotexts.hint.ondivinggearoutofoxygen: You have equipped diving gear that lacks a sufficient oxygen source. Put in a new oxygen tank before using this gear.
infotexts.hint.onhandcuffed: You have been handcuffed and your capability to move or interact is limited. Someone else needs to uncuff you.
infotexts.hint.onisinteracting.reactorwithextrarod: Adding more than one fuel rod to the reactor is useful for jump starting it when it's submerged but will produce a dangerous rate of reaction under normal operation.
