infotexts.hint.onreactoroutoffuel: The reactor has run out of fuel and the sub will run out of power. Replace the fuel rod to get power back on.
infotexts.hint.onrepairfailed: Failing to repair a device can cause you harm. Characters more skillful in mechanical or electrical repairs are more likely to succeed.
infotexts.hint.onroundstarted.voipdisabled: Turn on the voice chat in the setting if you want to communicate using your microphone.
infotexts.hint.onshootwithoutaiming: You'll need to aim by holding [key] before using this.
infotexts.hint.onshowcampaigninterface.map: Use the campaign map to select your next destination. After picking a destination, you can choose the mission you want to undertake.
infotexts.hint.onshowcommandinterface: Use the command wheel to issue commands to other crewmembers. Choose an order category, then the order. A suitable person will be assigned for the job.
infotexts.hint.onshowhealthinterface: This is the health interface. Choose a body part to see the afflictions affecting that part. Drag medical items from your inventory to administer them to a body part.
infotexts.hint.onsonarspottedenemy: Sonar is picking up a moving target. Make sure the sub's guns are manned and try to manouver so that your gunners have a clear shot.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.assistant: You're playing an assistant. Assistants are a jack-of-all-trades class. Be helpful where you can and develop your skills.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.captain: You're playing a captain. You should make your way to the command room and start navigating the submarine to the destination.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.engineer: You're playing an engineer. Engineers are responsible for keeping the submarine powered at all times. To do that, tend to the reactor and keep electrical equipment in good condition by repairing them.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.mechanic: You're playing a mechanic. You should keep an eye out on all the devices on the submarine and repair them if they break.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.medicaldoc: You're playing a medical doctor. Take care of your fellow crew and treat their injuries if they hurt themselves.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.securityof: You're playing a security officer. Take inventory of the weapons on board the submarine, arm the turrets in case of an enemy attack and keep the rowdy crewmembers in line.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.brokenitem: All devices on a sub will gradually break down over time, as this one has, and must be maintained for peak operating performance. Equip a screwdriver to repair electrical devices, and a wrench to repair mechanical ones.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.lootingissteal: Items with a red hand icon belong to someone else. If you take them, there will be consequences to deal with.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.turretperiscop: This periscope controls a submarine weapon. Use the mouse to look around and press [shootkey] to fire and [deselectkey] or "ESC" to stop.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.deconstru: Use the deconstructor to break down items to their components. Insert an item to the input slot and press "Deconstruct" to start the process.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.fabricato: Use the fabricator to craft items. Choose an item from the list, and if you have the required items in your inventory, press "Create" to start fabricating.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.gunloader: This loader must be loaded with ammunition for the linked submarine weapon.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.navtermin: You can plot a course for the sub, set the autopilot, control the sonar, and monitor a side view of the sonar returns from here. Click on the sonar view to select direction. Use Mouse scroll wheel to zoom in and out.
infotexts.hint.onstartedinteracting.item.reactor: Nuclear reactors provide power to your devices. Try to keep the "load" and "output" the same, otherwise you'll likely suffer from blackouts or power spikes that damage your devices.
infotexts.hint.onstoleitem: You just stole something. This has hurt your reputation, and worse still, security will need to deal with you.
infotexts.hint.ontryopenstuckdoor: The door has been welded shut. You need a plasma cutter to open it.
infotexts.hint.onweldingdoor: You're welding a door shut. Once it's completely welded, you'll need to use a plasma cutter or crowbar to get it open again.
infotexts.hint.reminder.characterchange: If you wish, you can play as any of your crew by opening the crew list to the top left of the screen and clicking on a portrait.
infotexts.hint.reminder.commandinterface: You can give orders to the crew via the command wheel, which is displayed with [commandkey].
infotexts.hint.reminder.tabmenu: Press [infotabkey] to open the info tab where you can find information about things like your crew, your mission, and your reputation.
infotexts.hint.reminder.toolbelt: You have a toolbelt equipped. Hover over the icon in your inventory to access the toolbelt inventory.
infotexts.hint.onballastflorainfected: One of the ballast pumps is infected with ballast flora. Destroy the root with fire to kill it.
infotexts.hint.onobtaineditem.unidentifiedgeneticm: You've found a mass of unidentified alien genetic material. You can use a research station to process it into something that can be inserted into a Gene Splicer—a device that can be used to augment people with non-human abilities.
infotexts.hint.onobtaineditem.geneticmaterial: You've obtained a vial of identified alien genetic material. You can use it with a Gene Splicer, combine it with genetic material of the same type in a Research Station to refine it and boost it's effectiveness, or combine it with a genetic material of different type to combine their effects.
infotexts.hint.geneticmaterial.useinstructions: You can use the genetic material by equipping a Gene Splicer, and inserting the genetic material into it in the health interface. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material cannot be removed without destroying it.
infotexts.hint.geneticmaterial.onrefiningorcombini: Refining and combining genetic materials has a chance of tainting them, dependent on your medical skill. Combining genetic materials of different type always taints them.\n\nTainted genes cannot be refined or combined further, and using them can have unexpected side-effects.
infotexts.hint.upgradedivingsuits: You are approaching a depth of 4,000 meters, after which normal diving suits will not be adequate to protect you from the pressure. You should try to obtain better ones, such as combat or abyss suits.
infotexts.hint.assignedastraitor: You have been assigned a traitor objective. If you complete the objective successfully, you'll be given a reward and potentially a more difficult (and dangerous) traitor objective later.
infotexts.hint.assignedastraitor2: Be discreet! Others in the crew can vote on who they suspect to be a traitor, and if the majority of the crew suspects you, the objective will fail and you will receive no rewards.
infotexts.hint.traitorsonboard: There may be traitors in the crew. If a traitor completes their objective successfully, they might get to steal portions of the mission reward and experience points gained by the rest of the crew.
infotexts.hint.traitorsonboard2: You can suspect someone as the traitor by clicking the traitor icon in the crew list. If most of the crew correctly suspects the traitor, the traitor's objective will fail and they will not receive any rewards. But if the suspicions fall on an innocent player, the crew will need to pay a fine.
infotexts.hint.repairingsabotageditem: Something's off here. The device seems to keep breaking down despite your attempts to repair it. Could someone have tampered with it in some way?
infotexts.hint.radiojammed: There's nothing but static coming out of your headset—someone might have activated a radio jammer somewhere.
infotexts.hint.onobtaineditem.throwableexplosive: You've obtained a grenade. You can prematurely cook it by pressing [usekey]. Once the safety has been disengaged there's no turning back!
infotexts.talentrequirement.requiretwoabove: Requires two (or more) talents selected from the row above.
infotexts.talentrequirement.requirefourabove: Requires four (or more) talents selected from the rows above.
infotexts.talentrequirement.requiresixabove: Requires six (or more) talents selected from the rows above.
infotexts.talentrequirement.requireeightabove: Requires eight (or more) talents selected from the rows above.
infotexts.talentrequirement.requirespec: Requires a specialization from the previous row.
infotexts.talentrequirement.speclocked: Specialization talents in the same row are mutually exclusive, you can pick only one.
infotexts.talentrequirement.spectreelocked: This specialization tree has been locked by selecting a different specialization.
infotexts.experiencetooltip: Experience is primarily gained by completing missions.\nCompleting missions in a more difficult area rewards more experience.
infotexts.talentname.handsomestranger: Once Upon a Time on Europa
infotexts.talentdescription.tumble: Whenever you ragdoll for at least [seconds] seconds, your attacks with pistols are [damage]% more powerful for the next [duration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.quickdraw: If it has been longer than [seconds] seconds since you've attacked with a pistol, your next attack with a pistol is [damage]% more powerful.
infotexts.talentdescription.bountyhunter: Whenever you or an allied crewmember kills a monster, your crew gains additional marks equal to [percentage]% of the creature's maximum health.
infotexts.talentdescription.trustedcaptain: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain a Coalition Commendation.\nWhen you apply a Coalition Commendation on another character, gain [selfxpgain] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.esteemedcaptain: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain a Coalition Medal.\nWhen you apply a Coalition Medal on another character, gain [selfxpgain] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.camaraderie: Whenever you finish a mission without a crewmember dying, and your crew contains at least [jobcount] different jobs, your crew gains an additional [extramoney]% money and experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.drunkensailor: Gain [stunresistance]% stun resistance while drunk and immunity to the negative effects of drunkenness.
infotexts.talentdescription.trucker: Whenever you finish all your selected missions, gain an additional Coalition Commendation.
infotexts.talentdescription.trustbuilding: Whenever you finish a mission, your crew gains an additional [smallgain]% maximum health, and if all crewmembers survived, your crew gains an additional [largegain]% maximum health instead, up to a maximum of [maxgain]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.bythebook: Whenever you finish at least one mission, your crew gains an additional [moneyamount] marks and [experienceamount] experience for each captured, live enemy human on board your ship, up to a maximum of [moneyamountmax] marks and [experienceamountmax] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.bootcamp: Whenever you finish a mission without a crewmember dying, you gain an additional [amount]% experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.tandemfire: As long as you are manning a turret alongside another allied crewmember, both of your attacks are [amount]% more powerful. Only the closest allied crewmember gains this effect.
infotexts.talentdescription.munitionsexpertise: Whenever you fabricate SMG ammo, shotgun ammo or stun gun ammo, you have a [probability]% chance to gain twice as much output.
infotexts.talentdescription.multitasker: Whenever you gain a skill point, if it’s not for the same skill as the last skill point gained, gain an additional skill point.
infotexts.talentdescription.apprenticeship: Whenever another allied character gains a skill point, you have a [probability]% chance to also gain a skill point in that skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.buccaneer: Aiming with a melee weapon before attacking adds up to [amount]% power to your next melee attack.
infotexts.talentdescription.crisismanagement: The more filled with water your submarine is, the faster you repair devices and swim, up to an additional [statamount1]% repair speed and [statamount2]% swimming speed.
infotexts.talentdescription.vitaminsupplements: Whenever you apply medicine to a friendly character, they gain [healthboost]% health until the end of the mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.cannotfallunconsciousf: Whenever you fall below 0 health, you will remain fully conscious and your attacks are [powerincrease]% more powerful for [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainmedicalskillformis: Whenever you complete a mission, if all crewmembers survived, gain [skillincrease] points in Medical skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainoutputandskillfrom: Whenever you deconstruct an alien artifact, you have a [probability]% chance to gain double output from it and gain [largeartifactskill] to a random skill. Small alien artifacts, when deconstructed, give [smallartifactskill] skill instead.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainexperiencefromarti: Whenever you deconstruct an alien artifact, you and another random allied crewmember gains [experiencegain] experience. Small alien artifacts, when deconstructed, give [smallexperiencegain] experience instead.
infotexts.talentdescription.maxtriggeruntildeath: This effect can only occur once per life each round.
infotexts.talentdescription.maxskillfromtalent: This talent can only give up to [skillamount] skill bonus.
infotexts.talentdescription.expertcommando: When firing a ranged weapon while crouched, you gain [spreadreduction]% reduction to spread and your attacks are [powerincrease]% more powerful, but your firing rate is [firingratedecrease]% slower.\nRecover from bleeding much more quickly.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainmedicalitemeffecti: Medical items you apply are [amount]% more potent.
infotexts.talentdescription.geneticmaterialrefinef: Refining genetic materials adds an additional [amount]% to their potency.
infotexts.talentdescription.stillkickingheal: Whenever you fall below 0 health, rapidly heal normal damage types and remove stun over a short duration.
infotexts.talentdescription.extraskillfromcrafting: Gain [amount]% more skill from fabricating items.
infotexts.talentdescription.medicaleffectiveness: Medical items are [amount]% more potent when applied to you.
infotexts.talentdescription.payextra.monsterandnes: You are paid an additional [extra]% for monster and nest missions.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.fabricatorandde: You can tinker with a fabricator or a deconstructor, increasing their operating rate by [speedincrease]%.\nYou can tinker with fabricators and deconstructors indefinitely.
infotexts.talentdescription.honkinggivesskillgain: Clown Power allows you to honk your horn to give nearby allies an additional [skillgainincrease]% skill gain for a short while.
infotexts.talentdescription.honkinghealscharacters: Clown Power allows you to honk your horn to slowly heal nearby allies.
infotexts.talentdescription.standanddeliver: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain "The Sailor's Guide."\nWhenever you use "The Sailor's Guide," the ally nearest to you gains [skillamount] to all skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.letitdrainreminder: You can only install a maximum of [itemcount] of this item on your submarine.
infotexts.talentdescription.cannedheat: Whenever you play an accordion, the ally nearest to you will gain [allyexperienceamount] experience every second. When they do, you gain [experienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.nuclearoption: You can craft much cheaper ‖color:gui.orange‖Nuclear Shells‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Nuclear Depth Charges‖end‖, using non-spent ‖color:gui.orange‖Fuel Rods‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.quickfix: Whenever you fully repair a device, gain [experienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.maxtriggeruntildeath: This effect can only occur once per life.
infotexts.talentdescription.maxtriggeruntilmission: This effect can only occur up to [maxtrigger] times until you finish another mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.singletriggeruntilmiss: This effect cannot occur again until you finish another mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.increaseattackpowertom: Your attacks are [attackpowerincrease]% more powerful against monsters inside your submarine.
infotexts.talentdescription.cannotfallunconscious: You will remain fully conscious even after falling below 0 health.
infotexts.talentdescription.extramarksonnewstation: Your crew gains an additional [marks] marks whenever you reach a new station.
infotexts.talentdescription.bonuseslostondeath: These bonuses are lost on death.
infotexts.talentdescription.bonuslostondeath: This bonus is lost on death.
infotexts.talentdescription.assistantsdontcount: The deaths of assistants do not count.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainitemonfinishmissio: Whenever you finish a mission without a crewmember dying, gain the item [item]
infotexts.talentdescription.maximumhealthperlevel: Gain an additional [maximumhealth]% maximum health for each of your levels.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainalltalentsintree: Gain all the talents in this talent tree.
infotexts.talentdescription.bedsidemanner: Whenever you apply medicine to a friendly character, they gain [physicaldamageresistance] physical damage resistance and an additional [skillgainincrease]% skill gain, the total duration depending on your medical skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.electrochemist: If you have not been attacked for [seconds] seconds, the next attack you suffer has [powerreduction]% less power and your attacker is stunned for [stunseconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.drsubmarine: Using medical items while crouched also applies [selfinflictpercentage]% of the effects on you as well.
infotexts.talentdescription.combatmedic: Gain an additional percentage to Movement Speed, Ranged Fire Rate and Melee Attack Speed equal to [skillpercentage]% of your medical skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.geneharvester: When looting a monster, there is a [probability]% chance of finding a genetic material on it.
infotexts.talentdescription.researchgrant: Whenever you refine or combine genetic items, gain [marks] marks.
infotexts.talentdescription.melodicrespite: When you play a guitar, you and allies near you gain the following attributes for up to [seconds] seconds:
infotexts.talentdescription.expandedresearch: Whenever you fabricate depleted fuel or a fuel rod, gain [experienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.hazardousmaterials: Whenever you loot a reactor in a wreck for the first time, you will find rare materials.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainskillatlowskill: When you gain a skill point for a skill that has a total lower than [skilltotal], gain an additional skill point.
infotexts.talentdescription.advancedsplicing: Whenever you or another allied crewmember combines or refines genetic materials, gain [experienceamount] experience and a bonus of [skillbonus] to medical.
infotexts.talentdescription.increasemaxrepairelect: As long as your electrical skill is [skilltotal] or higher, you can repair electrical devices [percentage]% past their maximum condition.
infotexts.talentdescription.dontdieonme: The CPR you apply is much more powerful.
infotexts.talentdescription.healabovehealth: As long as you are above [percentage]% health, normal damage types slowly heal by themselves.
infotexts.talentdescription.extraskillfromcrafting: Gain [amount]% more [skillname] skill from fabricating items.
infotexts.talentdescription.scavenger: Whenever you open a container outside your submarine for the first time, you have a [probability]% chance of finding additional items.
infotexts.talentdescription.payextra.cargoandescor: You are paid an additional [extra]% for cargo and escort missions.
infotexts.talentdescription.simultaneousskillgain: Whenever you gain [skillname1] skill, also gain [skillname2] skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.increasereputationgain: Your crew's reputation gains are improved by [value]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.chanceofextraweapondam: Whenever you attack with any weapon, your attack has a [probability]% chance of becoming twice as powerful.
infotexts.talentdescription.extrapowertoharpoons: Gain an additional [value]% attack power with ‖color:gui.orange‖harpoons‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.extrapowertoharpoonsin: If you are in the open sea, gain an additional [value]% attack power to harpoons instead.
infotexts.talentdescription.dropalienmaterialonkil: When you kill a monster while outside your submarine, it has a [probability]% chance of having an additional alien material.
infotexts.talentdescription.warriorpoet: You can write a book.\nTo do this, ragdoll yourself. After [seconds] seconds, you will gain the item [itemname] and [moneyamount] marks for each enemy you've killed since your last book (as royalties).
infotexts.talentdescription.dualspecops: When you ragdoll in water, propel yourself forward in your current direction.
infotexts.talentdescription.beatcop: Doubled against monsters inside the submarine.
infotexts.talentdescription.truepotential: Clown Power allows you to hit characters with a Toy Hammer for a [probability]% chance to implode them.
infotexts.talentdescription.stonewall: Whenever you are attacked, gain an additional [physicaldamagereduction]% physical damage resistance and [stunresistance]% stun resistance for [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.richinknowledge: Whenever you gain a skill point, gain an additional [experienceamount] experience, while your allied crewmembers gain [alliedexperienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.olympian: You gain an additional percentage to the following attributes equal to [skillpercentage] of the total average of all your skills:
infotexts.talentdescription.playingcatchup: If you are [levelvalue] or more levels behind your most highest-leveled crewmember, gain an additional [experiencevalue]% mission experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.skedaddle: Move [value]% faster. When you are attacked, this bonus is increased to [attackedvalue]% for [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.insurancepolicy: Whenever you die from non-friendly sources during a mission, your crew is paid [amount] marks for each mission you've completed since the last time you've died.
infotexts.talentdescription.feigndeath: Enemies will ignore you if you have been ragdolled for longer than [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.stillkicking: Whenever you fall unconscious, revive a short while later and remove all afflictions.
infotexts.talentdescription.crewlayabout: Allies near you repair [repairspeed]% faster and gain a bonus of [amount] to all skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.graduationceremony: Upon creating a new character, retain all of your current experience for that new character.
infotexts.talentdescription.enrollintoclowncollege: As long as you are wearing a full clown outfit, you gain Clown Power.
infotexts.talentdescription.clownpowerdamagereduct: Clown Power gives you an additional [physicalresistance]% physical damage resistance.
infotexts.talentdescription.waterprankster: Clown Power gives you immunity to pressure and allows you to swim [swimspeedvalue]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.psychoclown: Clown Power allows you to attack faster with melee weapons based on how much Psychosis you have, up to [maxattackspeed]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.slapstickexpert: Clown Power allows you to have a small chance to trip randomly when you run.\nWhile ragdolled, Clown Power allows you to reduce the power of incoming attacks by [powerreduction]%, and characters that attack you have a [probability]% chance of becoming stunned for [stunseconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.commando: When firing a ranged weapon while crouched, you gain [spreadreduction]% reduction to spread and inflict [powerincrease]% more damage.
infotexts.talentdescription.phdinnuclearphysics: Your attacks with crowbars are [powerincrease]% more powerful.
infotexts.talentdescription.intheflow: Whenever you fully repair a device, repair [repairspeed]% faster for the next [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.coauthor: You can co-write a book with a Mechanic.\nTo do this, select their character and have them select yours. After [seconds] seconds, you will gain [itemname], and both of you gain [experienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.polymath: Gain a bonus of [skillincrease] to all skills, and you gain [experiencegain]% more mission experience, but you have [maximumhealthreduction]% less maximum health.
infotexts.talentdescription.pyromaniac: Inflict [burnincrease]% more burning damage. Doubled when fighting against ‖color:gui.orange‖Ballast Flora‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.scrapsavant: You can refine [scrapamount] scrap to any alien material.\nGain [experienceamount] experience when you fabricate an alien material.
infotexts.talentdescription.scrounger: When you deconstruct scrap, gain [experienceamount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.miner: Whenever you deconstruct an ore, you have a [probability]% chance to gain double the output.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.fabricatorandde: You can tinker with a fabricator or a deconstructor, increases their operating rate by [speedincrease]%.\nYou can tinker with fabricators and deconstructors indefinitely.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.pump: You can tinker with a pump, increasing its pumping rate by [speedincrease]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.engine: You can tinker with an engine, increasing its torque by [speedincrease]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.loader: You can tinker with a loader, increasing the connected turret's firing rate and damage by [damageincrease]%, while lowering its power usage by [powercostreduction]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.tutorial: You can use a wrench to tinker with devices.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.cooldownreducti: The cooldown period of tinkering is reduced to [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.durationincreas: You can tinker for an additional [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.suppliespower: Non-turret devices you tinker with will always function as if they had power.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.reminder: The device is only affected for as long as you keep tinkering with it.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.duration: You can tinker for [duration] seconds. After you have tinkered with a device, you cannot tinker for [cooldown] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.tinker.overclocking: Tinkering with items damages them, but the effects of tinkering are increased by [tinkerincrease]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.fieldmedic: Every [seconds] seconds, if your allied crewmembers are at [healththreshold]% health or higher, gain [skillincrease] point in Medical skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.curiosity: Whenever you deconstruct an alien artifact you gain [experiencegain] experience, and your crew gains [crewexperiencegain] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.reverseengineer: Whenever you deconstruct an alien artifact, gain double output from it and gain [skillgain] to a random skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.alienhoarder: Your attacks with alien pistols have [powerincrease]% additional power for each alien artifact you are carrying, up to an additional [maxpowerincrease]% power.
infotexts.talentdescription.firemanscarry: You can drag characters at full speed.
infotexts.talentdescription.researchersintuition: Whenever you open an alien container for the first time, you have a [probability]% chance of finding additional items.\nWhile you are holding a large alien artifact, gain an additional [swimmingspeed]% Swimming Speed.
infotexts.talentdescription.commander: Whenever you give an order to another character, apply Inspiration to that character, giving them [physicalresistance]% physical damage resistance and a bonus of [skillincrease] to all skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.commanderreminder: Giving an order to a new character removes the effect from the last character.
infotexts.talentdescription.additionalinspirationb: In addition to other Inspiration bonuses, the ordered character also gains the following attributes:
infotexts.talentdescription.allhandsondeck: You may bestow an additional character with Inspiration effects.
infotexts.talentdescription.atmosmachine: When you deconstruct an alien artifact, there is a [probability]% chance it will instead transform into a random alien item.\nWhenever you finish a mission, your crew gains [experienceamount]% additional mission experience for each large alien artifact on board your ship, up to [maxexperienceamount]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.navydiver: Attacks you suffer are [attackpowerreduction]% less powerful while you are in water.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualityrepair: ‖color:gui.orange‖Welding tools‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Plasma Cutters‖end‖ you fabricate are [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualityweapon: ‖color:gui.orange‖Weapons‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualitybatter: ‖color:gui.orange‖Battery Cells‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualityfuelro: ‖color:gui.orange‖Fuel Rods‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualitytools: ‖color:gui.orange‖Tools‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualitytanks: ‖color:gui.orange‖Welding Fuel‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Oxygen Tanks‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.crafthighqualityexplos: ‖color:gui.orange‖Explosives‖end‖ you fabricate are of [qualitybonus] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainitemsonmission: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain the following items as an additional reward:
infotexts.talentdescription.extramission: You may select an additional mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.lowhealth.effectivehea: When you are below [health]% health, normal damage types are healed [extraheal]% more effectively.
infotexts.talentdescription.lowhealth.regenerate: When you are below [health]% health, normal damage types slowly heal by themselves.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainstructurerepairspe: Repair hulls [amount]% faster with welding tools.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainstructurecutterdam: Deal [amount]% more damage to structures with cutters.
infotexts.talentdescription.findadditionalscrap: Whenever you open a container in a wreck for the first time, you have a [probability]% chance of finding an additional scrap.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainmarksonskillpoint: Gain [amount] marks when you gain a skill point.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainskillspastmax: You can gain skills past their ordinary maximum.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainbonustoallskills: Gain a bonus of [amount] to all skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.reductiontoallskills: Suffer a reduction of [amount] to all skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.increasemaxrepairmecha: You can repair mechanical devices [percentage]% past their normal maximum condition.
infotexts.talentdescription.geneticmaterialrefineb: Refining genetic materials improves their potency by [amount]% more.
infotexts.talentdescription.geneticmaterialtainted: Combining different types of genetic materials is [amount]% less likely to taint the materials.
infotexts.talentdescription.gainmissionxpanditem: Whenever you finish a mission without a crewmember dying, you gain an additional [amount]% experience and gain the item [item].
infotexts.talentdescription.depletedfueldeconstruc: Whenever you or another allied crewmember deconstructs depleted fuel, they gain [amount] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.gaindoubleskillatskill: As long as your [skillname1] skill is [skilltotal] or higher, they gain twice as much [skillname2] skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.warstories: Gain [xpbonus] bonus XP when completing a mission in which you killed at least [creatureamount] creatures.
infotexts.talentdescription.easyturtle: Take [amount]% less damage from attacks while you are in water.
infotexts.talentdescription.logisticsexpert: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP and [moneybonus]% bonus money when completing a [missiontype1] or [missiontype2] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.healthinsurance: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP and [moneybonus]% bonus money when completing a [missiontype] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.mailman: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP and [moneybonus] bonus money when completing a [missiontype] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.protectandserve: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP when completing a [missiontype] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.nobodyimportantdies: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP when completing a mission, if all crewmembers survived.
infotexts.talentdescription.travelingtradesman: Items sold by your crew sell for [amount]% more.
infotexts.talentdescription.camaraderienew: Whenever you finish a mission without a crewmember dying, your crew gains an additional [extraexperience]% experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.downwiththeship: If you are on your submarine and it becomes at least [flooded]% flooded, you gain an additional [swimmingboost]% swimming speed and repair hulls [repairspeed]% faster for [duration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.emergencymaneuvers: Whenever your submarine takes damage from a monster, gain ‖color:gui.orange‖maximum Helm skill‖end‖ for [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.lonewolf: If there are no crewmembers nearby, gain the following:
infotexts.talentdescription.deputy: ‖color:gui.orange‖Assistants‖end‖ nearby get [skillbonus1] ‖color:gui.orange‖Helm‖end‖ and [skillbonus2] ‖color:gui.orange‖Weapons‖end‖ skill and gain these skills twice as fast.
infotexts.talentdescription.bigguns: Deal [amount]% more damage with ‖color:gui.orange‖Revolvers‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Handcannons‖end‖ to monsters.
infotexts.talentdescription.commendations: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain a ‖color:gui.orange‖Commendation‖end‖.\nWhen you apply a ‖color:gui.orange‖Commendation‖end‖ on another character, give them [selfxpgain] experience.
infotexts.talentdescription.yourreputation: When entering a new outpost you have positive faction reputation with, gain [amount] mk.\nDoubled for cities.
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliation: Choose a faction to side with, in order to gain affiliation bonuses for that faction.
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliationfaction: Choose to side with [faction] and gain the following:
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliationbenefit1: Reputation with [faction] increases [reputationincrease]% faster, but reputation with other factions decreases [reputationloss]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliationbenefit2: Earn [amount]% more marks when completing a mission for [faction].
infotexts.talentdescription.campaigning: Affiliated faction shipyards offer [amount]% discount for upgrades and buying submarines.
infotexts.talentdescription.networking: Affiliated faction shops offer [amount]% lower prices. Doubled for faction-unique items.
infotexts.talentdescription.figurehead: Replaces ‖color:gui.orange‖Commendations‖end‖ with ‖color:gui.orange‖Medals‖end‖ that give [selfxpgain] XP. If the character is then below level [level], give them XP to reach level [level].
infotexts.talentdescription.factiondiscount: All services on affiliated outposts give [discount]% discount.
infotexts.talentdescription.leadingbyexample: As long as you're alive, all crewmembers receive ‖color:gui.orange‖High Morale‖end‖ granting the following:
infotexts.talentdescription.inspiringpresence: Crewmembers in the same room that gain a skill point, instead get [amount]. Crewmembers walk [movespeed]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.trickledown: If you gain a skill, so does every other crewmember everywhere. Crewmembers swim [amount]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.steadytune: After playing a ‖color:gui.orange‖Harmonica‖end‖ for [duration] seconds or longer, you and nearby allies gain +[buffamount]% [buffname] for [buffduration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.melodicrespite2: After playing a ‖color:gui.orange‖Guitar‖end‖ for [duration] seconds or longer, you and nearby allies gain +[buffamount]% [buffname] for [buffduration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.family: ‖color:gui.green‖On unlock:‖end‖ Every crewmember gains one level.
infotexts.talentdescription.family2: During missions, if no crewmember has died, upgrades ‖color:gui.orange‖High Morale‖end‖ to ‖color:gui.orange‖Excellent Morale‖end‖, doubling the bonuses.
infotexts.talentdescription.crustyseaman: Recover from bleeding much more quickly.
infotexts.talentdescription.extrapowder: Explosions have [rangeamount]% larger radius and deal [damageamount]% more damage.
infotexts.talentdescription.gunrunner: You move [amount]% faster while carrying turret ammunition.
infotexts.talentdescription.warlord: Inflict [amount]% more damage with ranged weapons for every nearby enemy. Up to [maxamount]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.blooddonor: Whenever you finish at least one mission, gain one ‖color:gui.orange‖Blood Pack‖end‖ in your inventory.
infotexts.talentdescription.genetampering: All crewmembers gain [healthamount]% more health and move [movementspeed]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.assistantdragatfullspe: ‖color:gui.orange‖Assistants‖end‖ can drag characters at full speed.
infotexts.talentdescription.slightlypowerfulcpr: The CPR applied by crewmembers reduces ‖color:gui.orange‖Oxygen Low‖end‖ [amount]% more effectively.
infotexts.talentdescription.medicalassistance: ‖color:gui.orange‖Assistants‖end‖ in the same room have their ‖color:gui.orange‖Medical‖end‖ skill boosted by [amount].
infotexts.talentdescription.miracleworker: Nearby crewmembers are unable to succumb to their injuries unless they give in.
infotexts.talentdescription.blackmarketgenes: Shops on ‖color:gui.orange‖Research Stations‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Cities‖end‖ can sell genetic materials.
infotexts.talentdescription.sellgeneticmaterialsmu: You can sell genetic materials for [amount]% more.
infotexts.talentdescription.junctionjunkie: Gain [bonus] bonus XP when completing a mission in which you repaired at least [amount] electrical devices.
infotexts.talentdescription.machinemaniac: Gain [bonus] bonus XP when completing a mission in which you repaired at least [amount] mechanical devices.
infotexts.talentdescription.stationengineer: Gain [bonus]% bonus XP when reactivating a ‖color:gui.orange‖Beacon Station‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.buzzing: Your reactor's ‖color:gui.orange‖Max Output‖end‖ is increased by [amount]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.cruising: Your reactor's ‖color:gui.orange‖Fuel Efficiency‖end‖ is increased by [amount]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.doesnotstack: Does not stack with multiple of the same talent.
infotexts.talentdescription.betterthannew: Electrical devices you've repaired deteriorate [amount]% slower.
infotexts.talentdescription.engineengineer: Submarine ‖color:gui.orange‖engines‖end‖ have +[amount]% [stattype] per level you have, to a maximum of [max]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.retrofit: Unlock ‖color:gui.orange‖hull upgrades‖end‖ as if your submarine is one tier higher.
infotexts.talentdescription.toolmaintenance: All crewmembers craft tools at [amount] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.residualwaste: Deconstructing an item has a [chance]% chance to give double the output.
infotexts.talentdescription.ironstorm: ‖color:gui.orange‖Tier 1‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Tier 2‖end‖ submarines can be upgraded as if ‖color:gui.orange‖Tier 3‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.repairmechanicaldevice: You repair ‖color:gui.orange‖mechanical devices‖end‖ twice as fast.
infotexts.talentdescription.quickfixer: After you repair a ‖color:gui.orange‖mechanical device‖end‖, move [amount]% faster for [duration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.robotics: Build a powerful (but fragile) drone to watch your back.
infotexts.talentdescription.roboticsreminder: Only [amount] defense bots per crew can be active at the same time.
infotexts.talentdescription.iamthatguy: Inflict [amount]% more ‖color:gui.orange‖Blunt Force Trauma‖end‖ damage with melee weapons.
infotexts.talentdescription.lowhealthstatboost: While below [health]% health, you gain the following:
infotexts.talentdescription.heavylifting: You move [amount]% faster when carrying ‖color:gui.orange‖Metal Crates‖end‖ or ‖color:gui.orange‖Artifacts‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.revengesquad: When you die, your crewmates get [amount]% ‖color:gui.orange‖Physical Damage Resistance‖end‖ for [duration] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.peerlearning: When completing a mission, give the lowest level crewmembers [amount]% bonus XP.
infotexts.talentdescription.miracleworkerreminder: You become immune to ‖color:gui.orange‖Miracle In Progress‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.thewaitinglist: When waiting for CPR, your vitality bar decreases [amount]% slower.
infotexts.talentdescription.thefriendswemade: Turn unhatched mudraptors friendly in the medical fabricator.
infotexts.talentdescription.thefriendswemaderemind: Only [amount] per crew can be active at the same time.
infotexts.talentdescription.thearrival: Once per station, honking a ‖color:gui.orange‖Bike Horn‖end‖ will give you [amount] reputation with [faction].
infotexts.talentdescription.apprenticeshipbase: Choose one job as apprenticeship and gain relevant skill boost of that job.
infotexts.talentdescription.apprenticeshipjob: Choose [job] as your apprenticeship and gain the following:
infotexts.talentdescription.journeyman: You and all crewmembers whose job matches your apprenticeship get [skillamount] of the job's primary skill and earn this skill [skillspeedboost]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.loyalassistant: You and all crewmembers whose job matches your apprenticeship can craft items at [amount] higher quality.
infotexts.talentdescription.disloyalscum: You and all crewmembers whose job ‖color:gui.orange‖does not‖end‖ match your apprenticeship repair, weld and gain skills [amount]% faster.
infotexts.talentdescription.unlockapprenticeshipta: Get all talents from one ‖color:gui.orange‖random specialization‖end‖ tree of your apprenticeship job's talent tree.
infotexts.talentdescription.massproduction: Fabricating items has a [chance]% chance to not consume one of the input ingredients.
infotexts.talentdescription.specops: Inflict double (non-turret) damage against full health enemies.
infotexts.talentdescription.letitdrain: Build portable pumps and install them where you need them.
infotexts.talentdescription.dangerzone: Have an additional [resistance]% resistance to ‖color:gui.orange‖Radiation sickness‖end‖ while wearing a ‖color:gui.orange‖Hazmat Suit‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliationbenefit: Earn [amount]% more marks when completing a mission for your ‖color:gui.orange‖Affiliated faction‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.affiliationfactionremi: ‖color:gui.orange‖Affiliated faction:‖end‖ The faction you have the highest reputation with.
infotexts.talentdescription.campaigning: ‖color:gui.orange‖Affiliated faction‖end‖ shipyards offer [amount]% discount for upgrades and buying submarines.
infotexts.talentdescription.networking: ‖color:gui.orange‖Affiliated faction‖end‖ shops offer [amount]% lower prices. Doubled for faction-unique items.
infotexts.talentdescription.factiondiscount: All services on ‖color:gui.orange‖Affiliated faction‖end‖ outposts give [discount]% discount.
infotexts.talentdescription.emergencyresponse: You move [movementspeed]% faster if any crewmember is unconscious.
infotexts.talentdescription.chonkyhonks: Honking your horn has a [chance]% chance to stun nearby creatures for one second.
infotexts.talentdescription.truepotentialtemporary: Hitting an unconscious ally with a ‖color:gui.orange‖Toy Hammer‖end‖ revives them with [affliction] applied for [duration] seconds. Requires Clown Power.
infotexts.talentdescription.veteran: Gain a bonus of [helmbonus] ‖color:gui.orange‖Helm‖end‖ skill and [otherbonus] to all other skills.
infotexts.talentdescription.medicalexpertise: Gain a bonus of [amount] ‖color:gui.orange‖Medical‖end‖ skill. Your bandages are more effective.
infotexts.talentdescription.evasivemaneuvers: Whenever your submarine takes damage from a monster, gain a bonus of [helmbonus] ‖color:gui.orange‖Helm‖end‖ skill for [seconds] seconds.
infotexts.talentdescription.inspiringtunes: Nearby allies gain a bonus of [skillamount] to all skills for [duration] seconds when honking a bike horn.
infotexts.talentdescription.optimizedpowerflow: Gain an additional percentage to Turret Power Cost Reduction and Turret Charge Speed equal to [statamount]% of your ‖color:gui.orange‖Electrical‖end‖ skill.\nWhenever you fully repair an item, gain a bonus of [skillamount] ‖color:gui.orange‖Electrical‖end‖ skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.elbowgrease: Gain an additional percentage to Melee Power and Maximum Health equal to [statamount]% of your Mechanical skill.\nWhenever you deconstruct scrap, gain a bonus of [skillamount] to Mechanical.
infotexts.talentdescription.doubleduty: As long as you are outside your sub, take [physicaldamagedecrease]% less physical damage. As long as you are inside your sub, gain a bonus of [skillincrease] ‖color:gui.orange‖Medicine‖end‖ skill.
infotexts.talentdescription.craftwithlessitems: You can craft ‖color:gui.orange‖FPGA Circuits‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.orange‖Circuit Boxes‖end‖ with much fewer materials.
infotexts.CheatsEnabledDescription: Cheat commands have been enabled on this server. You cannot get Achievements during this play session.
infotexts.EosIntro0: Following Barotrauma’s release on Epic Games Store, Barotrauma uses Epic Online Services (EOS) to enable crossplay between Steam and Epic Games Store users. Crossplay between platforms makes it possible to host and join servers seamlessly between players on Steam and Epic.
infotexts.EosIntro1: To enable crossplay, you are not required to create an Epic Games account. However, the crossplay feature requires sharing your SteamID and display name with the EOS backend. Additionally, joining servers hosted by Epic players may also require Steam authentication tickets to be sent to the host to verify your identity using your SteamID (and if applicable, such as when playing Barotrauma through Steam Family Sharing, the SteamID of the account that owns the copy of Barotrauma that you are using).
infotexts.EosIntro2: By enabling crossplay, you agree that your Steam account will be registered in EOS’ backend for authentication purposes.
infotexts.EosIntro3: You can disable crossplay later at any time by toggling the relevant option in the Gameplay & UI tab in the settings menu.
infotexts.EosFailedToInitialize: Initializing the Epic Online Services SDK failed:
infotexts.FailedToCreatePuid: Creating a Product User ID for use with Epic Online Services failed:
infotexts.AskHowToProceed: How would you like to proceed?
infotexts.EosEpicAlreadyLinkedToOtherSteamAccount: The Epic Games account you logged into is already linked to a different Steam account. An Epic account can only be linked to one Steam account.\n\nHow would you like to proceed?
infotexts.EosEpicAccountHasPuidByItself: The Epic Games account you logged into is already registered in the EOS backend.\n\nHow would you like to proceed?
infotexts.EosPickDifferentEpicAccount: Log into a different Epic Games account
infotexts.EosAllowCrossplayTooltip: Enabling crossplay allows you to play with players on other platforms.
infotexts.EosPingUnavailable: Epic Online Services does not offer a way to estimate a server's ping, so Barotrauma cannot display it on servers hosted via Epic.
infotexts.EosStatus.NotInitialized: Epic Online Services is not active.
infotexts.EosStatus.InitializationError: Epic Online Services could not be initialized due to an error.
infotexts.EosStatus.ShutDown: Epic Online Services has been shut down. A restart is required to initialize it again.
infotexts.EosStatus.InitializedButOffline: Epic Online Services is active. Online functionality is unavailable at this time.
infotexts.statisticsconsenteostext:
Hello, and welcome to Barotrauma! By default, we do not collect any information about you. If you would like to keep it that way, please click "No" below.

If you would like to let us use your gameplay statistics to improve Barotrauma , click "Yes" to give us permission to collect some data. See a full list of gameplay data we will collect further down. We will store your consent and a hash of your Epic Account ID in our own database, but your information will always be handled anonymously when we use it for development.

To make use of these statistics, we employ the services of GameAnalytics Ltd. and comply with their terms of service. Thus, if you give us permission to use your gameplay data, you must also give permission to GameAnalytics to use your data for quality management and analytics purposes.

You can always change your choice regarding this consent in the game settings. For more information about privacy related to GameAnalytics Ltd., please see the following webpage: ‖color:255,255,255,255‖https://gameanalytics.com/privacy/‖end‖

Please review our privacy policy below:
infotexts.entitydescription.brokendivingsuit: A severely damaged diving suit that could be deconstructed for some raw materials.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_cargo_difficult.c: “Got some real 'handle with extreme caution' cargo sitting down at the docks. This won't be your average transport job, as magnetic suspension crates keep the very volatile contents from a violent and explosive reaction. Ensure the crates are powered throughout the journey, and you will be fine. Think you can handle this?”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvageartifactab: “We picked up a faint signal in the depths. The eggheads are pretty sure it's an alien artifact. If you check it out, there'd be some marks in it for you.”
infotexts.missiondescription.cargocompoundn: A local arms dealer is offering [reward] marks in exchange for delivering a shipment of powerful explosives to a customer in [location2].
infotexts.missiondescription.salvageartifactabyss: Researchers of [location1] have picked up a faint infrasonic signal similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. The weakness of the signal suggests a deep dive to the abyss may be necessary to retrieve the potential artifact.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargonitroglycerin2: Local researchers are offering [reward] marks for delivering very volatile nitroglycerin to [location2]. Magnetic suspension crates need to be powered at all times, to keep the contents stable.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargonitroglycerin2: The unstable explosives have been successfully delivered.
infotexts.missiondescription.cargochemicalsdifficu: Researchers of [location1] need someone to deliver some dangerous chemicals to [location2] for a reward of [reward] marks. Upon loading the crates, it was noted some of the crates may not be waterproof.
infotexts.entitydescription.magneticsuspensioncrat: A vessel in which volatile items may be stored. While powered, it guarantees the contents do not suffer from impact damage.
infotexts.entitydescription.chemicalcratedamaged: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored. It is supposed to be waterproof, but it's in poor condition.
infotexts.entitydescription.volatilenitroglycerin: A highly, highly unstable liquid that will very much explode when subjected to small amounts of heat or physical shock.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems: This is a mandatory security inspection. Just a moment.
Someone's been stealing our supplies as of late. I'll just pat you down quick to make sure it wasn't you…
Hey, you! I need to check your pockets. Hold on for a second.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.nostolenitems: Thank you for your cooperation. You're free to go.
Everything's in order. Have a good day!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.warn: What do we have here? Drop the stolen goods and I'll let it slide this time.
Took something that doesn't belong to you, eh? Drop the stolen goods right now!
Thief! Drop the stolen items now or there will be consequences.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.arrest: All right, have it your way then. You're under arrest!
Want to do this the hard way, huh? Fine.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.comply: You're off the hook for now. But I'll be keeping an eye on you…
Okay, you're free to go. But I'll be keeping an eye on you…
infotexts.versionmismatchwarning: The version of the game executable (v[gameversion]) does not match the content (v[contentversion]). This may happen if you're using a mod that overrides the game executable, and the mod has not been updated to match the vanilla game content. Using a mismatching executable may result in various issues, including crashes and save file corruption.
infotexts.versionmismatch.verifylaunch: Do you still want to launch [exename]?
infotexts.suppliespurchased.deliverymethod: Do you want the purchased items now, or would you like them delivered to your submarine when you depart?
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.c1: Confined to your calamitous coffin, with the same sweaty sailors for company day by day, moment to month. You need to feel freedom, the air caressing your exposed body. It's time to get those clothes off.
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.c2: You finally feel free again! At last! Now, to keep it up for the entire remainder of the tumultuous trip, without arousing too much suspicion or outrage.
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.objective1: Take off any clothes that might restrict or cover you. This includes diving suits, but excludes headwear or gear covering a small part of the body.
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.objective2: Complete the mission without covering yourself. Avoid being suspected of eccentric behavior.
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.success_self: I went an entire mission without covering myself, and there was barely a complaint about it!
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.success: The traitor went an entire mission without covering themselves with clothes or a diving suit. Hats off to them.
infotexts.EventText.exhibitionism.failure: Going without clothes on for the entire journey has failed. Another victim to the shackles of a prude society.
infotexts.EventText.originalhonkero.c1: The Original Clown Experience™. You aren't currently tormenting any crewmembers with bike horns. An absolute disgrace, which you plan to rectify IMMEDIATELY.
infotexts.EventText.originalhonkero.c2: You've found the Bike Horn. “Well done…” you hear your imaginary clown colleagues congratulating you.\n\nNow to find [character] and become their worst nightmare. Of course, all the other crew should think you're innocent, so try not to be too obvious about it. Finally, you should ensure the torment lasts the entire journey, so pausing a bit between honks is mandatory.
infotexts.EventText.originalhonkero.objective1: Find a Bike Horn, then torment [victim] with it. Collateral damage should be avoided, so try not to honk when other crewmembers might see you. Honk [honks] times, with at least a [cooldown] second interval to really let that honk sink in.
infotexts.EventText.originalhonkero.objective2: You obtained a Bike Horn. Honking time!
infotexts.EventText.originalhonkero.success: The traitor successfully tormented one crewmember.
infotexts.traitorobjective.originalhonkero.torment: Torment your victim with your Bike Horn
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.c1: “Who laughs last…” you mumbled to yourself as you walked through the airlock, into the submarine. They pulled the classic “broken airlock” prank on you, and you did for a moment there think you'd be flushed, crushed and imploded.\n\nLet's see how they react to one of the true classics: the blank ammunition prank. You just need to sabotage one of the coilgun's ammunition boxes a bit…
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.c2: You tinkered a bit with the coilgun's ammunition box, meaning it's now utterly useless to kill enemies with. For good measure, you installed some bike horns in there, because why not. If the bike horns sound, you know your prank was successful.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.c3: The sound of a honk emanating from the tampered ammunition box fills you with joy. Your prank was a success! While you feel like laughing out loud and rubbing it in their faces, you are aware of the potential repercussions. Better wait a day or two, and have a laugh about it later.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.objective1: You plan to prank your crewmembers by replacing a coilgun ammunition box with a version that just has blanks. First, obtain a coilgun ammo box, then insert it into a loader and make sure your crew tries to engage an enemy with it.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.objective2: You successfully replaced an ammo box with blanks. It is indistinguishable from the real thing. Insert it into a loader and make sure it is fired [shotsfired] times by someone other than you.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.objective3: The sabotaged coilgun ammunition box has been loaded—now you just need to make sure the blanks are fired [shotsfired] times by someone other than you.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.success_self: You successfully pranked the crew with blanks.
infotexts.EventText.firingblanks.success: The traitor successfully pranked the crew with blanks.
infotexts.traitorobjective.firingblanks.insertammo: Insert the blanks into a loader
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.c1:
Oof. You feel the lightness of your pockets. “That wretched [victim] did it again…” Foul play HAS to be involved—how can you be this unlucky ALL the time? On the other hand, luck always seems to be in the favor of that wretched [victim]. You know you weren't the only one who lost money yesterday, although the shady gambling room made it hard to see who else was there.

Maybe you can get some of your money back in an old-fashioned robbery. You can play unfair too.

The gambling event was called “[codeword],” so mentioning the “[codeword]” incident might help you identify possible co-conspirators.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.c2: Welp. You are all out of money again, thanks to this gambling event aptly named “[codeword].” Luckily you still have those bandanas from last time this happened, so you can just take the money right back and call it even.\n\nNow, if only you could identify who actually took your money. Unfortunately the lighting was rather dim, but perhaps mentioning “[codeword]” will get you some information from a crewmember.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.c3: You have your masks, and you have your target. “Let's go…” you and your accomplice whisper to each other. You just have to isolate the [victim] and get your money back. The rest of the crew might disapprove, so make it inconspicuous.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.c4: Robbery successful! Now, better find a way to avoid getting accused of treachery…
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.objective1: Find your accomplice to rob your target with.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.objective2: The target is [victim]. Ensure your accomplice knows who you're robbing.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.objective3: You have bandanas. Share them with your accomplice in order to stay hidden.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.objective4: You're ready to go. Isolate your target, knock them unconscious with a blunt tool or weapon, and rob them!
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.objective5: You successfully robbed your target. Now deny or deflect any accusations!
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.success_self: You and your accomplice successfully robbed the target. And got away with it, too!
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.success: Two robbers successfully stole from their target without getting accused.
infotexts.EventText.clobberyrobbery.failure: The two robbers were caught attempting to steal from their target.
infotexts.traitorobjective.clobberyrobbery.bluntda: Use a blunt instrument to knock the victim unconscious
infotexts.traitorobjective.clobberyrobbery.robvict: Rob the victim while they're unconscious
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.c1: You've gotten yourself in quite a preduckament. All signs induckate yet another preducktable trip from outpost to outpost. Without feather ado, you started Operation: “[codeword].” You do reckon you need some help, and you already know who fits the bill.\n\nYou ducktate to them what to do: “What's this? A submarine woefully underpopulated by ducks?!…”
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.c2: “…A large influx of DUCKS outta put a stop to that.”\n\nAfter a very seducktive speech, the leader of Operation: “[codeword]” promptly quacked off. You were convinced from the words “more ducks,” but you didn't get all the plan details nor their identity. Waddle we do now? Mentioning “[codeword]” might be a good start.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.c3: You found the a-duck-ately large stash of ducks. Time to get producktive and fill up the ballast tanks with them.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.objective1: Find the duck stash. Guide your partners of misconduckt to the stash. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify them.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.objective2: Follow the lead of the operation leader. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify them.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.objective4: Finish the mission with an a-duck-ate number of ducks. Ensure nobody removes the ducks (or replenish them if necessary).
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.objective6: Duckies are endangered! Replenish the ballast tanks!
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.objective7: Fill ballast tanks with [number] ducks. Progress is being made.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.success_self: You and your partners of misconduckt successfully duckified the ballast tanks.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.success: Fowl play! Two ducking traitors successfully duckified the ballast tanks.
infotexts.EventText.ducksideofthemoon.failure: All signs in-duck-ate two traitors failed at their fowl play.
infotexts.traitorobjective.ducksideofthemoon.compl: A-duck-ate number of ducks in ballast
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.c1:
You wake up from a fever dream. Beads of sweat have collected on your forehead, but you're not bothered by all that. You still remember your dream vividly, and it must have had some meaning to it. In it, a person taken over by the husk infection slowly approached you, and you had no way to move—your limbs were completely frozen. But! Instead of brutally attacking and murdering you, the Velonaceps calyx radiated calmness and compassion. They WANT to save us, if we'll let them!

As long as we show our faith and truly BELIEVE, we can do anything. Although your crew is full of blasphemous non-believers, you'll ensure the submarine will be turned into a temple worthy of the husks' blessing. You do hope you might enlist some people to your cause, though.

Studies have shown that believing in husks as saviors can be linked to an interest in [codeword]. Mentioning [codeword] might find you some allies.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.c2: One of your crewmembers was having a fever dream last night; you could hear their shouts and screams followed by an eerie calmness and murmurs of “praise the husks.”Seems like someone found their religion in their dreams and, you won't lie, you're kinda into that. Lacking any kind of conviction yourself, you often look for others to follow, sometimes just to interrupt the tedious day-to-day grind. Sounds like you found yourself a new temporary source of entertainment.\n\nStudies have shown that believing in husks as saviors can be linked to an interest in [codeword]. Mentioning [codeword] might get you involved.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.c3: You found a miraculously infinite stash of husk figurines! Surely a sign you're on the right track. Better inform your fellow cultists of this…
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.c4: The submarine has been transformed into a temple worshipping the Velonaceps calyx, and rather tastefully too. However, clearly this is not enough, as a new idea popped into your head: Prove the power of the husks by replacing the fuel rod in the reactor with a husk figurine.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.c5: Guess your faith in the husks might have been a bit overrated and not actually capable of magically fueling the nuclear reactor. That's not really part of the Church of Husk's faith anyways, you remember now. Oh well, it was just a fever dream, after all. Time to move on.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective1: Turn the submarine into a shrine to worship the Velonaceps calyx. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow husk worshippers.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective2: Follow the lead of the group leader. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify the leader and fellow husk worshippers.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective3: Use the miraculously near-infinite stash of husk figurines to sanctify the submarine. Attach husk figurines in [percentage]% of the rooms in the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective4: Replace the fuel rod in the nuclear reactor with a husk figurine.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective5: You're all done! Hopefully you haven't been acting so suspiciously that anyone would accuse you of treason.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.objective6: Use the miraculously near-infinite stash of husk figurines to sanctify the submarine. You're halfway there!
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.success_self: You and your co-conspirators successfully represented your faith. Unfortunately the reactor still seems to prefer fuel rods over figurines.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.success: Traitors decorated the submarine with figurines and replaced the fuel rod. To what end? Only those silly husk worshippers would know.
infotexts.EventText.poweredbyfaith.failure: Traitors tried to use husk figurines as an alternative to fuel rods. A bad idea and a worse execution.
infotexts.traitorobjective.poweredbyfaith.fuel: Replace the fuel rods in the reactor
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.c1: You were contacted by the Church of Husk: “We acknowledge having a symbiote growing inside your throat may be a bit scary for some people, so we would like to research the psychological effects of the threat of the husk infection, in order to be able to treat it effectively…”\n\nAttached with the message were three syringes, two of which don't do anything, one of which contains the Velonaceps calyx in advanced stages. You'll be running the “[codeword]” test group, for a small monetary reward.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.c2: You were contacted by the Church of Husk: “We acknowledge having a symbiote growing inside your throat may be a bit scary for some people, so we would like to research the psychological effects of the threat of the husk infection, in order to be able to treat it effectively…”\n\nThe message states you are part of the “[codeword]” test group. You'll be given a randomized syringe to inject yourself with that either contains the Velonaceps calyx, also known as husk infection, or does absolutely nothing. Find your group leader to take part, and receive a small monetary reward.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.c3: You have your syringe—now it's time to inject yourself. Try to be subtle about it, as the rest of the crew might not appreciate such risks.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.objective1: Hand out two of the three syringes to the test group. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow testers.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.objective2: Receive a syringe from the test group's leader. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow testers.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.objective4: Survive, help your fellow testers to survive, and deflect any accusations.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.success_self: You and your fellow test subjects gathered useful data on the psychological effects of husk infections.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.success: Some treasonous lackeys of the Church of Husk gathered useful data on the psychological effects of husk infections.
infotexts.EventText.huskroulette.failure: Traitors were tasked to gather useful data on the psychological effects of husk infections, but did not complete this task.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.c1:
Tack-tack-tack-tack. With chattering teeth you practically embrace the somewhat heated pipes running along the walls of the submarine. The chill air sends shivers through your spine, and you frantically try to rub your hands together before they go numb. “Why is it always so darned cold here?” you think to yourself. “Would turning up the heating just a tiny bit really hurt our fuel consumption?!”

In the distance, you see a fellow crewmember buried in blankets, and hear a familiar sound: “tack-tack-tack.” Perhaps together you could heat up the submarine?

You vaguely recall someone else complaining about the cold earlier on the radio too. Perhaps you could all heat up the submarine? Use the codeword “[codeword]” to find the other freezing crewmates.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.c2: Looks like someone stashed strong booze in the hidden compartment. This should come in useful.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.objective1: Light fires aboard the submarine simultaneously with your co-conspirator. Use the codeword “[codeword]” to identify fellow traitors.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.objective2: Find items to help you start a fire.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.objective3: Have fire raging in a total of [rooms] different rooms, at the same time.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.objective4: Have fire raging in a total of [rooms] different rooms, at the same time. The submarine is getting warmer—repeat [amount] more times.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.objective5: Aah, the warmth is spreading through your body. You feel revitalized.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.success_self: You and your co-conspirators finally feel warm again. All it took was setting half the submarine alight for a mere moment!
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.success: Traitors successfully set the submarine aflame to warm themselves up.
infotexts.EventText.gnawingcold.failure: Traitors failed to warm themselves up enough.
infotexts.traitorobjective.gnawingcold.waitfornofi: Wait for the fires to go out
infotexts.EventText.deepdiverducks.c2: You have created [number] prototype ducks as requested. They're magnificent.
infotexts.EventText.divinelabor.c2: You have devotedly created [number] husk figurines and you're sad to have to part with them.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.objective1: Find the empty vials, then collect blood samples from half of your crewmates.
infotexts.EventText.bloodsamples.c3: You've now collected blood samples from half the crew. The Church of Husk will be pleased.
infotexts.talentdescription.otherassistantxpbonus: Other assistants receive [bonus]% bonus XP that stacks up to [max]%.
infotexts.talentdescription.starterquest: Complete a task to receive a boost to the related skill and XP:
infotexts.talentdescription.starterquest.repairjun: - Repair a junction box (+[xpbonus] XP and +[skillbonus] [skill])
infotexts.talentdescription.jengamaster: Interacting with cabinets on the submarine permanently increases that cabinet's stack sizes by +[amount].
infotexts.talentdescription.mule: Stackable materials can have +[amount] items per stack in your inventory.
infotexts.meetsbonusrequirementtwice: Has a [chance]% chance to be [quality] and [chance2]% chance to be [quality2].
infotexts.filterserverconfirm: Are you sure you want to hide "[server]"? This will prevent servers with this name from showing up on the server list. You can revert this by resetting the hidden servers in the game settings or by editing the file [filepath] in the game folder.
infotexts.filterservertooltip: Prevent servers with this name from showing up on the server list.
infotexts.reportserverdisabled: Sending user statistics is disabled. You need to enable it in the game settings to report servers.
infotexts.reportserverexplanation: If you would like to report the server "[server]," please choose a reason below. You can also hide the server in your own server list by choosing "report and hide server."
infotexts.clearserverlistfiltersconfirmation: Are you sure you want to unhide all servers? This will make all the servers you've previously hidden visible again.
